loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: El Sr. Fermín O. tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado hace 10 años, tiene 2 hijos pequeños que van a la escuela del pueblo, su pequeños ingresos están referidos a la producción de palmito, producto que  por su inestabilidad de precios hizo que, produjera un desequilibrio financiero en su hogar, en tal sentido la razón del crédito, tiene como objetivo la limpieza del terreno, para ya comenzar a cosechar y comercializar los tallos, ahora que los precios de mercado del producto están en alza, y de esta forma equilibrar nuevamente su pequeña economía hasta la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Mr. Fermín O. is 42 years old and has been married for 10 years. He has two young children who attend the local school. His humble income is from cultivating palm hearts. The variations in the price of this product have created an uncertain financial situation in his home. His goal for the loan is to clean his land to begin to harvest and sell the stalks, since they currently have a high market vaule. This will allow him to balance his budget until the next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Barkawu

texts.en:
Monsieur Barkawu K. is 28 years old. At the moment he is unmarried and has no children. His store, Essofa, has been open since 2008.

This is Mr. K.'s first loan with WAGES. He plans to use his 500,000 CFA loan to purchase various products for his store.

loans.use: To purchase various products for his store

loans.name: Mrs. Ly Pa Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ly P. has been selected by eight people as a group leader. The group is located in Chres village in Prey Veng province. All the members in this group will use a portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Ly P. is 54 years old. She and her husband, Mr. S. Leang, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to sell in order to support their family. Now they have some problems because the soil in their field is infertile, and it is far away from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mrs. Ly P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She is the mother of one child who is helping her with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Virginia Marilyn

texts.en:
Virginia Marilyn G. is from the village of Daanglungsod, Katipunan. She is 56 years old. Virginia Marilyn is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Virginia Marilyn owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virginia Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Virginia Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & to provide working capital. Virginia Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory for her sari-sari (variety) store. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Virginia Marilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy S. is from the village of Landing, Baliangao. She is 38 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Precy owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling assorted household items in the local community. Precy has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2005, Precy joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Precy is requesting a new loan of 15,500 PHP which will be used to purchase a home appliance. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Precy from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a home appliance.

loans.name: Bukiro Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
M. Hellen, aged 61, is a hardworking and die-hard agriculturalist who has been maintaining a banana, cattle and coffee plantation for more than 41 years in her home area of Kabukokyero. This fetches her 400,000 UGX per month from milk and banana sales though not enough to sustain her family of 11 children as some are still students at higher institutions of learning.
Hellen has persevered to keep her business enterprise growing. Her aim in taking up this loan is to buy mulches and fertilizer for her plantation and employ additional laborers as she plans to expand and transport her products to bigger markets. This will help her increase productivity, earn more revenue, and live a more sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, mulches and labor for her plantation

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta en primer grado y el otro es bebe, Marleny junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de sombreros, brindan este servicio a diferentes tiendas de sombreros, actividad que realiza con ayuda de trabajadores dependiendo de la demanda del producto, también Marleny lleva los sombreros a las ferias para incrementar sus ventas.
Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad y solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de materia prima.
Marleny sueña con tener una tienda de sombreros y tener casa propia pues vive en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Marleny lives together with her husband and 2 children. One of them is in first grade and the other one is a baby. Marleny, together with her husband, makes sombreros. They sell their product to different stores. She has some hired help to carry out the manufacturing depending on the demand. Marleny also sells the sombreros at different fairs to supplement her sales. Marleny is a member of the community bank named Dignity. She requests a loan in the amount of 1000 soles to purchase materials. Marleny dreams of opening her own sombrero store and she dreams of having her own house. Currently they live with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make sombreros.

loans.name: Prutus

texts.en:
Prutus has been practicing mixed farming for twenty years in the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. His main products are maize, vegetables, tomatoes, beans and honey which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from his carpentry services and masonry services.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is planning to buy an incalf cow since he will be able to earn income from the sale of milk and this will assist him in paying school fees for his children.

Protus is 45 years old. He is a married father of 8 children who are now between the ages of 4 and 22. Seven of the children are attending school.

His biggest challenge has been fluctuation in market prices and diseases that may cause losses. He, however, hopes to acquire at least 3 or 4 dairy cows that will enable him increase his productivity and income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Neyer

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Neyer;  tiene 37 años de edad, el socio es casado y tiene trabajando 8 años como administrador en el terminal de una empresa de transportes llamada Civa, el socio tiene 3 hijos y solicita el préstamo para la educación de sus menores hijos y algunos otros gastos en el hogar. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus menores hijos.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “KAROLL WOKTILA”. THis bank is located in the Huanchac district, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco. The member, Neyer, is 37 years old. He is married and has been working for 8 years as a manager in the terminal of a transportation business called Civa. He has 3 children and is asking for the loan for his youngest childrens' education as well as for some other household expenses. He is asking for the loan to invest in his youngest children's education. This member is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments according to the agreed schedule. .

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his children's education

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru: Каримова Махина проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 25 лет. Не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее собственный продуктовый магазин. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 3 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Mahina K. lives in the Vakhdat region. She is 25 years old, unmarried and lives with her parents. She has a secondary education. She works in trade at the market. She has her own product store. She has been engaged in this type of activity for three years. The loan brings an opportunity to expand inventory.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
el señor Modesto Q. tiene 66 años de edad es padre de 4 hijos, sus hijos le ayudan a la pesca y colaboran con los gastos de la casa. don Modesto es una persona trabajadora que se esfuerza todo los dias por salir adelante, su trabajo consiste en comprar mariscos como ser pescado blanco, rojo y camarones. Sus ventas las realiza de casa en casa y en el mercado de Nacaome. 
 
Modesto vive en la comunidad de Agua Fria desde hace 18 años en donde a podido hacer su hogar junto a su esposa la señora Teodora Gutierrez.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mariscos y asi tener mejores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Modesto Q. is 66 years old and he is the father of 4 children. His children help him fish and they contribute to the household expenses. Modesto is a hardworking person and he struggles every day to come out ahead. His work consists of purchasing seafood such as fishes and shrimp. He carries out his sales by traveling from door to door, and he also sells in Nacaome market. 

Modesto has lived in the community of Agua Fria for the past 18 years and he has forged a home together with his wife, Teodora Gutierrez. 

The loan will be used to purchase more seafood to improve his earnings. He depends on this income to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna G. is from the town of Banga. She is 26 years old. Erna is married and has two young children aged three and two. To make a living, Erna owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business is planting and harvesting rice for sale. Erna works hard to be able to save for her children's education in the future.

Erna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Erna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. lives in Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has seven children, two of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her niece and her grandchildren).    Edith has a retail shop business.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Edith sells her products in a shop, retail.  Edith has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.  She also generates additional income through roasting maize and cassava for sale.

The main business challenges for Edith include   transportation and seasonality .  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop. Edith lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: buy more  bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 24 years old, married and has a 2-year-old child. She owns a piggery. She started raising pigs for fattening 3 years ago. Ailyn also helps her husband at their farm. She plants and harvests rice crops that they sell to the market. Ailyn works hard to be able to save and build a new house for her family.

Ailyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ailyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds and farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and farm supplies

loans.name: 02.03.07-Bac Son-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Toi N. T. (57) is a 28 year-old woman who lives in the town of Hoang Hoa.  Toi is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.03.07-Bac Son-Hoang Hoa (02.03.07-Bac Son-Hoang Hoa.

Toi is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Toi owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making fish sauce and selling products to tourists and local community members.  Toi has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Toi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Toi is requesting her first loan, for 3,079,800 VND, from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Toi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. T. Hoan (58) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


2.  N. T. Lan (59) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  C. T. Nguyet (60) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


4.  N. T. Tam (61) is a 21 year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  D. T. Ha (062) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Toi N. T. (57) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Toi là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.03.07-Bac Son-Hoang Hoa (02.03.07-Bac Son-Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các sản phẩm gia dụng cá nhân cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Toi thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Toi kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Toi đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Toi đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. T. Hoan (58) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  N. T. Lan (59) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  C. T. Nguyet (60) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4.  N. T. Tam (61) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


5.  D. T. Ha (062) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Alfredo se dedica a la venta y comercialización de CD´s y DVD´s desde hace ya bastantes años y es de esta forma que él ha logrado subsistir y progresar durante los 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Don Alfredo es nacido en la ciudad de La Paz y actualmente vive de forma independiente, es decir es soltero. Don Alfredo trabaja con la institución desde el 2007 y es el cliente más antiguo o uno de los más antiguos de la institución, razón por la cual no se le negó dicho crédito, además de aquello a tenido un comportamiento crediticio ejemplar y incluso cuenta con su propia cuenta de ahorro en la institución, el dinero del crédito es para comprar un lote de películas y videos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado durante todo este tiempo.
texts.en:
Sr. Alfredo has been buying and selling CDs and DVDs for several years as means of surviving and progressing. He has been in this business for ten years. Don Alfredo was born in the city of La Paz and now lives independently. He is single.

Don Alfredo has worked with Emprender since 2007. He is a long-time client and one of the oldest of Emprender. For this reason, he has never been denied a loan. In addition, he has an exemplary credit history and has built up his own savings. The money from this loan will be used to buy movies and videos. He is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided throughout this entire time.

loans.use: Purchase movies and music videos

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more beans, seasoning, rice, oil, pepper, tomato etc

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a married woman living in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and ambulant tobacco vending. Her husband, Romeo T., is 74 years old. They have five children who are between 31 and 44 years old. 

Eleonor joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eleonor has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save for the future needs of her family. Eleonor is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim has a little business selling detergent goods and perfumes at the central market in Isfara, Tajikistan. An experienced entrepreneur, he has been selling for 10 years and has been successful offering good quality products for low prices. Abdurahim supports his family of five with his venture. He has requested a loan of 13,000 somoni so that he can purchase new inventory to stock his kiosks. This is Abdurahim's first loan with IMON International. The loan will greatly improve Abdurahim’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods, increasing the assortment of goods for sale

loans.name: Hilda Yrene

texts.es:
La Sra. Hilda es comerciante hace más de 2 años, tiene su despensa bien surtida  en el barrio San Pablo de Coronel Oviedo. Ella tiene pareja desde hace más de 6 años con el Sr. Albino, tienen tres hijos juntos, ella también comenta que la mejor manera de salir adelante es respetarse y ayudarse mutuamente en la familia, ellos se levantan a las 4 de la mañana todos los días para empezar a trabajar.
La Sra. agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza puesta en su persona y el apoyo crediticio que le está brindando y  asegura que invertirá bien su préstamo para poder devolverlo en tiempo y forma, para poder seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda has been a storekeeper for over 2 years. Her well-stocked shop is in the San Pablo neighborhood of Coronel Oviedo. She has been together for over 6 years with Mr. Albino. They have three children together. Mrs. Hilda also remarks that the best way to get ahead is to respect one another and mutually help one another within the family. The couple wakes up at 4 in the morning each day to begin work.
Mrs. Hilda thanks Fundación Paraguaya for its trust in her and for the support it offers her in loans. She assures that she will invest her loan well in order to repay it in due time and course, so that she may continue to work with the institution.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, fruits, snacks, vegetables, baked goods, legumes, etc.

loans.name: Lilia Amparo

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura, al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Lilia, tiene 55 años de edad es madre soltera de una hija que en la actualidad es mayor de edad, está casada y vive en su casa junto  a su esposo y tres nietos de nuestra amiga.

Se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon y Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja dos días en las entregas y cobros de sus productos ya que deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Nos cuenta que lleva en esta actividad ya por cinco años y que le va bien. También se dedica ayudar a niños en tareas dirigidas.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  5 ciclos y le gusta porque con estos créditos ella financia su negocio, además por la responsabilidad de las socias. Su sueño es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the Mejía community bank meet in Mejía which is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo.  Most people in this city work in agriculture, growing and selling coconuts.

Here we meet 55 year-old Lilia who is a single mother with one grown-up daughter.  Her daughter is married and lives in her home together with her husband and three of Lilia's grandchildren.

Lilia sells Avon and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) through catalogs.  She works two days a week delivering her products and collecting payment since she leaves her goods on credit and collects payment for them every week.  She tells us that she has been in this business for five years and that it is going well.  She also helps children with directed tasks.

Lilia will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and other products.  She has been a member of her community bank for 5 loan cycles and she likes it because these loans help her fund her business.  She also likes the responsibility of the other group members.  Her dream is to own a store.

loans.use: To buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
Elbrus A. is a responsible father of  four children. From the time he was young, Elbrus learned the honorable work of raising livestock from his parents, work which today brings him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. Elbrus has six years of experience in sheep breeding. 

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Elbrus hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his livestock will bring better prices. For this reason, he is requesting the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Melinda has been in this business for six years. Melinda earns more income with a sari-sari store.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving for her children's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna J. is 30 years old, married and the mother of three children. She owns a beauty salon in Changamwe, Mombasa, that has been in operation for 10 years. 

This is Anna’s second financing from KADET Ltd., and she plans to purchase more beauty products and detergents for her salon. 

Anna hopes to expand her business with the anticipated profits from the loan. In the future, she hopes to open more salon outlets in Mombasa.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products and detergents

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme, composé de  mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 25 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de tubercules et font la tresse.                                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des tubercules et des petits matériels  pour la tresse.                                                                        
La cliente NANA D., qui se trouve être la présidente du groupe, compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs de Falako et souvent à Fana, pour les revendre au niveau du village au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme group, either married or widowed, are on average 25 years old with 3 children, living in traditional extended families in the village of Nalla, sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They met through connections with friends, family and neighbors. 

The women trade in condiments and root vegetables and  they also braid hair. They are on their first group loan, which will be used to buy condiments, root vegetables and small accessories for braids. Nana D., the group's president, plans to buy condiments from sellers in Falako as well as in Fana, to re-sell in her village, for cash and on credit, to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs which will be used to repay loan installments, pay contributions towards social ceremonies and the rest will be re-invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, es originaria del departamento de León , esta casada , es madre de 4 hijos , ella es dueña de un negocio de un auto lavado, lleva 8 años en este negocio. Inicio en esta actividad por sugerencia de uno de sus hijos ya el trabajo en Costa Rica en un negocio de auto lavados y vio que era rentable para ponerlo en casa , la necesidad económica y las pocas oportunidades de trabajo llevo a doña Juana a decidirse a poner este negocio con el apoyo de sus hijos que trabajan en Costa Rica y los ingresos de su esposo en conjunto lograron iniciar este negocio. Anteriormente doña Juana se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, zapatos y otros accesorios  estos productos los compraba en Honduras, su segundo negocio fue una comideria, la cual no continúo por problemas de salud. Su otra fue de ingresos es el salario de su esposo quien trabaja como albañil.  
Ella solicito préstamo para comprar material de construcción como cemento, zinc, perlin, otros materiales que le permitan reparar y mejorar su negocio. Con este crédito espera mejorar las condiciones del local, atención al cliente  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Tiene entre sus planes instalar un televisor para entretenimiento del cliente mientas le lavan el vehículo, también colocar un exhibidor de bebidas así ofrecer un mejor servicio. Su meta próxima es comprar un taxi  ,para ponerlo a trabajar ,tener otra fuente de ingresos ,mejorar la condiciones económicas de su familia .
texts.en:
Juana lives in the department of León. She is married and the mother of four children. She has owned a car wash business for the past eight years. She started this activity because a child of hers, who lived in Costa Rica and worked there in a car wash business, saw that it was a profitable activity to have at home and suggested it to her. Due to economic hardship and scarce job opportunities, Juana decided to launch this business with the help of her children who worked in Costa Rica. Her husband invested some money from his salary in the business.

Previously, Juana had a general store, where she sold clothes, shoes and other accessories which she imported from Honduras. Her second business was a snack bar, which she could not keep due to health issues. The other family income was the salary of her husband who is a bricklayer.

Juana applies for this loan to buy construction materials, such as cement, zinc sheets, purlins etc., to renovate and improve her premises. Thanks to this loan, she hopes to offer better service to her customers and improve the quality of life of her family.

She has a few plans to improve client service: a TV to keep her customers entertained while they wait to have their car washed, and a showcase for drinks. Her next goal is to buy a taxi and thus get another source of income to improve the economic situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, zinc sheets, purlins etc., to repair and improve her car wash business.

loans.name: Jack Herless

texts.es:
Jack tiene de   26 años de edad, el es  soltero sin carga familiar,  vive  en casa de sus  padres, la cual esta ubicada en el en un sector llamado las Dunas, en el departamento, de Lambayeque,    la cual cuenta  con todos los servicios básicos (energía eléctrica y agua).

Jack cuenta con una mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas) que es de su propiedad, con la cual brinda servicio de transporte publico de pasajeros, en el centro de Chiclayo, Jack ha adquirido experiencia en este rubro y  además labora como estibador en el mercado  Lo Patos, el es bastante conocido en el sector donde vive.

Jack está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para realizar mejoras en su vivienda,  el desea cambiar la puerta de su casa,   lo que le permitirá contar con mayor seguridad y comodidad.

El tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos, lo consideran una persona bastante tranquila, trabajadora y responsable.

.
texts.en:
Jack tiene de   26 años de edad, el es  soltero sin carga familiar,  vive  en casa de sus  padres, la cual esta ubicada en el en un sector llamado las Dunas, en el departamento, de Lambayeque,    la cual cuenta  con todos los servicios básicos (energía eléctrica y agua).

Jack cuenta con una mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas) que es de su propiedad, con la cual brinda servicio de transporte publico de pasajeros, en el centro de Chiclayo, Jack ha adquirido experiencia en este rubro y  además labora como estibador en el mercado  Lo Patos, el es bastante conocido en el sector donde vive.

Jack está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para realizar mejoras en su vivienda,  el desea cambiar la puerta de su casa,   lo que le permitirá contar con mayor seguridad y comodidad.

El tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos, lo consideran una persona bastante tranquila, trabajadora y responsable.

.

loans.use: Realizar mejoras en su hogar.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Teresita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa sells different types of things such as rice, used shoes, eggs, beans, ice blocks and other things at Elmina, which she has done for 7 years. She wants to add the sale of provisions to what she already sells. A loan would be used to buy the above mentioned items and provisions to sell. Adjoa uses her income to support her husband and to provide the basic needs of her family.With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.en:
Mayra is 32 years old and lives near the city of Latacunga, Ecuador. She is single and lives with her three children age 13, 8 and 2. She is a cheerful person who works hard to support her children and move forward. 

She sells a local specialty food known as “cuero,” which is made from the skin of pork. The dish is fried in its own fat until it is crispy and is often served with beans and potatoes. 

Mayra began her business several years ago with the hopes that, through her own business, she could give her children an education and support them as a single mother. She is seeking this loan to invest in her business and be able to make more cuero to sell. 

Mayra hopes this loan will help her change her life as it will help her invest in her work and help her give a better life to her children. Mayra’s dream is to have a larger business in the future.

loans.use: to invest in her food production business by buying more supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past two years, he has operated a restaurant business, selling at retail to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other restaurant operators. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) he wants to purchase tables and chairs for his restaurant. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs for his restaurant.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen, vive con su esposo y una hija, es propietaria D. un salón D. belleza, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia gracias a su madre quien le enseño el oficio, trabaja a tiempo completo durante todos los días.
Ella, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. vitrinas y cosméticos (maquillajes, tintes para el cabello, labiales) para mejorar su negocio y darles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Su objetivo es tener su negocio más fortalecido para mejorar los ingresos y terminar la construccion D. su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen lives with her husband and one daughter.  She is the owner of a beauty salon.  This business came of her own initiative, thanks to her mother who taught her the profession.  She works full-time every day.

She is asking for a loan to purchase glass showcases and cosmetics (makeup, hair dyes, lipsticks) in order to improve her business and to take better care of her customers.

Her goal is to have a stronger business to improve her income and to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: To purchase glass showcases and cosmetics (makeup, hair dyes)

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en:
Sainbayar is 51 years old and lives with her son and husband in a house in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband is in disability pension and stays at home. Her son is an assistant to chief at the CIS Mongolia LLC. His monthly income is 293,558 MNT. 

Sainbayar started her business in 1995 by selling meat at the Huchit Shonhor market. From 2010, she has been continuing her business at the Narantuul-2 market. She has collected much business experience and made a constant client base. Her business turnover volume is 1,000,000 MNT and her daily income is about 150,000 MNT. 

She purchases meat from countryside herders at 5:00 AM in the morning and makes the by-products and sells the products to retailers. By 13:00 she finishes selling the by-products. Her family supports the business activity very much. She is planning to expand her business activity.

She is a hard-working and diligent woman who says "I want to buy a used small truck to transport products. I am spending sufficient amount of money on taxi expense. It would be nice to have a car, pay the loan interest and own the car." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car for her business to transport the meat.

loans.use: To purchase a new car to transport meat.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya.  He is 24 years old and married with a two-year-old child. He has been in the poultry farming business for four years, and he sells his eggs and birds to the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business.

James has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry to boost his business.  He says that the improved income from farming will enable him to improve his family's living standards and pay for his children's education in better schools.

He adds that a shortage of poultry feed is a challenge, but he is glad to have Juhudi's loan services.

loans.use: To purchase poultry to boost his business.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 23 years old and single. He supports his aging parents. He is a milk seller in Kapsabet. He has been in this business for the past two years. His monthly income is 4,400 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This is his first loan and he desires to use the amount to pay milk suppliers. The profits will be used to repay the loan as well as his parent's upkeep. He hopes to expand his business and pursue a teaching career.

loans.use: to pay milk suppliers.

loans.name: Wilson Fernando

texts.es:
Wilson Fernando tiene 26 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive en el Cnatón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.
La VRC Unión y Progreso la Colombia baja, está conformada por quince integrantes y está ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa esta ventanilla se dedica a Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, Soya plátano, naranja, etc.
Wilson se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de cacao arroz, maíz, soya, naranja, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos agrícolas para  mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.  
 Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. 
El  sueño es comprarse una casa donde pueda vivir y no preocuparse del  arriendo.
En los tiempos libres le gusta a pasear con los amigos y disfrutar de las fiestas de Cantón.
texts.en:
26-year old Wilson Fernando is single and has no children. He lives in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

There are fifteen members in his Community Bank which is called the Unión y Progreso la Colombia Baja and is located 90 minutes from the cooperative. The branch deals mainly with agricultural loans for such items as cocoa seedlings, rice, maize, soya, bananas, oranges etc.

Wilson earns his living from the land. He grows cocoa, rice, maize, soya, and oranges which he buys and sells in San José del Tambo each weekend. He is seeking a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and other supplies to keep his fields healthy. With the support he receives from this loan, he will be able to buy basic necessities.

The main difficulties Wilson faces are insect infestations and diseases, and the changing climate.

His dream is to buy a house of his own and not be worried about renting anywhere. In his free time he likes going out with his friends and enjoying the local fiestas.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and other supplies

loans.name: Asel's Group

texts.en: Five years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Asel started to sell grocery goods. Asel is 37 and married to a construction worker. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two sons and a daughter who are studying at school. She earns about 4,000 soms per month. Her profit made it possible to increase commodity turnover and to purchase a fridge to improve their living conditions. With money from this loan, Asel wants to purchase 100 kg of sugar, oil and detergents. In the future she wishes to expand the store. Asel is the treasurer of this group. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kg of sugar, oil and detergents

loans.name: Gladys Piedad

texts.es:
Gladys de 61 años, una mujer trabajadora que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de negocio.
Su negocio es una tienda que está ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda en la cual vende todo tipo de vivieres como: bebidas, arroz, aceites azúcar, etc.
Es soltera, tiene un hijo de 16 años, el la ayuda en la tienda después que retorne de su colegio 
El horario de ella es de lunes a domingo, desde las 8:00am hasta las 20:00pm.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y para la compra de mercadería como: bebidas,  arroz, aceites azúcar, etc.
 Su sueño es que su negocio incremente e aumente en las ganancias, ella quisiera abrir un nuevo local en otro sector de la urbe.
texts.en:
Gladys, 61, is a hard-working lady who aspires to growing her business.  She has a grocery store set up in the front part of her house where she sells beverages, rice, oil, sugar, etc.

She is single and has a 16-year-old son who helps her in the store when he gets home from school.  Her opening hours are Monday through Sunday, from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  She is requesting a loan to invest in the business by purchasing goods such as softdrinks, rice, oil, sugar, etc.

Her dream is to grow the business and increase earnings.  She would like to open a new store in another area of town.

loans.use: To buy softdrinks, rice, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Findencio

texts.es: Fidencio tiene 45 años, es un hombre emprendedor y alegre. Vive en compaña de su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Fidencio es la crianza de ganado vacuno, cuyos animales los adquiere desde terneros y los vende cuando ya llegaron a su desarrollo completo. Del mismo modo, sucede con las crías que sus vacas paren. Èl cuenta con un terrero en donde tienen a todas sus cabezas de ganado muy bien acondicionadas y cuidadas, conociendo muy bien todo lo necesario para esta actividad,gracias a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron éste oficio. Tiene cuarenta años realizando esta actividad, pues desde que era muy pequeño aprendio ayudando a sus padres en el campo. Ahora  cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, pero para trabajos forzosos necesita la ayuda de 20 peones que contrata. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le genera ingresos económicos con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, teniendo muchas ganas de seguir creciendo. Este sería el crédito número cuatro con la instituían MFP, se siente cómodo con su grupo del banco comunal ya que los considera personas responsables y buenas. Con el préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará vacunas para el ganado, y alambres para el mantenimiento del cerco de su terreno.
texts.en:
Fidencio, 45, is an enterprising, cheerful man.  He lives with his wife and four children in his own house.  Fidencio raises cattle.  He buys the animals when they are still calves and sells them when they’ve matured completely.  This is also what happens when cows he owns give birth.  

He has a piece of land where he keeps his entire herd of cattle in good surroundings and well cared for.  He knows everything necessary for this type of work having learned helping his parents in the fields.  Now, his children help him but for heavy work he needs to hire twenty day laborers.  What he likes about his work is that it generates income to cover his household expenses.  He very much wants to continue growing.

This will be loan #4 with MFP.  He feels comfortable in his communal bank group because he considers them to be responsible, good people.  He will use the 1500 new sol loan to buy cattle vaccines and wire for fence maintenance.

loans.use: to buy vaccines for his cattle and wire to renovate his fence.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y muy alegre, le gustan el negocio y es  muy dedicada, está conviviendo con Richard, fruto de esta unión tiene 3 hermosos hijos de 14, 14  y 12 años; además de tener la compañía de su suegra quien los acompaña desde hace 6 meses atrás, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Isabel es la venta de ropa de primera calidad tanto para damas, caballero y niños, para lo cual realiza viajes periódicos a la ciudad de Lima, realizando sus compras en el emporio comercialde dicha ciudad, de donde trae lo último en moda. Sus ventas los realiza a crédito dejando 15 días  a amigos, familiares y recomendados. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, iniciándose con un capital que le brindó su pareja. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera, comenta que ahorrando las ganancias de su actividad, logró realizar los acabados de su casa, y apoya con los gastos del hogar  a su pareja, sabiendo que apoyándose mutuamente lograrán progresar. Lo que no le gusta de su actividad es que algunos de sus clientes se atrasan con los pagos de sus créditos, pero ésto no la desanima y sigues buscando nuevos clientes, además de tener planes de abrir  un local propio en su casa, donde pueda exhibir y poner la venta de más ropa. Este será el préstamo numero 2 con a institución MFP, agradece la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero para seguir avanzando con su negocio. Se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de más ropas de variados modelos en mayor cantidad  y a menor precio.
texts.en: Isabel is 35 years old and is a hard-working and happy woman who enjoys and is very dedicated to her job. She is married to Richard, with whom she has three children, ages 14, 14 and 12. Her mother-in-law has also lived with them for the past six month in a house they own. Isabel makes a living selling high-quality clothing for men, women and children, goods she acquires periodically on trips to the city of Lima, making her purchases at a commercial emporium in the city that features that latest fashions. She sells on bimonthly credit to friends, relatives and recommended customers. She has been dedicated to this activity for the past four years, starting out with funds her husband provided her. What she enjoys most about her work is the income she generates. She says that with money she saved from her job they were able to finish construction on their house and she has supported her husband with household expenses, knowing they will make progress together. What she doesn't like about her job is that some of her customers are late with their payments, but this does not discourage her and she is always on the lookout for new customers. Furthermore, she has plans to open up a store in her home where she can exhibit and put more clothing up for sale. This will be her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is grateful for the financial support so she can keep advancing with her business. She promises to make her payments on time. She is requesting the loan to purchase more clothing in various styles and in larger quantities at better prices.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en: Nona is 57 years old and single. She lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. To earn a living, Nona operates a general store. She has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 6,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional stock for her general store. Nona has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 4 years. In the future, Nona hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de ser sociable y de trato amable, es conviviente con Jenix quien es palmicultor, vive en compañía de su pareja ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes pero siempre la visitan constantemente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Florinda es la venta de comidas tanto desayuno como menús, para eso cuenta con un restaurante ubicado en el mercado Nro 02 de la ciudad de Pucallpa, iniciándose hace 30 años con un capital propio, primero con un puesto de venta en dicho mercado para luego a base de esfuerzo y trabajo logró hacerse de un local donde abrió su restaurante al que le puso el nombre de “Florita”, contando con el apoyo de 2 ayudantes para la atención al público a las que paga por semana trabajada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder tener una actividad a la que puede dedicarse y mantenerse ocupada,  además del ingreso económico que le genera para pagar sus gastos de su hogar. Por lo contrario, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es que sus ayudantes se cansan del trabajo y se retiran bastante rápido, espera poder contar con ayudantes estables. Además tiene planes de mejorar el ambiente de su local para una mejor atención de los clientes. Este seta el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además dice sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de pinturas para el pintado de las paredes, así como nuevas sillas. Además con el saldo comprará los ingredientes para la preparación de menús.
texts.en:
Florinda, age 52, is an enterprising and hard-working woman.  She is also friendly and treats people kindly.  She lives with Jenix, who is a palm grower.  She only lives with her life partner as her children are grown and live independently.  However, they always visit her at her house.

Florinda’s business is selling food; she sells as many breakfasts as her set menu items.  She has a restaurant in the number 2 market in the city of Pucallpa.  She started 30 years ago with her own capital.  First she had a stall at the market.  Then, with her effort and work, she managed to establish a place where she opened her restaurant.  She named it “Florita”.  She has two helpers to wait on the customers.  She pays them at the weekly rate.

What she likes about her business activity is being able to have a business that she can devote herself to and that keeps her busy.  She also likes the income that it generates to pay her household expenses.  On the other hand, what she does not like about her business activity is that the helpers get tired of working, and they take off pretty quickly.  She hopes to be able to count on stable helpers.  She also has plans to improve the ambience of her place in order to provide the customers with better service.

This will be her sixth loan with the MFP institution.  Therefore she hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She also says that she feels good with her communal bank as she considers the members to be good people.

She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy paint to paint the walls and to buy new chairs.  She will use the balance to buy ingredients to prepare her set menus.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and paint.

loans.name: Yeimy

texts.es: Yeimy de 19 años es una joven muy emprendedora,  que tiene un hijo en la edad de 1 año,  con el que sueña ver crecer lleno de bienestar y con las mejores condiciones de vida, que ella en  su inagotable esfuerzo,  pueda ofrecerle. En su condición de mujer cabeza de familia, Yeimy  genera ingresos mediante una actividad comercial, a través de la cual vende mercancías cosméticas, accesorios,  ropa etc, mediante guías especializadas de productos. Ella siempre tiene a la mano el catalogo, pues está dispuesta a conseguir un cliente en cada persona con la que habla o a la que conoce; con su negocio ha logrado salir adelante y su motivación por surgir es inmensa, pues el futuro de su hijo está en sus manos, él es el gran motor de su impulso comercial y la resolución de sus necesidades  no dan espera. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el l comprará productos que en este mes de Diciembre han llegado en su catalogo, con unos importantes descuentos,   impactando a sus clientes, como perfumes, champos, colonias, desodorantes, labiales, bases y otros productos capilares.  A sus clientes desea complacer y lograr con ello, su meta de  venderles y de ganar un poco mas de dinero, para continuar capitalizándose. Yeimi es una mujer progresista que está estudiando una carrera técnica, con la que planea grandes éxitos,  para si misma que irradien a su hijo.  Su desafío más grande es el poco capital con el que cuenta,  para continuar el crecimiento empresarial  soñado, por eso se esmera en lograr que sus productos, roten cada vez más rápido y sus cuentas por cobrar también. En la actualidad obtiene una rentabilidad no menor del 40%,  importante para el buen desempeño de este tipo de negocios, que muestra un potencial crecimiento  con el capital de trabajo nuevo,  producto del apoyo de su credikiva actual y que en el  futuro también planea obtener.
texts.en:
Yeimy, 19, is a young entrepreneur who has a 1-year-old son.  She dreams with seeing him grow up filled with wellbeing and with the best possible living conditions that she can offer through her untiring effort.

In her condition as a female head of household, Yeimy earns income through a commercial activity through which she sells cosmetics, accessories, clothing, etc. via specialized catalogues.  She always has a catalogue at hand because she’s willing to win over a customers from every person she meets or talks to.  With her business she’s managed to get ahead and her motivation to surge forward is immense because her son’s future is in her hands.  He is the great motivator of her commercial impulse and meeting his needs can’t wait.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan which is also her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy products like perfume, shampoo, cologne, deodorant, lipstick, foundation and other hair products that are in the December catalogue and have important discounts that impact her customers.  She wants to please her customers this way.

Yeimy is a progressive woman who is studying a technical career that she plans great successes for herself that will reflect on her son.  Her greatest challenge is the little capital she has to continue with her dreamed for business growth.  This is why she strives to sell her products quickly so that they turnover more quickly each time as well as her accounts receivable.  She currently has a profit margin of no less than 40% which is important for this type of business’ development which shows a potential for growth with new working capital from her current Kiva loan and the ones she plans to get in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs Sem is 49 years old and a single mother of five children, residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province.  Three of her children are now working in various positions and help by contributing their income to the whole family.  Sem generates her income by cultivating rice crops on the existing farmland and takes time to manages all things at home to ensure a better living for her children.

At present, she has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to build a toilet made of bricks to keep her family in healthy living conditions.  For her future, she wishes to continue supporting her two school-age children until they finish grade twelve.

loans.use: to build a toilet made of bricks.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Sophy, 27, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are fish vendors. There is only one source of income to support the family. Therefore, Sophy would like to ask for a loan of USD 700 to purchase a piece of farming land to grow agricultural crops to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a new business of selling groceries, renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farming land to grow agricultural crops.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana es una microempresaria exitosa de 38 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de  17 años. Su negocio es una pulpería la cual administra desde hace 15 años, con el apoyo de su hijo quien le ayuda a despachar a los clientes. Solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento a los socios de kiva porque desea invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosa y aceite. Una de sus metas es hacer progresas su negocio.

loans.use: para la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosa y aceite.

loans.name: Leyda

texts.en:
Leyda has a small beauty shop where she cuts men and women’s hair. She started out in this line of work by offering her services at people’s homes, but now she has set up a part of her own house to work from. She has just started selling jewelry and other accessories to her clients as a part of her business. Leyda wants to continue investing in items to sell as complimentary goods from her business. She has noticed that by having people come in for haircuts she can also market these other goods. She and her husband have three kids. She is very optimistic about receiving the loan for her business and the good of her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in complimentary products to sell from her beauty shop

loans.name: Aroldo

texts.en:
Aroldo was born and raised in Baba, and has been farming rice his entire life. He lives with one of his daughters and her family. He works the land with the help of his sons who share in profits from the production. He has been living on the land for more than 60 years. He hopes that he will be able to buy fertilizer and seeds with the loan. He also wants to rent a tractor to work the land so it will be more productive.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Farm Rice

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en: R. Khanlar is 27 and married with 2 children. He runs a small cattle business consisting of 1 cow. He likes his job and plans to broaden it by buying another cow and a calf in the future. To approach this goal, he applied for a loan of 1200USD.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Elminaz

texts.en: Elminaz A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the southwest Azerbaijan. She is a Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region. Elminaz is married and she has 5 children and 4 grandchildren. She sells fruits and vegetables in the Beylagan city bazaar, where she rented a small booth. She established her business 14 years ago. Her son helps her to sell fruits and vegetables. Elminaz needs $600 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz is 50 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in the villlage of Ashagi-Zeyid in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. He has been in the farming business for 6 years, raising peach trees. Ramiz is requesting a loan of  $825 to buy pesticides for his trees.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Laloanea

texts.en: Laloanea is a mother of 35 years of age and married with one child. Her talent of making Elei prints has allowed her to earn money for her family’s needs. She is now apply for her second loan to buy specialized equipment for her business. She delivers her products to various shops at the flea market at Savalalo and Fugalei 4 times a week. She makes 400 Tala ($160 US) a week ,and after all expenses she is left with a profit of 180 Tala ($72 US).

loans.use: To buy materials such as paint, screens, and brushes for her Elei (a traditional Samoan craft) printing business

loans.name: Yao Jules

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao Jules A. was born in 1970; today he is married and the father of 4 children. He works several small jobs but his sales of fuel is his most important one. Today, faced with ever growing demand, he would like to satisfy his customers' requests and so, is applying for a loan of $250. The earnings he makes will allow him to support the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur A. Yao Jules est né en 1970, marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Il exerce de petites activités mais la vente de carburant reste son activité dominante. Aujourd’hui face à une demande toujours croissante, il veut saisir cette occasion pour solliciter ce crédit de $250 afin d’être en mesure de satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of fuel.

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat S. is a married woman and has 7 children; she is 50 years old. She hails from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells fish and charcoal and has been in business since 1980. She hopes to get the loan of $450 to buy more fish and charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Muguluka West E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Kate L.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Kate is 20 years old and is single. She has 1 child aged 2. Each week, Kate makes approximately UGX 8000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to improve business and educate her children. Kate has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Kate is joined in her small group by Halima M., Janat K. and Madinah M.. Halima M. has a business selling sugar wax and wants to increase working capital. Janat K. is currently operating a business selling chapatis and wants a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, cooking oil and onions. Madinah M. operates a business selling sugar wax and wants to add to her sugar wax business.

loans.use: To increase the stock of clothes sold

loans.name: Tesalia

texts.es:
Mrs. Tesalia T. S., founder of the Hidden Treasure Community Bank, lives in the San Martin region, section Mariscal Caceres. Her sales booth is located in front of the Pomarrosas market in the city of Juanjui. She is dedicated to the purchase and sale of hens. She began selling hens when she was motivated by her husband who was the one that would purchase the hens that were brought from the town of Chacras. It is then that she saw that it was a beneficial business and thus they decided to begin their sales booth. With her loan of $725, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy hens in an average of 10 to 50 every day. She will also invest in the purchase of feed and the fabrication of cages for their exhibition and sale. Tesalia is 33 years of age and together with her husband, she has two young children. She has many expectations and dreams for her life. Among them is to own her own home and there be able to start a small grocery store in order to secure the future of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise

La señora Tesalia T. S. fundadora del Banco Comunal Tesoro Escondido, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , distrito de Juanjui, su puesto de venta está ubicado, frente al mercado Pomarrosas de la ciudad de Juanjui, se dedica a la compra/ venta de gallinas. Se inicio en la venta de gallinas al por menor motivada por su esposo quien era el que compraba las gallinas que traían de las Chacras y vio que el negocio era rentable es así que deciden tener un puesto fijo de venta. Con el crédito de S/.2,000.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará gallinas en un promedio de 10 hasta 50 diarias. Así mismo invertirá en la compra de alimento y la fabricación de más javas para su exhibición y venta. La señora Tesalia tiene 33 años, junto a sus su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos,tiene muchas expectativas y sueños como tener sus casa propia y ahí implementar un negocio de venta de abarrotes ,bebidas gasificadas y plásticos que asegure el futuro de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase more hens for subsequent sale.  Con el prestamo comprara mas gallinas para su venta

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
Seema S. is a group leader. She is married and has six kids, all of whom attend a local school. Seema’s husband manufactures thread reels. He has invested a several loans in his business previously, which allowed him to continue sending his kids to school. Now, they require a loan to expand their business further.
