The women in the group all reside in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Seema’s subgroup members are: Yasmeen (who has a grocery store), Asma S. (her husband is a welder) and Rehana B. (who has a thread manufacturing business). Lastly, Safia B. is a widow who has a printing press.

loans.use: to expand the manufacture of thread reels

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim B. is a 60-year-old farmer who has more than 20 years of experience in tending and raising livestock. It is his main source of income. He has four children and  they all live together in a small village in the Saatli region. He needs US$ 1000  to purchase three calves at US$ 300 each and fodder for US$ 100.

loans.use: to purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru:
Kurbongul A. lives in the Vahsh region. She is 29 years old and has a bachelor's degree in accounting. Since her salary is very small, Kurbongul buys and sells dining sets and dishes. She has been in this business for the past 6 years. At this moment, she would like to purchase additional inventory from wholesellers. The more inventory she has, the better are her sales. Since she doesn't have enough funds to realize her plan, Kurbongul decided to take out a loan for 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллоева Курбонгул жительница района Вахш. Возраст 29 лет, образование высшее. По специальности бухгалтер. Так как заработная плата очень маленькая Курбонгул занимается куплей продажей посуды.Имеет опыт в бизнесе более 6 лет. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить посуду у оптовых поставщиков.Если у нее будет большой выбор товара ,торговля будет лучше .Так как своих денежных средств у нее нет ,Курбонул решила взять кредит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
Milka is a member of the "Solidarity" Communal Bank. She resides at Jr: Oscar R Benavides N º234 in the Callería District within the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 39 and widowed, with no children. She lives with her elderly parents, whom she assists.

Milka rents out 2 motorcars that are kept at her own home. She must wake every morning at 5:30am to tend to her chauffeurs and to give them the motorcars. Later, she prepares breakfast for her parents and provides care for her beloved mother, who suffers from arthritis.

With the requested loan of S/. 2,000, which is to be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 1 motorcar and renew her insurance policy and licenses.

Milka is a very giving woman, affectionate and a blessing to her parents. She is trustworthy and receives a strong endorsement in this opportunity offered to her by way of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Milka pertenece al Banco Comunal “Solidaridad”, vive en el Jr: Oscar R Benavides N º234 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años, es viuda y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres ancianos a los cuales para asiste. Decide poner un negocio y para ello solicitó un préstamo de S/. 300.00 al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad cuenta con 2 motokars , los cuales pone en alquiler, el lugar donde guarda es en su propio domicilio. Para lo cual se levanta todos los días a las 5:30am para atender a sus choferes y poder entregarles el motokar. Luego prepara el desayuno para sus padres y atiende en particular a su querida madre que padece de artritis.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará de 1 motokar y renovará el Soat (seguro de accidentes) y su tarjetas de circulación.

Milka es una mujer muy entregada, cariñosa y es una bendición para sus padres, se siente segura y con un buen respaldo por la oportunidad que le esta brindando Manuela Ramos.

loans.use:
Purchase of a motorcar
Compra de 1 motocar

loans.name: Thi Hoan

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Hoan, 39 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007. Her family relies mainly on agriculture and their income falls into the average range. Mrs. Hoan has 4 schooling children. Her first loan of 5,000,000VND (312.50USD) was used to invest in rearing pigs. She always took the time and money to purchase more bran and corn to feed the pigs, so after the first loan she sold the pigs and gained a profit of 8,000,000VND (about 500USD). She continued to use this profit to purchase pigs and pig feeds. Her husband is a construction worker with the monthly income of 2,000,000VND (about 125USD). This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to continue investing in rearing pigs. Her average monthly income is 5,000,000VND (about 312.50USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thi Hoàn 39 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007, hoàn cảnh kinh tế gia đình chị bình thường vợ chồng chị làm nông nghiệp là chủ yếu. Chị có 4 người con đang ăn học, vòng vốn ban đầu chị vay 5.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn trong qúa trình chăn nuôi chị luôn đầu tư thời gian cũng như vốn mua cám, ngô làm thức ăn cho lợn, từ đó việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị luôn đạt kết quả cao, sau một vòng vốn gia đình chị xuất chuồng và lãi được 8.000.000đ. Số lãi thu được chị lại đầu tư mua giống lợn và thức ăn chăn nuôi, Chồng chị là thợ xây nên công việc của anh cũng rất đều đăn thu nhâp bình quân 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Madi

texts.ru: Гафуров Маъди житель района А.Джоми. Возраст 34 года, женат , имеет 3 детей.Образование средние. Клиент более 7 лет занимается  выращиванием овощей. Он имеет небольшой участок земли.Каждый год ,собрав урожай он делает запасы на свою семью,а остальное реализует на местном рынке. Этот вид деятельности помогает ему прокормить свою семью.Так как сельское хозяйство является единственным источником дохода его семьи.В данный момент клиент хочет закупить  качественные семена.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 4 месяцев
texts.en:
Madi G. is a resident of the Jomi district. 34-years-old, he is married and has three children. He attended secondary school, and has raised sheep for more than seven years. He has a small parcel of land. Each year after gathering in the harvest, he keeps a portion for his family and sells the rest at the local market, an endeavor that helps him to feed his family. Agriculture is his family’s sole source of income. Now he wishes to purchase high-quality seed. He plans to repay the loan within four months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of high-quality seed

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia Es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga. Eugenia es madre soltera, tiene 59 años y 1 hijo, Eugenia es jubilada de la universidad, Eugenia tiene un consultorio de parasicología en donde brinda servicios de oraciones, curaciones, lectura de cartas, Eugenia es vidente, su consultorio esta ubicado cerca del centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Eugenia también vende productos naturales por catálogos sus ventas son al contado y en algunas oportunidades al crédito.

Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicinas naturales y reparación de su casa. Los sueños de Eugenia son tener un local propio, curar a las personas necesitadas y tener un molino.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the communal bank “Alegría Huamanga”.

Eugenia is the 59-year old single mother of one son, and retired from the university. Eugenia has a parapsychology office where she provides services such as orations, healing treatments, and card readings. Eugenia is clairvoyant, and her office is located in the center of the city of Ayacucho. Eugenia also sells natural products by catalog. Her sales are in cash and, at times, on credit.

Eugenia needs a loan of 3,000.00 soles to invest into the purchase of natural remedies and home repairs.

Eugenia’s dreams include being able to have her own location, to cure those persons who are ailing, and also to have a mill/grinder.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eugenia needs a loan of 3,000.00 soles to invest in the purchase of natural remedies and for home repairs.

loans.name: Fanny Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Fanny D. tiene la edad de 30 años habita en el sector de la Borgoña ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo eh hijo, el esposos de ella trabaja como técnico y la apoya con los gastos de casa ya que tienen un hijo a su cargo de diez año de edad, el pequeño estudia su primaria. La señora fanny tiene su propio negocio ya que ella vende y compra ropa de primera y segunda .Esta señora trabaja por encargos y a vez sale  vender .La señora empezó su negocio con sus propios esfuerzos y su marido que la apoyo para que ella salga adelante. Esta señora su gran sueño es llegar a tener su propia tienda y administrarla ya que ella acaba de cursar su secundaria y estudiara administración de empresas en la universidad de Managua.
texts.en:
Fanny D. is 30 years old and lives in the area of Borgoña located in the municipality of Ticuantepe along with her spouse and son. Her husband works as a technician and supports her with the household expenses as their son is 10 years old and he is in primary school. Fanny has her own business where she buys and sells new and used clothing. This woman works per orders placed as well as going out and selling. She began her business through her own efforts and her husband supported her so that she could be successful. This woman has a great dream to have her own store and manage it as she finished secondary school and would study business administration in the university of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi: Chị Ngọc năm nay 46 tuổi, Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Trong những năm đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Hiện nay công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.. Với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng  kinh tế gia đình chị Ngọc rất ổn định  và thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả vốn theo quy định. Vòng vố tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Bui is 46 years old. She joined the Fund in 1996. In the first few years she borrowed money to invest in raising livestock. Currently the family's main source of income is a general store. With an income of 4,000,000 VND/month, the family's finances are very stable and well-suited for making the repayments in accordance with the terms and conditions. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in the family's store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her store

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina tiene 52 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijas menores de edad. Se dedica a su tiendita de abarrotes que abrió hace 8 años a base de mucho esfuerzo, ya que en su hogar tuvo que ser padre y madre y afrontar sola las dificultades de la vida, pero gracias a su gran capacidad para los negocios y las ventas tuvo grandes oportunidades que supo aprovechar y así obtuvo la tiendita que tanto quería a la cual se dedica íntegramente, sin descuidarla, estando siempre abierta frente a las demandas de sus vecinos, las cuales hay que aprovechar y brindar una atención de calidad es su prioridad, logrando rentabilidad en su negocio a pesar de los costosos precios de las mercaderías. Agustina está en su tercer préstamo con MFP, y siempre ha sido una clienta muy responsable y entusiasta dentro de su grupo, ya que motivaba a las socias frente a situaciones difíciles. Con el dinero que solicita implementará la mercadería para su tienda y así convertirla en una de las más competitivas dentro de su localidad.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 52-year-old single mother who lives with her two underage daughters. Eight years ago, after much effort, she opened up her own general store because she had to be both the mother and father of the household, facing the difficulties of life on her own. However, thanks to her great business abilities, she was able to take advantage of the opportunities that came her way. Thus, she obtained the general store she had always wanted. She is fully dedicated to her shop; she never neglects it and keeps it open to meet her neighbors’ demands. Customer service is her priority, and she manages to make hers a lucrative business despite the high prices. This is Agustina’s third loan with MFP, and she has always been a very responsible and enthusiastic client in her group since she motivates the other members to face adversity. With the money that she is requesting, she will obtain more goods for her store, thus making it one of the most competitive shops in her locality.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Rómulo

texts.es: Rómulo tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro, se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo por sus hijos, los mismos que estudian y son su razón de seguir adelante. Rómulo es profesor del nivel primario, pero a causa de no encontrar un puesto seguro en alguna institución educativa es que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes y que se sientan seguros mientras los transporta. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que está solicitando mandará a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Rómulo is 40 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in his own house. For the last three years he has earned a living transporting passengers in his three-wheeled motorcar. He works very hard because of his children who are in school and who motivate him to forge ahead economically. Rómulo is a primary school teacher, but because he has not been able to secure a position in an educational institution, he has earned a living transporting passengers. He enjoys that he is able to provide good service to his customers and that they feel safe while he transports them. This is his second loan with MFP. With the funds requested, Rómulo will have his three-wheeled motorcar repaired.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his three-wheeled motorcar.

loans.name: Ghullam Sediq

texts.en: Ghullam Sediq K. is 46 years old, married and the father of five children. He is from the Nangarhar province. He is an uneducated man but he is hard working and full of experience in agriculture.  Sediq has been involved in this  business for more than 20 years but now he wants to enlarge his business. Sediq has requested a loan  for 30000 Afganis to buy more seeds for planting that will allow him to  enlarge his business. He is very happy about this process of small loans  and thanks all lenders, Kiva and AFSG in Jalalabad Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buying some seeds and necessary things for his land

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en: Tumenbayar is 24 years old. He just moved out with his girlfriend from his parents' home, where he used to live with his father, mother, two sisters and a young brother. He now lives in a small rental room with his girlfriend. In 2007, he started a small retail business. With his sister, he went to Ereen, China (a border city) to buy cheap clothes and sold them at profit in his small rented space in the local market.  Since May 2008, he left the retail business to his sister and started a small photo-taking business in a small rented room. He takes photos for passport, IDs, and customized photos for school and college commencements. As the business slows down due to popularity of digital cameras for most families, he expanded his service by adding a computer, where he creates various cards such as invitation cards. He also types various documents in his computer for his customers. In addition, he added a small cellphone-service business, where he uploads songs and videos for cellphones. His business does well during anniversaries and wedding celebrations. He requested a loan to buy a decent-quality camera and printer. His dream is to have his own studio with excellent-quality computer and equipment.

loans.use: To buy a decent-quality camera and printer

loans.name: Faananafu

texts.en: Faananafu I., 32, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the vegetable garden and plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public 4 days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about 120 USD).  SPBD loans are Faananafu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy things needed to upgrade both her vegetable garden and her plantation, such as sacks of fertilizer, chemicals, wheelbarrow, axe, knives, gloves and weed-killer. She wants to buy all these things in order for her business to become more successful.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools needed for her two agricultural businesses.

loans.name: Carla Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Carla V. es una dama que se dedica cien por ciento a su negocio de venta de ropa en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua siendo este el único ingreso que percibe para brindarle las condiciones de vida a su familia compuesta por sus 6 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos están en secundaria.

Espera que su crédito sea otorgado para así adquirir la mercadería de sus proveedores y continuar ofertando la ropa a sus clientes en su establecimiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
Carla V. is a woman who is dedicated 100% to her business selling clothing in the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua. This is the only income that she receives to provide living conditions to her family made up of her six children, five of whom are in secondary school. She hopes that her loan will be granted so that she may acquire merchandise from her suppliers and continue to offer clothing to her customers from her stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal and bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia baji is a wife of M. A. and a citizen of a city named Kasur, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and for its shrines. They both are very hard workers. They own a decorative embroidery business.

Her husband goes to markets and gets orders from the clothing shops and then Razia baji and her daughter prepare the embroidered dresses and earn income. They both complete one dress in 10 days and earn Pak rupees 15,000 to 18,000. Razia baji is applying for a loan to buy material (colored thread, clothes, beads and sketches) to complete the order of shop keepers.

loans.use: To buy material to complete orders

loans.name: Acela

texts.es:
La señora Acela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en el Caserío Ponciano, Distrito de Shatoja, Provincia San Martín Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 46 años, 05 hijos, tres de ellos que aun dependen de ella.

Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de abarrotes, ya son años que se dedica a este tipo de venta.
Estableció su negocio, ahorrando poco a poco, vendiendo sus productos que su cracrá le produce y con el apoyo del crédito de Manuela Ramos, tuvo mas en capital y se inicio con s/. 300.00 donde comenzó a comprar sus productos, para establecer su bodeguita.
Hoy sus vecinos y amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca, una de sus ventajas grandes que tiene; es que se encuentra ubicada cerca de un campito, y ahí es donde vende sus gaseosas heladitas.

Con el préstamo de S/.800.00, lo invertirá comprando abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, paquetes de leches y aceites; también paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazadas en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Acela belongs to the Shatojinas Laboriosas Community Bank. She lives in the Caserío Ponciano, Shatoja district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 46, and in a common law marriage. She has five children; three of them are still dependent upon her. She has been selling groceries for years. She started her business by saving little by little and selling products her farm produces. With the loan from Manuela Ramos, she had more capital; she started with 300 PEN. She bought products and set up her little store. Now her friends and neighbors know and welcome her, and the products sell themselves. One of the big advantages she has is that she is located near a small field, and that is where she sells her cold soft drinks. With a loan for 800 PEN she will buy groceries like rice, sacks of sugar, packages of milk and oil. She will also buy packages of different flavors and sizes of soft drinks, housecleaning supplies, and personal hygiene items. This way she can keep her customers satisfied and happy. She feels very satisfied with the work she does. She believes it is worth the sacrifice to accomplish the dreams and goals that she has outlined for her life. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering support to her and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to increase her product (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Faithful Women Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a 48-year-old woman.  She never went to school because she grew up deep in the interior of Liberia.    Sarah has 4 children that she raised until they were so big they left the house and 2 children that she is still working on raising in her home.  All of her children were able to attend school (unlike her) and she made sure to send them to private school so that they could have a quality education.   

 Sarah’s business is selling plastic dishes in the market.  She has been doing this for 4 years.  She says that she attracts customers by talking sweet to them and making them laugh.  She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can support the rest of her children through school.    

With the loan she is requesting, she will be able to restock her dishes.  Because the currency is ever changing, Sarah does not have a specfic number of containers of dishes that she plans to buy.  She hopes that the money will stretch to allow her to purchase 13-20 dozen.

loans.use: 13-20 dozen new sets of dishes for resale

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita D. makes a living primarily from selling crabs in her community. She is 37 years old, married and has seven school-age children. They are from the village of Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Merlita has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP.This previous loan was used to purchase crabs to sell. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition fees of her children.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a crab selling business

loans.name: Potiniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
     Потинисо - женщина, которая занимается откормом и продажей скота. Ей 53 года, замужем имеет 4-х детей. Муж на заработках в Алма-ате. Потинисо вместе с сыном  имеет хороший доход с этого бизнеса. Прибыль Потинисо тратит на расходы семьи, а деньги, которые присылает её муж она использует на строительство своего дома. Потинисо на запрашиваемый займ хочет закупить несколько молоденьких барашков и корм для них.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Potiniso is a woman who feeds and sells cattle. She is 53 years old, she is married and has four children. Her husband works now in Alma-ata. Potiniso and her son together get good profit from this business. Potiniso spends the profit on the family's expenses and uses the money which her husband sends to repair her house. Potiniso wants to use the requested loan to buy several more young sheep and the fodder for them.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Ventura De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra, Ventura de Jesus P. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de pulperia P.,  tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de 
actividad y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar.
ella es casada en la foto del negocio sale con su querido esposo.
la sra ventura esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas mercaderia para invertirla en su negocio, ya que tiene muchos clientes y desea satisfacer las necesidades de todos ellos.
ella desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida. tiene pensado en un futuro inviertir en mejorar y ampliar su vivienda.
se siente muy alegre por el apoyo que todos sus clientes le han dado.
texts.en:
Ventura de Jesus P. earns her living selling popular consumer products. She has a store called P.. She's been in business for a number of years, and it's worth noting that during this time she has learned how to be a manager. She is married, and in the picture above she's shown in the store with her beloved husband. Ventura is seeking a loan to invest in more merchandise for her store. She has a lot of customers and wants to meet everyone's needs. She would like to improve her quality of life. In the future she plans to invest in improving and expanding her house. She feels very glad for support her customers have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lard, rice, churros (sweet-cream-filled pastries), soft drinks, bread, cookies, coffee, tortillas, milk, chicken, soups, pastas, salsas, candies, lozenges, chocolate, toilet paper, paper towels, soaps, detergents, and juices.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia T. is thirty-six years old and a widow. She has three children, one boy and two girls who are both in school at the primary level. She is taking care of three other dependents who are also in school. Lydia runs a bar selling beer, wine, sodas, and so on. Her business is located in Kiyirikiti village that is in Nyendo, in the Masaka district. She is using the loan to purchase more crates of beer, soda, wines, and boxes of water to sell to her customers. Her business dream is to increase her inventory by purchasing different types of alcohol, which would enable her to really increase her average daily sales.  Even more, she dreams of educating her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda, wines, water, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a member of the Gangilonga borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 8 years old. 

Shida has owned a Grocery business for 3 years, she works 8 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Shida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more drinks for Grocery business.

With the additional profit she gains from  the use of this loan, Shida hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more Drinks

loans.name: Benta

texts.en: Benta A. is a jovial mother who has been blessed with five children. She is very enthusiastic about how she manages to take care of her children. This, she says, is because she has been able to take care of them as the family breadwinner. She says it has not been easy since she lost her husband, but the joy of struggling in life gives her the zeal to keep going.  To earn a living, she sells fresh farm produce at the market and the surrounding homes in the village. She will be using half of the loan as extra capital to sustain her business growth. The rest will go to extension and preparation of the farms. She requires a loan of Kshs. 10,000.

loans.use: As extra capital and farm preparation

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en: Nelda C. is from the village of Looc, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Nelda owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products like chorizo (a spicy pork sausage), lumpia (spring roll) and others in the local community. In 2009, Nelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel P. produces snacks which she sells within their village. According to her, she needs additional capital amounting to PHP 5,000 for the growth of her business. She hopes that she can avail herself of this loan so that she can immediately buy the ingredients needed in cooking of her snacks. She said that having sufficient capital to run her business can help her to make it more productive.

Raquel is married to Celso who works as a driver. Her husband is in full support of running their business. She hopes that they can make it more productive. They have been blessed with two children: Russel Dave, nine years old, an elementary pupil and Celestine Tyra, seven years old.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her snack vending

loans.name: Asucina

texts.en:
Asucina B. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 44 years old. Asucina is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Asucina owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling products to local businesses and community members. Asucina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Asucina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asucina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Asucina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Asucina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yopi

texts.en:
Yopi E. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase sodas, beer and water to sell.  Yopi is 30 years old and married to a soldier. She has four children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to purchase sodas,beer and water to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old and married. She has five children, the eldest of whom is 16 years old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband has a poultry farm that helps to support their family. She is a LAPO client.

Mary sells electronics at retail prices. Her customers are mostly residents and friends. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction with her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Segundina es viuda, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Segundina vende desayunos en su casa y en algunas oportunidades vende cebiche, actividad que realiza todos los días. Segundina tiene proyectado implementar una fuente de soda.
Segundina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas y sillas.
Los sueños de Segundina son equipar su fuente de soda, tener un restaurante y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Segundina is a member of the Communal Bank “Alegría Huamanga”. She is 41 years old, widowed, and has four children. She sells breakfasts from her home and on some occasions sells ceviche. Her business is open every day. Segundina also has plans to open a soda fountain.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy tables and chairs. Segundina dreams of equipping her soda fountain, opening a restaurant, and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Melita's Group

texts.en: Melita S. owns and operates a fruit and vegetable vending business. She is 38 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Cabisera 9-11, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. Melita has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Melita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Melita has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Melita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Melita is the leader of a 4 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Melita S. Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama was born in 1957. She is married and has four children between the ages of 8 and 23. Salama and her family live in Gasabo District, Kigali Province, in the capital of Rwanda, in the village called Gatsata. Her business is also located there. 

Salama owns a small shop where she sells spare parts. She has been an entrepreneur since 2005. Salama has decided to be a businesswoman because, before, when she was a farmer, she could not meet the needs of her family. So far so good, because she is able to sort out her family problems. Her business opens every day at 7:00 in the morning and is open until 9:00 in the evening every day except Saturday.

Salama is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business because, right now, Salama cannot satisfy the demands of her clients. Salama’s shop is situated in a good place because there is a bus station that is not far from her shop. Salama believes that she can earn more profits by selling more spare parts. With these profits, Salama will be able to save money for her children so she can pay their school fees.

loans.use: Purchasing more spare parts

loans.name: Chamroeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Chamroeurn S., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Savet Sorn, 30, (pictured together) live in a small village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2001 and have four children: three sons and one daughter.

Chamroeurn is a rice farmer and, besides farming, he also sells firewood. His wife sells Cambodian noodles in the village.

Chamroeurn is requesting his first loan of US$600 to buy a motorized hand-tiller to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorized hand-tiller to use on his rice farm

loans.name: Abidemi

texts.en:
Abidemi buys and sells timber wood, which are use to make furniture, roofing of houses, and more. She gets her wood directly from the saw mill. She has been managing this business for 10 years and it has impacted her positively. She hopes for greater improvement in her business and a better future for her family.

Abidemi wants to buy more timber wood to sell in order to make more profits. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more timber wood to sell. She is 40 years old, married, with 5 children and they lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Her husband operates a personal business to sustain his family. Abidemi says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more timber wood to sell.

loans.name: Sophak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophak C. and her husband, Mr. Savit Uk, have been married since 1991 and have five sons. One of them is a carpenter, two attend school and the other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband has been driving a motorcycle taxi for more than six years.

Sophak has been selling corn for more than eight years and she sells mangoes as well.She hopes to continue to expand her business, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase mangoes under contract to sell.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes under contract to sell

loans.name: Alice Akinyi

texts.en:
Alice Akinyi is 37 years old and married to Peter Otieno. They have six children and they live in Manyatta area within Kisumu city. 

Alice has a stationery shop that she has been running for the past year. She is new to KADET after being introduced by a friend who is servicing loans with us and has seen their benefits. She intends to use the money to buy more stationery and add to her stock since many clients are in need of printing papers.

Her dream is to put a lot of effort into this business and see to it that it grows so as to enable her to cater for the family's needs and be able to put food on the table without much struggle.

loans.use: To increase her stock of printing papers

loans.name: Achike

texts.en:
Achike R. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock onions, cooking oil, etc., to sell.  

Achike is 31 years old and married to a policeman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock onions, cooking oil, etc., to sell

loans.name: Go-Befo Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses.

With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will each be able to add more stock to their business, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by feeding and clothing their children and sending them to school. 

Yeakain S. is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni city thirty years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending schools: two in secondary school and the two in primary school.

Yeakain sells cooked cassava and she has been doing this for many years now. With her share of the loan she will buy more cassava and other cooking ingredients in large quantity in order to improve the size and quality of her business.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and other cooking ingredients in large quantity

loans.name: Agata

texts.en: Agata O. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut phase (peanut paste) at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and cooking oil to sell. Agata is 31 years old and is married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a restaurant. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Lunh

texts.en: Lunh S., 38, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. is a farmer and grows rice for an income of US $3 per day. When she is not working in the field, she produces roofs made from palm leaves. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about US $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. S. is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase a generator to recharge batteries for people in the village. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a generator to recharge batteries

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.ru:
Очень многие люди задаются вопросом о том, чем же им заниматься, чтобы прокормить себя и свою семью. Этот вопрос сейчас актуален для многих так как проблемы с трудоустройством заставили многих людей забыть о том, по какой специальности они заканчивали ВУЗ или кем они вообще были по призванию. Вот и сейчас многие люди вынуждены идти торговать на рынок. Кыргызстан в условиях современного капитализма оказался в водовороте, который повлёк за собой массовое закрытие и банкротство заводов фабрик, предприятий, что в свою очередь привело к тому, что десятки тысяч бывших инженеров и рабочих оказались в не удел. Однако жизнь продолжается и сильные духом люди даже в нынешних условиях умудряются найти для себя занятие. Айгуль Сариева – лидер данной группы. Она к своим тридцати шести годам имеет большой жизненный опыт по обеспечению себя заработком. У Айгуль одна дочь. Муж работает сварщиком. Чтобы помочь мужу прокормить семью Айгуль четыре года назад решила заняться торговлей хлопушек. Постепенно её заработок позволил ей перейти к торговле вещами. Сейчас ежемесячный заработок Айгуль составляет около одиннадцати тысяч сомов. Она уже успела купить автомобиль и тем самым сделала большой подарок своему мужу. Сейчас Айгуль надеется получить данный кредит и закупить товар. Полученную прибыль Айгуль собирается копить, чтобы в будущем оплачивать университетское образование дочери. 
Партнёры Айгуль по группе:
Адылу Сариеву сорок семь лет. Он – отец двух дочерей. Жена Адыла занимается торговлей в маленьком магазине. На данный момент Адыл работает в собственной станции техобслуживания. Адыл обратился за этим кредитом, чтобы закупить товар.  
Бермет Тынысбековой тридцать четыре года. Бермет воспитывает двоих детей и в это же время работает на р. Дордой – на одном из самых больших рынках в Центральной Азии. Она разносит чай, кофе и булочки среди продавцов. Бермет надеется получить кредит с целью открыть своё кафе. 
Динаре Нураковой двадцать восемь лет. Чтобы прокормить семью муж Динары занимается частным извозом, работает водителем такси, а сама Динара работает в швейном цеху технологом. Динара нуждается в швейной машинке и поэтому очень надеется, что этот кредит даст ей возможность купить её. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aigul S. is the leader of the group. She is thirty-six years old, married, with one daughter. Her husband is a welder. Aigul has been manufacturing firecrackers for 4 years and gradually it has allowed her to grow her apparel sales business. Currently, she makes 1,000 Soms per month. Aigul bought a car as a present for her husband. She's applying for credit to purchase apparel. She hopes to use savings to pay for her daughter's education.

Aigul has 3 partners. Adyl S. is forty-seven years old, married with 2 daughters. His wife works in a retail store. He is a mechanic and applying for a loan to purchase merchandise for his service station.

Bermet T. is a thirty-four year old mother of two. She delivers tea, coffee and pastries to merchants at one of the largest flea markets in Central Asia, on the Dordoi River. She is applying for credit to open her own cafe.

Dinara N. is twenty-eight years old and married. Her husband is a self-employed taxi driver. Dinara is a seamstress and hopes to buy a sewing machine with a loan. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase goods to resell them

loans.name: Kyosimba-Onaanya Women's Group Buikwe-Lugazi

texts.en:
Before she began her food-selling business 12 years ago in Buikwe in Lugazi, Hadijah N. was more of a  business rolling stone. She subsisted on occasional pieces of work, like the selling of second-hand clothing to the selling of food. At present, 48-year-old Hadijah N. is a master at her food-selling business. 

Hadijah is a married mother to two children and in a week she makes 100,000 shillings. With this loan, she wants to reinvigorate her business with bulk  purchases of lucrative cash crops like sweet potatoes, cassava and maize, that she will, in the course of transacting, resell.

loans.use: The purchase of lucrative cash crops like cassava and sweet potatoes for resale

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita C. is from the village of Makawa Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Jovita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Jovita owns & operates a weaving business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling woven goods such as "banig", "kalo", and baskets. Jovita has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jovita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in his business. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Jovita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in his weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase more cassettes for his shop

loans.name: Lutviyar

texts.en: Lutviyar M. is 44, married with three children, lives in the small village of Saatli district, where he now works as a farmer. His main business is agriculture and livestock breeding, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. Lutviyar owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables. Due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy seeds, fertilizer and calves. The loan will greatly improve Lutviyar’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and two calves

loans.name: Francois Xavier

texts.en:
Francois Xavier is 28 years and single. Francois Xavier takes care of dependent relatives. He owns a store which contains various products such as: cosmetic products; rice, sugar, etc. Francois Xavier has an experience of 3 years and the hours of his business are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the morning every day except on Saturday. Francois Xavier's business is well organised and known in his residence place.

Francois Xavier is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing more products for his store. With this expansion; he expects to attract more customers which is the best way of earning more profits to be used in his family and in his business.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: kokouvi est un jeune célibataire, il a ouvert en 2007 un bar qu'il a appelé "ALMAX", ce bar fonctionne bien et lui procure de bonnes recettes. son bar est très animé les soirs. les fêtes de fin d'année étant proches, il voudrait mettre les atouts de son côté et sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des casiers de boissons et divers
texts.en: Kokouvi is a young unmarried man.  He opened a bar in 2007 that he calls "ALMAX".  It is doing well and brings in a good income.  His bar is very busy in the evenings.  Because the year-end holidays will soon be here, he would like to put his best foot forward.  So he is requesting a loan from WAGES that will be used to buy cases of beverages and miscellaneous items.

loans.use: Buying cases of beverages

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily D. is from the town of Surallah. She is 46 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Emily owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in farming for over 20 years. She is hoping for an increase in her next harvest.

Emily joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old married woman from Lebanon.  She has many years of experience working with mobile phones.  She began as an employee in a mobile phone shop and opened her own store four years ago.  She got married recently and she is planning to have a child with her husband after improving her life situation. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve her shop by adding new décor and adding new merchandise consisting of new mobile phones and rechargeable cards to her shop. The majority of mobile phone users in Lebanon purchases these prepaid cards; it is less common to have an annual phone contract. In the future, she is looking to further expand her business and increase her capital.

loans.use: To improve her shop by adding new décor and adding new merchandise consisting of new mobile phones and rechargeable cards to her shop.

loans.name: Mwandila Group

texts.en:
Daniel M. is in his mid-thirties and married, with three children. Daniel has been running a secondhand shoe store since 2007. The business is open from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and earns Daniel a low monthly profit. 

This will be Daniel's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his first loan to increase and diversify his stock of shoes. This loan has now been successfully repaid. Daniel aims to use his second loan to once again increase his stock of shoes and to buy some bricks for the house he is constructing. 

Daniel will share this loan with his loan group Tujijenge Tanzania, which consists of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. In the photo, Daniel is sitting in the front row.

loans.use: to increase his stock of shoes and to buy some bricks

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Lourdes is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, instant noodles and snack foods in the local community. She also sells vegetables, like Chinese and local cabbages. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products such as beverages and vegetables. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products like beverages and vegetables

loans.name: Mercy Marisol

texts.es:
La Señora. Mercy G. es socia del banco comunal Prosperidad, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones la misma que es muy amable y cordial.

Doña Mercy es costurera actividad que desempeña hace 15 años, elabora ternos para compromisos sociales, labora en su propio taller ya que este oficio lo ha aprendió trabajando en otras fabricas, labora de lunes a viernes sin tener un horario fijo.

La Señora. Mercy tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad que estudia en la universidad. Su esposo no se encuentra en el país, ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  y fue invitada por su cuñada ha formar parte del banco, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como es tela, hilos, etc. Su meta es agrandar su taller.
texts.en:
Señora Mercy G. is a member of the community bank Prosperidad (Prosperity). She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its architectural beauty. Its people maintain its culture and traditions and are kind and cordial.

Doña Mercy is a seamstress, an activity that she began 15 years ago. She makes men's suits for special social events. She works in her own workshop, having learned this trade by working in other factories. She works from Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule.

Señora Mercy is 37 years old. She is married and has a son who is 18 and studies at the university. Her husband is not in the country. He emigrated in search of a better job. She does not have her own house, so she lives in the house of a relative.

This is the first loan that she has taken out with the community bank, and she was invited by her sister-in-law to become part of the bank. She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of materials such as fabrics, thread, etc. Her goal is to enlarge her workshop.

loans.use: Buy fabrics, thread, buttons, fasteners, etc.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a 41-year-old married man and father of two kids. He has been the owner of a perfume and cosmetics sales shop since 2001. Mouhamad's work is special since he makes his own perfumes upon request. Mouhamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his products and introduce new ones to his clients. Mouhamad’s clients are his neighbors, friends and relatives. Most of them are teenagers. He works hard for his children’s education and seeks to provide them with the best education. Mouhamad hopes to expand his business and start wholesale trade in the future

loans.use: To increase his products

loans.name: Guadencio

texts.en:
Guadencio A. is from the village of Mapuroc, San Mateo. He is 51 years old. Guadencio is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Guadencio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Guadencio has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Guadencio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guadencio is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Guadencio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty B. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Betty has a poultry farm business, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Betty hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for resale

loans.name: Marycil

texts.en:
Marycil is 32 years old and lives in the town of Trento with her family. She is engaged in farming. She and her husband plant and harvest rice crops. They sell their harvest to the community. Aside from farming, Marycil also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells noodles, sugar and other products. Marycil said the income from the store helps in providing for their daily needs.

Marycil joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marycil has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Marycil is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married, with a son and 2 daughters. She lives in the town of Privetnoye in the Kherson region. Ludmila owns several greenhouses where she grows cabbage, potatoes, radishes, squash and beets. She is an experienced farmer as she has been in this business for 15 years. Ludmila has invested about 100,000 grivnyas in the enterprise. Her average net profit amounts to 4,400 grivnyas a month.  

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 15,000 grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, fertilizer and plastic film. She is planning ahead to make sure her greenhouses are equipped for the upcoming farming season to provide the proper environment for growing plants.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, polyethylene film, wood and fertilizer

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en: Yagub H. has been a hairdresser since 2001. He was born in 1971 in the Cabrayil region. He is an internal refugee from Nagorno Karabakh. Yagub fled to the Bilasuvar district of Azerbaijan in 1993. He is married and has two children. Both of them are adults. This is his first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan in the amount of 500 AZN to improve the fittings in his barber shop. He promises to make the payments on time, since he would like to have more loans in the future.

loans.use: to improve the fittings in his barber shop

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
This loan group is made up of the four borrowers who are shown in the picture. The group's leader, Han H., is 50 years old.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is local fisherman. Han H. and her husband make a living by selling fish which they catch in and around the Tunle Sap River. They typically generate approximately $7 a day in income to support their family. 

Recently, this family was not able to catch as many fish as before because their boat often broke down. Therefore, Han H. is applying for a loan to repair their old boat and to buy a new piece of fishing equipment for the boat.  This loan will help her family can catch more fish, as they did before. 

The other three borrowers in this group include: 

Mrs. T., who will be using her loan to buy some nets to support her fishing activities.
Mrs. T., who is applying for a loan to purchase nets to catch more fish.
Mrs. P., who is asking for a loan to buy new machine equipment for her boat for fishing purposes.

loans.use: To repair her old boat and buy new fishing equipment

loans.name: Zulmira Simao

texts.pt:
Zulmira Simão N. nasceu na cidade de Inhambane, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique solteira mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 2 a 10 anos de idade, os 2 mais velhos vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 4ª classe não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e naõ sustenta mais ninguem.

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo ainda muito nova, veio com os seus pais. Possui um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 10 anos. Naõ possui empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e a vezes consegue poupar algum atravez de Xitique(sistema tradicional de Poupança rotativa).

Ja teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigo que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 11.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, areia, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O emprestimo anterior foi de 5.500.00mt aplicado na construção da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para concluir a sua residencia e confortar a sua familia.
texts.en:
Zulmira Simão N. was born in the city of Inhambane in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is a single mother of four children between the ages of 2 and 10, the two eldest of whom attend school. She only went through the 4th grade, and wasn't able to continue because of her parents' difficult financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
She and her parents left Inhambane for Maputo when she was very young. She's had her own business selling staple goods for more than 10 years. She doesn't have any employees and brings in about 3000 meticals a month, which is enough to cover household expenses and sometimes even save a little with Xitique (a traditional rotational savings system).
She has received loans from other banks, but learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 11,000 meticals, which she intends to use to purchase construction materials (stone, sand, cement, etc.) to continue building her house. Her previous loan was in the amount of 5500 meticals, which she also used to build her house.
She's committed to paying this loan off on time so that she'll be eligible for others in the future. She intends to request additional loans to finish the house and provide her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction material (stone, sand, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Amanda Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Amanda es una señora de 27 años está casada con el señor Alba Jhasmany juntos tienen una hija de 9 años, la cual asiste a una escuela de primaria, Amanda vive en la comunidad de la maica sud , vive en la casa de sus padres , ya que la casa de ella aún está en construcción , los padres le heredaron el terreno y ahí es donde está haciendo construir , actualmente viven los tres tan solo en  una habitación , donde todos están muy incomodos , la principal actividad de la señora Amanda es la venta de comida ( chicharrón de cerdo, que es un plato tipico de la zona , pato , conejo, etc. ) , todos los fin de semanas a partir de viernes hasta el lunes , y el esposo trabaja como taxista todos los días , de esta manera los dos trabajan todos los días para terminar la construcción de su casa , el préstamo será destinado para la compra de un cerdo para la preparación de chicharrón , ya que le ha faltado capital para seguir cocinando.

Ella lo mejor que hace es cocinar así que entre sus sueños y metas esta, que en futuro tener un restaurant grande donde ella pueda preparar sus exquisitos platos.
texts.en:
Amanda is 27 years old and she is married with Mr. Alba Jhasmany and they have a 9-year old daughter together. She is in primary school. Amanda lives in the community of La Maica Sud. She lives in her parents' house because her own house is still under construction. Her parents inherited her land where she is building. The three of them live in a single room and they are all very uncomfortable. Amanda's main business is food sales (pork rinds, a traditional food of the region, and duck, rabbit, etc.). She sells during the weekends from Friday to Monday. Her husband works every day as a taxi driver. They both work every day to finish building their house. The loan will be destined to purchase a pig to make pork rinds. She has not had capital funds to keep up her food sales.

The best thing she knows how to do is to cook and among her dreams and goals is to have a great restaurant in the future where she will be able to prepare her delicious recipes.

loans.use: to purchase a pig for her catering business.

loans.name: Gema Consuelo

texts.es:
La Sra. Gema Consuelo pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen la Inmaculada” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada y tiene 52 años. 

Desde  muy joven su afición hacia la costura le lleva a estudiar alta costura y diseño de modas. En el año de 1991 cesa de laborar como docente y se dedica de lleno como a trabajar como modista, se inicio con la confección de ropa interior para damas y caballeros y salía a vender en las tiendas del Distrito del Tarapoto haciéndose conocida y de esta forma ella logra establecer su negocio en su domicilio donde elabora uniformes  para trabajadores de entidades públicas y privadas por pedido. Actualmente su actividad está más dirigida a la elaboración de ropa de cama como: sábanas, cubrecamas y fundas de almohadas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  telas especiales para el diseño de los juegos de sábanas y cubrecama, hilos de coser, agujas, para continuar dando un servicio  de calidad a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Gema se considera una mujer exitosa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gema Consuelo is a member of the ‘Virgen de la Inmaculada’ Communal Bank, located in the District of Tarapoto within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 52 years old and divorced.

At a young age, her love for sewing brought her to study haute couture and fashion design. In 1991, she stopped working as a teacher and completely dedicated herself to working as a stylist. She started by making underwear for men and women and sold them to stores in the District of Tarapoto, making herself well-known. As a result, she was able to establish a business at her house where she makes uniforms by request for employees of public and private institutions. Currently, her work is more oriented towards making bed linens like sheets, bedspreads and pillowcases.

With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase special fabrics for making sheet sets and bedpsreads, thread and needles to continue providing quality service to her customers.

Gema considers herself to be a successful woman and she is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy special fabrics for making sheet sets and bedpsreads, thread and needles.

loans.name: Tala

texts.en:
Tala is 42 years of age and is married with two children. Tala owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Tala needs a loan of 1,450 WST to purchase general farm supplies and equipment such as knives, shovel, wheelbarrow and spade. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 140 WST or 58 USD per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2010, Tala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tala's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment such as knives, shovel, wheelbarrow and spade

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 65 years old and lives in Plaride, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 10 children.

To earn a living, Dionesia has a business selling different kinds of snacks. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Dionesia has a requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Dionesia has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Beat Art And Craft Group

texts.en:
A single mother of four, 53-year-old Jane has been selling liquor to earn a living for four years now, having taken over the business after her Dad passed on and becoming fully involved in its daily operation after separating from her husband. She earns as much as Ugandan shillings 150,000 per week and also has a poultry business.

Jane works hard at her enterprise, knowing the crucial role it plays in the welfare of her children and relatives. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more jerrycans of liquor to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of liquor to resell.

loans.name: Diego De Jesus

texts.es:
A sus 30 años de edad Diego es reconocido por su voz, desde hace 12 se dedica a cantar, y generalmente lo hace como mariachi. Esta labor la heredó de su padre quien actualmente también canta y desde pequeño le ha apasionado la música y la interpretación de la misma, es por estoy que hoy en día utiliza su talento como método para generar ingresos.

Diego sueña con llegarle a mas clientes, y ser un cantante reconocido en su ciudad Medellín donde realiza su labor, pero para ellos es conciente que deberá seguir trabajando y conociendo nuevos clientes a quienes deleitar con su voz, pero actualmente carece de un amplificador de sonido que le facilite no solo el servicio si no que sus clientes lo escuchen con mas calidad y cobertura, pero Diego no cuenta con el capital para comprar esta herramienta de trabajo por  lo que solicita un crédito que le permita mejorar el servicio y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida
