texts.en:
At the age of 30, Diego is recognized by his voice. For 12 years he has been a singer, mainly a mariachi singer. This work was passed down to him by his father, who is currently also a singer. He has had a passion for music and music interpretation from a young age, and this is why he is now using his talent to generate his income.

Diego dreams of having more clients, and being a well-known singer in his city, Medellin, where he works. But in order for this to happen, he knows that he has to keep working and meeting new clients to delight with his voice. At the moment he needs a sound amplifier, which will help him not only in providing his services, but also mean that his clients will hear him in greater quality and range. Diego does not have the capital to purchase this work tool, so he is requesting a loan which will allow him to improve his service and thus his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a sound amplifier

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has a mixed farm in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya that produces bananas, coffee, tomatoes and French beans. He has been in the farming business for 20 years, selling all his produce at the local market. Farming has been his main source of income. His major challenge has been lack of a ready market for farm produce, which affects his cash flows. 

Charles has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings in order to cultivate his banana farm. He specifically wants to expand the acreage under bananas by acquiring more land. He says that this will improve his banana production and enable him to enjoy the economies of scale. The proceeds from this loan will enable him to improve his family's livelihood. In the future, he plans to acquire a piece of land in order to build a modern house for his family.

Charles is 54 and married with eight children. Six of his children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To expand his banana farm by acquiring more land.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Dominga que nació en la ciudad D. Cusco, tiene 57 años D. edad, está casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cuatro hijos y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. realizo mis actividades, Yo me dedico a llevar y vender productos del valle sagrado como verduras y frutas a la ciudad D. Paruro y al regresar a la ciudad del Cusco llevo granos secos, carne y queso. DesD. muy joven me dedico a este negocio, aproximadamente unos 25 años estoy en el negocio y me va muy bien.  En esta oportunidad requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como verduras y frutas”.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Vamos Juntas” (We Go Together) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, which is known in the region for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

It is here that the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sra. Dominga, who was born in the city of Cusco. She is 57 years old, married, and has four children. She said the following:

“At the moment, I live in the city of Cusco and this is where I conduct my activities. I bring products from the Sacred Valley, such as vegetables and fruit, to sell in the city of Paruro. When I return to the city of Cusco, I bring back dried grains, meat, and cheese. I have been in this business since I was a young woman and have been working for approximately 25 years. I have done very well and am taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more merchandise, such as vegetables and fruits.”

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Hinsiensien Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HINSIENSIEN est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Simbi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Simbi est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Simbi est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Benjamin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Simbi a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Simbi mène comme activité depuis dix ans la vente des produits cosmétiques et des mèches. Simbi s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Simbi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HINSIENSIEN, un troisième crédit. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group HINSIENSIEN is composed of three persons who live in the same district. This is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Simbi, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 29 years old and married to a wood worker by the name of Benjamin. They have two children, who are both in school and in their care. 

Simbi did not attend school very much. To support herself and her children, she has been running a business selling cosmetics and hair extensions for ten years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Simbi and the other members of the group HINSIENSIEN are requesting a third loan. The two previous loans have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Asibe

texts.en: Asibe sells cooked rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, fried fish and hot pepper sauce (shito) at Elmina.  She has done this for 9 years. Asibe is a single parent taking care of 2 children.  She uses her earnings to pay school fees and other household expenses.   Asibe will use this loan to purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and other ingredients. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit.

loans.use: purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Theonest

texts.en:
Theonest is single. He is a rice farmer and has been doing rice farming for the past two years. His parents taught him how to grow rice. He will use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor on his rice farm

loans.name: Enrique Gregorio

texts.es:
Enrique es un hombre de 52 años, padre de tres hijos vive con su familia en  la parroquia de "Río Verde" del cantón "Santo Domingo". Santo Domingo es cantón y ciudad de la nueva Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, que era parroquia rural de Quito,  Santo Domingo está entre la costa y la sierra del Ecuador, punto de enlace entre Quito, Guayaquil, Portoviejo,  y otras ciudades importantes. Situado en los flancos externos de la cordillera occidental, así como en la planicie costeña inferior a los 1000 msnm, es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país. Tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica: existen cinco cuencas y micro cuencas importantes. Es una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, posee una temperatura promedio de 22 °C.

Trabaja vendiendo refrescos en la ciudad, pero además vive en una pequeña finca que produce frutas. Sus dos trabajos le han servido para poder mantener a su familia. Su esposa le ayuda con sus actividades y se han planteado la meta de comprar un auto, con esto podrán sacar más fácilmente sus productos y poder tener ingresos más rápido. Con esto ellos podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida. Solicitaron un crédito a Fundación Alternativa para invertir en productos para venderlos. De esta manera ellos tendrán un ingreso que les permita alcanzar su meta de comprar un vehículo para que les alivie su duro trabajo.
texts.en:
Enrique is a 52-year-old man.  He has three children and lives with his family in Río Verde parish, in Santo Domingo canton.  Santo Domingo is a canton and city in the new province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas.  This was previously a rural parish of Quito.  Santo Domingo is located between Ecuador's coast and mountains.  It is a hub between Quito, Guayaquil, Portoviejo and other important cities.  Located on the flanks of the western mountain range, on the lower coastal plain, 1000 meters above sea level, it is the rainiest area of the country.  The area has great hydrological richness: there are five basins and important micro basins.  The area has a subtropical, humid climate.  The average temperature is 22 °C.

Enrique works selling soft drinks in the city.  However, he also lives on a small farm that produces fruit.  His two jobs have enabled him to support his family.  His wife helps him with his business activities and they are planning to buy a car which will enable them to transport their products more easily and make income more quickly.  This would enable them to enjoy a better quality of life.  Enrique requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa to invest in buying products to sell.  This will make him an income which will enable him to reach his goal of buying a vehicle to make his work easier.

loans.use: to invest in products to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 34-year-old married man with three children. He has a sari-sari (variety) store business in Trinidad, Bohol. Roberto has been running his store for eight years. He sells canned goods, shampoo and sachets of coffee and milk. Roberto also sells rice to the people in his community.

Roberto requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as rice and sugar. Roberto hopes to expand his store in the future. He also wishes for his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as rice and sugar.

loans.name: Damary Apolonia

texts.es:
Damary, es propietaria y administradora de una tienda donde ofrece artículos para toda necesidad como granos básicos, refrescos, galletas, dulces,  y lo ha logrado sacar adelante con su esfuerzo, dicho negocio lo tiene en su casa por ello lo atiende a tiempo completo.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, azucar, cafe, y más mercadería como boquitas, galletas, dulces, para su negocio ya que esta mercaderia es demandada por sus clientes, esta compra le ayudara a surtir su tienda.
La proyeccion de Damary es incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Damary owns and operates a store where she sells a variety of household items, such as basic staples, soft drinks, cookies, and candy. She has managed to keep it going through her hard work. As she has the business in her home, she runs it full time.

She is applying for a loan to buy basic staples, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, and other merchandise such as snacks, cookies and candy for her business, as her customers are asking for these products. This purchase will help her supply her store. 

Damary's plan is to increase her business, in order to improve her income and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 63 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive solo en el Cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia, vías de comunicación y las plagas. El sueño es tener más animales y más productos.
Se considera una persona humilde, honrado, alegre, y muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 63, is single and has no children.  He lives alone in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is involved in short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Luis is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and his sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  He asked for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain his crops in good condition.

The loan will be very helpful because he will be able to improve the quality of the product.  The challenges he faces are very frequent: competition, the roads and pests.  His dream is to own more animals and products.  He considers himself to be humble, honest, cheerful and very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Erdeneochir

texts.en: Erdeneochir is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in his own house in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Two of his children study at school and the younger son is in kindergarten. After being unemployed for six years he started his business by building his own house and grocery shop in 2010. His wife works mainly in the grocery shop. He is a diligent and hardworking man. Now that his business is going well, he wants to make his grocery shop bigger and then broaden his business by selling electric goods. He needs 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy electric goods to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy electric goods to expand his business.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is married with four children. Tita is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Tita is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900  to purchase additional livestock feed and vitamins.

Tita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Tita hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en: Connie is 28 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, which is located in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, soap and home products. To help expand her business, she is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more items to sell. Her goal is to increase her profits so that she can buy more food for her family. Her goal for the future is to own a wholesale business. Connie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which serves people who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that are too large to qualify for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap and home products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 38 years old and married with five children. With all five children in school, Melba works very hard to provide for them.

Melba runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Melba has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, coffee, spices, eggs, canned goods, etc.

In the future Melba would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Mrs. Tho is taking this loan out for her daughter,Mai. With the hope of being a general accountant for a commercial company, Mai is attending Hanoi Industrial College as a second-year student. She will be in school for three years and she will graduate in 2012. To be self-confident in her future job, she is studying hard to achieve good results. 

Mrs. Tho is asking for a loan of 11,664,000 VND to pay for Mai's school fees, books and supplies.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school fees, books and supplies.

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en: Branka is in her late 40s, married and has three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling clothes. She works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. and earns a good income. She is applying for her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and plans to use it to buy more clothing to sell. Her goal is to make enough money to build her own house. Branka will share this loan with the 16 members of her loan group, which is called Saranga. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leonidas De Jesus

texts.es:
Leonidas es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Leonidas se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 45 años a la actividad de la agricultura, pues tiene la ventaja de que sus padres se dedicaron a la agricultura y de estos aprendió desde muy temprana edad a desarrollar la actividad. Leonidas se encuentra casado y es padre de 7 hijos, quienes siempre han sido su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus cultivos, Leonidas ha podido captar gran cantidad de clientes, lo que le garantiza muy buenas ventas. Debido a que su guadañadora se le ha dañado, Leonidas ha tenido que ver como su negocio se ha visto parado por la poca producción que puede sacar, es por esto que Leonidas busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una guadañadora y poder desarrollar su actividad con total normalidad, pues la guadañadora que tiene se encuentra averiada.

Leonidas espera que con esta herramienta de trabajo en óptimas condiciones, pueda seguir desarrollando su actividad normalmente, lo que le permitirá seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Leonidas sueña con tener un gran cultivo en el cual pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y el cual le pueda ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida para toda su familia.

loans.use: Compra de una guadañadora y poder desarrollar su actividad con total normalidad, pues la guadañadora que tiene se encuentra averiada.

loans.name: Kara Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the Kara group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 2,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leone (SLL) for the both of them. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Aminata is the featured leader of this group. The 31-year-old is married to a businessman and they have 6 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Aminata has been a businesswoman for 19 years now, she sells cakes. With her share of this loan, she will buy frying oil, flour, etc. in order to fry a larger quantity of cakes for sale.

loans.use: to buy frying oil, flour, etc. in order to fry a larger quantity of cakes for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a businessman who operates multiple shops in Nabweru, one of Kampala's suburbs. He is a repeat borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance. He has achieved a lot through the loan schemes rendered to him, and his repayment records are amazing.

He intends to open up a mini second general store and he has approached UGAFODE for a facility of 3,000,000 UGX, the same amount as the one he has been servicing.

It's his desire that you generously contribute toward his loan so that he can meet demand during the festive season.

loans.use: to expand his general store business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de comida en su hermosa ciudad de Challabamba, con esta actividad está logrando salir adelante y desea ampliar su negocio por fiestas de fin de año donde el público le exige que prepare otros alimentos. 
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "sol naciente de Majopata" ,ella solicito el crédito para comprar carne, pollo, quinua y aceite.
La socia esta agradecida y satisfecha con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella.

loans.use: para comprar carne, pollo, quinua y aceite.

loans.name: Mana

texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Lomé, Mrs Mana O. is married and mother of six (6) children. She sells smoked fish to make her living and provide for her family. She owns an oven to smoke the fish, but because of an increase in the population of her village and the increase in demand for her smoked fish, she hopes to install a new oven which will allow her to smoke more fish. The experience she has in this field and her management sense will allow her to successfully expand her business. However, to make this new project a reality she needs some financial support. That is why she is asking for a loan of $650 to expand her business and increase her sales. This project is worthy of support because it will allow Mrs O. to take proper care of her children.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1966 à Lomé, Madame O. Mana est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants tous à sa charge. Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de poissons fumés pour assumer les charges de sa famille. Elle dispose d’un four de poissons, mais face à l’augmentation de la population de son village et à la croissante demande en poissons fumés, elle souhaiterait fabriquer un nouveau four qui lui permettrait de fumer plus de poissons. L’expérience qu’elle a dans le domaine et son sens de gestion lui permettront de mener à bien cet élargissement de l’activité. Mais pour réaliser ce nouveau projet, elle a besoin d’un appui financier. Ce qui l’amène à solliciter ce crédit de $650 pour agrandir la taille de son commerce et accroître son chiffre d’affaire. Ce projet mérite d’être soutenu car sa réalisation va permettre à Madame O. de bien prendre soins de ses enfants.

loans.use: Make a second oven to smoke fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Milton has a rice farm and would like to buy more supplies and livestock

loans.name: Evelminda

texts.en:
My name is Evelminda Z.. I product and sell tortillas. I've owned my business for 1 year now. In my community, people eat lots of tortillas and that why I'm in this business. At this point, I need to buy more dough and firewood to increase my production. With my profits I want to remodel the stove that I use to make my tortillas, and I will use them to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Evelminda Z. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, en nuestra comunidad la gente come mucha tortilla y por eso es que me dedico a este trabajo pero en estos momentos necesito comprar mas masa y leña para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi fogon en el cual hago mis tortillas tambien cubrir con los gastos alimenticios de mi hogar,.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, caulk, salt, water, firewood, and matches

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Srouy is a mother of four children and makes her living by producing wine and selling it to a wholesaler or to the people in her community. This business venture earns her around $2 each day, while her husband earns between $3 to $4/day from working as a mechanic. The loan will allow her to purchase tools to help in her business.

loans.use: To purchase tools to help in her business

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
I was born and raised in Multan, a mid-sized city in southern Punjab (a province in Pakistan). I am a mother of four and all my children attend school. My husband is a rickshaw driver (three wheeled local vehicle) while I knit.

I buy wool from a nearby village while my mother-in-law sells the finished products of knitting in various cities in Punjab. The venture of these two businesses yields us a profit of $90 USD a month. For higher quality of life, I need to expand my knitting business in order to cover all the household expenses. Therefore, I require 250 USD in loans to buy wool in bulk from the city, which will cost a great deal cheaper.

loans.use: To expand knitting business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Sra. Martha belongs to the Mujer Jepelacina community bank. She lives in Moyobamba, Peru. She earns a living selling general merchandise in a local market. She started the business with a loan from the community bank and, little by little, it's grown. She started with little more than a table but now she has a bigger space where she has a stand to show off her products, something that allows her to better serve her customers. She's a hardworking person, skilled at business. She decided to start her business because she wanted to earn an income of her own, something that would boost her self-esteem and help her grow as a person and as a woman.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.2,500 (2,500 Peruvian soles or about US$833), to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar, milk (of different brands and sizes), cooking oil, detergent, pasta, onions, garlic and other products. She wants her customers to be able to find what they're looking for and she knows that offering a wide range of products will increase her sales.

Sra. Martha, 46, has 5 children. She has the support of her husband, something that she didn't have at the outset. She's happy with what she's accomplished to date: her customer base has grown, she's improved her economic situation and she can help with household expenses. Her goal is to ensure that the business is well-established in a bigger and more secure place.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Martha pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujer Jepelacina, vive en Moyobamba, en la Región de San Martín. Se dedica la venta de abarrotes en el mercado de su localidad, ella se inició con el crédito del banco comunal y poco a poco fue creciendo. Se inicio con una mesa y ahora ya tiene un puesto más amplio en donde puede tener un estante para exhibir y acomodar mejor sus productos, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque es una persona muy trabajadora y hábil para el negocio, además le gusta generar sus propios ingresos para alimentar su autoestima y así crecer como persona y mujer.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500 soles ($ 833), el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará abarrotes como arroz, azúcar en sacos, cajas de leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, aceite en cajas, paquetes de detergentes, fideos en cajas, cebolla , ajos en sacos, y demás productos para surtir mejor su negocio, por que quiere que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan, cuando hay variedad el negocio aumentan las ventas .

Tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, ahora cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, por que en un inicio no fue así, esta contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha, su clientela aumentó, eso también ayudó a que mejore su situación económica y pueda ayudar en los gastos de su casa, su meta es contar con un negocio bien implementado y en un lugar mas amplio y seguro.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Evas

texts.en:
Evas is 21 years old and married with one child. For the past year she has operated a retail store, where she sells dry staples such as sugar, maize flour, rice and salt. She buys the dry staples in 100kg bags and sells by weight to customers. I have sat in some of these retail stores, relaxing, having a soda, passing the time. There are often a couple of chairs and a coffee table at which patrons can sit and enjoy their soda. These stores are usually operated by women, who run the store while looking out for their children playing outside on the street.

However, the best time is at night, when shops are only lit by lanterns. The atmosphere is alive at night and everyone enjoys being out in the cool air. Music plays, charcoal stoves roast skewered barbequed meat and chicken and people congregate in groups enjoying each others' company. There is very little crime as there is not much to steal and everyone is in the same boat. Evas is requesting a loan with which she plans to buy more staples such as sugar, flour, rice and salt for her store.

loans.use: Evas plans to use her loan to buy more staples such as sugar, flour, rice and salt for her store.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia V. is a young single woman who lives at home with her parents. Although she has no children of her own, she works everyday with the youth of Luque as an elementary school teacher. Cynthia’s dream was to one day own her own business and after hard work she has now obtained it.

A few years ago, Cynthia opened a women’s clothing store in her house. Because she lacked the initial capital to open it on her own, she had partners who shared in the expenses. Time passed and the business grew. Soon Cynthia was able to buy out her partners and continue selling clothes on her own.

Today, she has a small business with one of the best reputations in town along with a number of dedicated clients. Cynthia’s hope is to continue growing her business and move it out of her house and into the center of the city. With the profits she makes from her business, she plans to then attend the university and gain a business degree.

With this loan, she will increase her stock of merchandise, buying more pants, shirts, undergarments, sandals, and shoes to provide for the women of Luque.

loans.use: To buy female undergarments, pants for women, shirts, sandals, and women’s outfits.

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
Shamil J. is a 50-year-old man who breeds calves in the small village of Saatli region. He purchases baby calves, raise them, and sells them to the local bazaar traders for meat production. He has seven years of experience in this field.

Shamil need to expand his business and to purchase more caves, because the demand for meat is very high in Azerbaijan. He needs $1200 USD to purchase one milk cow for $600 USD and two calves for an estimated cost $300 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Nodirahon

texts.en: S. Nodirahon is 24 years old and she lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and today she is an active client. She started her own business from scratch and through the loans she organized this business in wholesale rice trading. Despite her young age, she has been engaged in the business for 8 years. She works directly with the suppliers and delivers rice to the many traders in her region at very low prices. She is now applying to Kiva for an 8 month loan of $775 to open a new trade outlet.

loans.use: Opening a trade outlet.

loans.name: Angelica Norma

texts.es:
For twenty years Angélica has been working as a travelling sales person in the city center. At first she began working for a boss; however, as time passed, she felt she was becoming familiar enough with the business to make herself independent. And that's what she did; with a little bit of money, she began to make her own salary.

Presently she has two kids with her husband who also works as a sales person. In the mornings, Angélica is dedicated to household chores, mainly preparing the meals for the kids until school.

She and her husband, thanks to the economic income that they have enjoyed from their sales business, have two cars they rent out for use as taxis. They have lots of expectations for their business; they hope to buy in the near future two more cars to establish their business of taxi services.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Desde los veinte años Angélica trabaja como cambista ambulante en el centro de la ciudad. Al inicio ella empezó trabajando para un señor; no obstante, conforme pasaba el tiempo, ella sentía que iba conociendo lo suficiente de este negocio como para independizarse. Y así lo hizo, junto un poco de dinero y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta.

Actualmente, ella tiene dos hijos con su esposo quien también trabaja como cambista. Por las mañanas, Angélica se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, preparando principalmente los alimentos para sus hijos, aún escolares.

Ella y su esposo, a parte de gozar del ingreso económico de su oficio de cambista, tienen dos autos que los alquilan para ser trabajados como taxis. Con este negocio tienen muchas expectativas, pues esperan comprar dentro de poco dos autos más para establecer su empresa de servicios de taxi.

loans.use: Invest more in her business

loans.name: Suliha

texts.id:
Since moving to Bali in 1994, Suliha has wanted to work, but she faced a reality that to find a job is very difficult. That was why then Suliha decided to open a booth to sell food. Up to now, Suliha is still running the business even though the income is not too big.

Suliha has to get up early in the morning everyday to go to Kerobokan Market to purchase the materials, and then cook them, and prepare everything before opening the booth at 7.00 am. Around this time, her booth is usually full with customers who have breakfast.

She uses the income from her business to pay her children’s tuition fee. She wants to improve her business in to a bigger one, that she expects to earn loan to increase her capital.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Sejak pindah ke Bali tahun 1994, Suliha berkeinginan bisa mendapat pekerjaan. Tetapi karena lapangan pekerjaan begitu sulit, dia akhirnya memutuskan untuk membuka warung makan. Sampai saat ini Suliha tetap menekuni usahanya ini meskipun penghasilan yang didapatnya tidak begitu besar. Setiap harinya, mulai pagi dia harus bangun untuk berbelanja bahan kebutuhan warungnya di Pasar Kerobokan. Setelah itu, dia pulang untuk memasak dan menyiapkan semuanya sebelum warungnya buka jam 07.00 pagi. Para pelanggannya biasa berdatangan pada pagi hari untuk sarapan sebelum mereka bekerja. Dari penghasilannya menjalankan usaha ini, dia bisa membayar biaya sekolah anaknya. Dia berkeinginan untuk mengembangkan usahanya menjadi lebih besar. Karena itu dia sangat mengharapkan diberi bantuan modal usaha.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is fifty six years old. She is married and is the mother of three children. Of her three children, two have completed polytechnique and the third is in senior high school. She is a petty trader, and she firmly believes in hard work and dedication to her craft which, according to her, is the secret to her business' success.

More specifically, for the past twenty years, she has been a retailer of eggs and soft drinks and has generated a nice stream of income for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy a larger supply of maize and eggs in order to better serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in her country.

She is a member of the trust group called God is Able. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure so that the group members properly repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To better serve her customers' needs and to meet their demands by purchasing maize and eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Mujeres De Debora Group

texts.en:
Lucelia C. runs a small cafeteria in the little community of Llano De Perre, Dominican Republic. As a single mother of three, the income from this mini-restaurant is the livelihood of her family. She sought out Esperanza to help her with her first ever loan, valuing $150. The money that Lucelia gets from this loan will go towards purchasing bread, meat, oil, and fresh fruit to make smoothies at her local venue. In typical Dominican fashion, her favorite dish is rice, beans, and chicken, a customer favorite as well. She dreams of one day being able to travel outside of the country with her three children.

Lucelia is one of the leaders of the 15-person micro-bank Mujeres de Debora. Many of the women in this 15-person bank have recently immigrated from Haiti in search of a better future. Their businesses are simple, but offer a stream of income that could never have been accomplished without such a loan for initial capital. Several of the women sell clothes and shoes in the street, while others go from office to office vending fresh fruit and vegetables daily. These unique entrepreneurs have united in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.

The concept of this group bank repaying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the other members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together. As these 15 entrepreneurs embark upon their first ever loan from Esperanza, we are confident that they will all succeed in bettering their lives and the lives of their families with this loan.

On behalf of Lucelia C., the Mujeres de Debora group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, where your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase meat, bread, fruit, and a blender for a small restaurant

loans.name: Thuy

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thi Thủy 41 tuổi, vất vả hơn các chị em khác trong địa phương, hạnh phúc gia đình đến với chị không lâu dài, khi xây dựng gia đình trong cuộc sông nảy sinh nhiều mâu thuận có nhiều vấn đề không hợp nhau nên vợ chồng chị đã phải chia tay, chị đã quyết định không đi bước nữa mà ở vậy nuôi con. Năm 1997 chị tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi,  ban đầu chị tập chung vào chăn nuôi lợn sau quá trình chăn nuôi lợn chị đã phát triển dần và mua được 1 con trâu phục vụ cho nông nghiệp. Tới đây chị muốn đầu tư vốn chăn nuôi lợn nái, con chị hiện đã lớn và đi làm thu nhâp 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn nái.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Thuy is 41 years old. She had a harder life than most women, and her family's happiness was short-lived. She and her husband had encountered too many contradictions trying to build their lives together, so they parted ways. She decided not to remarry and stayed single taking care of her child. She joined the fund in 1997 and borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. After raising pigs she was able to make enough money and bought a water buffalo to use in her farming business. Now she wants to invest in raising sows. Her child is now grown and working, making average 93 USD per month. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 625 USD to invest in her sow raising business. Average monthly income 312 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Abdujalol

texts.en:
Abdujalol J. is 31 years old. He is married with two children of school-age for whom he works very hard. His wife is a homemaker. Abdujalol processes and sells dried apricots. Having been working in this kind of business for 4 years, he has gained rich experience.

Abdujalol purchases apricots from farmers and after processing them he resells them in the market. Because he buys apricots wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for customers of different means. All this allows Abdujalol to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for the family.

Abdujalol wants his children to be well-educated and with this purpose in mind, he wishes to send them to better schools. To be able to do that, today Abdujalol is requesting 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) for a term of 12 months. He is going to spend his loan purchasing more dried apricots with the purpose of processing and selling them. Abdujalol expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots to increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 42 años, es madre de 7 hijos, los cuales  son su razón de seguir adelante, es una mujer muy activa, pues muy aparte de tener su negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, trabaja en un hospedaje muy reconocido en la región, pero cuando está de vacaciones y en sus ratos libres, Mery se dedica a fondo a la venta de abarrotes, es madre soltera, por eso que trabaja duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su deseo es ser mayoritaria de abarrotes, para esto requiere de un capital para el incremento de su mercadería, dinero que la incentivará a lograr sus metas en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Mery is 42 years of age. She is the mother of 7 children who are her reason for getting ahead. She is a very active woman. Apart from having her business selling groceries and primary need products, she works in a very well-known lodge in the region, but when she is on vacation and in her free time, she works in the sale of groceries. She is a single mother. For this reason, she works hard to get her children ahead. Her hope is to sell groceries the majority of the time. For this, she needs capital to increase her merchandise, money that will encourage her to succeed in her goals in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products she sells in her shop.

loans.name: Mily

texts.es:
La señora Mily, socia del BC Mujeres Activas, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Tiene 37 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus con dos hijos que aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguía No 298. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal, el cual le ha ayudado a crecer en su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en  6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes y otros productos que tienen mayor rotación, de esa manera podrá surtir bien su negocio y sus clientes encontrarán lo que buscan. 

Mily manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante. Desea crecer en su negocio y piensa ampliarlo con la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Mily is a member of communal bank Mujeres Activas. She lives in the San Martin region in the province and district of Bellavista. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are still dependent on her. Mily dedicates herself to selling groceries. Her business is located in her home at Jr. Augusto B. Leguia No 298. She has been working with the communal bank for five years and the bank had helped her expand her business. She will repay this loan of $975 in six months and will use the loan to purchase necessary products such as rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil, canned food in different sizes, toilet paper and other products. This will allow her to stock her business so that her clients can find what they are looking for. Mily wants to express that Manuela Ramos is a great support for her and her family as well as to other women that want to get ahead. Mily wants her business to grow and is thinking of expanding it by also selling clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, milk, oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Tausi E Group

texts.en:
Siwa S., age 40, is married with four children ages 14, 12, 10 and 8. She sells plastic shoes and some plates and bowls. She started her business six months ago and works daily from 8am until 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $40. Siwa hopes for a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase on the stock of her shoes.

Siwa will share this loan with subgroup E of the Tausi group. The subgroup has six members who run shops, have salons, and sell clothes and soft drinks. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Siwa is first on the left, standing

loans.use: To increase on her stock of plastic shoes.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie R., 42, has 4 children and presently resides in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has been a member of Pag-asa Center since June 2006. She has received several types of loan and recently she applied for PHP 15,000 to support her husband's farming activities. The family is cultivating a small parcel of land, and in order to have a good yield, fertilizer and insecticides are what they need.

Elsie's husband never gets tired of finding means to make a living. He also does fishing using their own "banca" (small boat). Their daily consumption is no longer a worry for the family. The couple also have a piggery where they focus on breeding pigs.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative gave a glimpse of hope for their different business ventures since they want to expand their piggery and develop their rice field. Slowly they have been able to save for their children's studies, and they hope to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 29 years old and her husband, Mr. Teun Cheunis, is 30 years old. They both currently live in Kandal Province, where they make a living as garment workers for a garment factory. The couple is responsible for one lively child who is a minor and is enrolled in school.

To earn extra income, S. and her husband hope to have a suitable investment to invest in. In order to make that possible, they would like to ask for a loan of $800 from HKL. They will use the loan to purchase rice to store and then re-sell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice to store and then re-sell for a profit

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum C. is 34 years old and lives with her husband in the Bati district of Takeo province. She is a farmer who grows and sells rice to earn a living. She makes around $1 a day. Her husband earns about $5 a day driving a motor-taxi. She and her husband have five children. Mrs. Sum would like to take out a loan to raise pigs and to make rice wine.

loans.use: To raise pigs and make rice wine

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve M. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Eve is 35 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees for the children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle is a 53 year old woman who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. Giselle has owned a shop for fourteen years. Giselle sells beauty products, faux bijoux and accessories.

Giselle requested a loan of $1500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop, like faux bijoux. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loan helped her improve her business. Giselle is speciA. because she has a nice variety of accessories and knows how to treat her clients. Her customers are friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulty. Giselle decided on doing her business because she likes it and wanted to be independent. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by selling souvenirs and gifts.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
La vivienda del señor Julián R. necesita nuevos acabados exteriores principalmente la pintura, sin embargo no tiene disponible capital para llevar a cabo su objetivo, él se encargará de realizar la mejora; ya que se dedica a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas. 
La familia de Don Julián se compone de cuatro hijos, siendo ellos la primera causa de su existencia y del esfuerzo constante para lograr darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
The exterior of Julián R.’s house is not finished. He does not have the money to buy the material. He will take charge of making the improvement. He does the construction and repairs on his house. Julián is a family man. He has four minor children, and he would like to give them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishings for the exterior of the house

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata A. is a 40-year-old mother of five children between the ages of 17 and 32. She has no grandchildren and is married to a farmer. She lives in Nyamasaria and would like a loan to purchase more seeds to plant and additional vegetables to sell. She is asking for 10,000 KSH.

Consolata recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy seeds and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
A medium-sized wooden house located in Kompong Cham Province belongs to Mrs. Chhem C., age 34, who has been establishing a family with the other family members. She is married with five children who are single, while her husband is a domestic construction worker. She currently earns a living as a local farmer, growing all kinds of vegetables in the village.

The family is facing difficulty with the roof of their house that frequently is cracking during the rainy season. Because of the seasonable problem, Chhem C. is looking for a loan on Kiva to buy zinc to cover their roof. The rest of the loan she will use for her farming business.

loans.use: To buy zinc to cover their roof

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Melita tiene 39 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija de 11 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro y gracias a su buena administración de las ganancias, ahora tiene dos motocarros, con el cual brinda trabajo como choferes a las personas que lo necesitan, además de fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Con las ganancias obtenidas de este negocio ha implementado un lavadero de autos y motocarros, donde también contrata a otras personas para la atención del mismo. Y sin quedarse atrás, Melita también invierte en otro negocio, que es la compra y venta de pescado, es abastecedora de los comerciantes de este producto del mercado de su localidad. Con estos tres negocios, Melita busca progresar y brindarle a su hija unos buenos estudios. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros son comprensivos y están pendientes de las necesidades de los demás, como también son responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita hará mantenimiento a sus motocarros, comprará mangueras para su lavadero y pescado para seguir abasteciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melita is 39 years old, is a single mother and lives with her 11 year old daughter in their own house. For the past 10 years she has worked transporting passengers in her motor-cart and thanks to the good administration of her earnings she now has two motor-carts with which she provides work as drivers to people who need it in addition to strengthening the economy of her home. With the earnings obtained from this business she has implemented a car and motor-cart wash that she also hires other people to run. And to not be left behind, Melita also invests in another business, the purchase and sale of fish, and she is the supplier of the sellers of this product in her community's market. With these three businesses Melita seeks to advance and provide her daughter with a good education. This is her 5th loan with MFP and what she likes about her communal bank is that all of the members are understanding and are aware of the needs of the others as well as being responsible with their payments. With the money that she is requesting she will do maintenance to her motor-carts and she will buy hoses for her car wash and fish to continue supplying her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her motor-carts and investment in other businesses

loans.name: Cirenia

texts.en: Cirenia E. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and has five adult children. Cirenia owns and operates a hog-fattening business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Cirenia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cirenia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feeds and other supplies. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia L. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has adult children. She is from the town of Benoni, Mahinog Camiguin. Alecia has been in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month.

In April 2009, Alecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Alecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional business capital. Alecia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dabawara 2 De (Dabawara Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe DABAWARA 2 de l’association DABAWARA  est constitué de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ayant en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture  de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener  à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le sorgho. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution  et tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 26  hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue à Marka-Coungo et Fana  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The group Dabawara 2 of the Dabawara association is composed of married women with an average age of 40 years old and four children.They live in polygamous families in Tingole, which is the administrative center of a rural town located in the prefecture of Fana, which is the second administrative region of the Mali republic. These women work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to help improve their winter business, which consists of the cultivation of sorgho and peanuts. This is their fifth loan through the institution, and all previous loans were repaid in full. With this new loan they hope to buy fertilizer, pesticides, basic tools and to pay the hoeing and labor fees necessary to maintain 26 hectares. Part of their harvest is saved for their own consumption and the rest is sold at the Marka-Coungo and Fana Markets to both male and female customers. They expect to make an average profit of 25 000 FCFA after the sale of their crop.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor and hoeing fees, fertilizer, pesticides, and basic tools

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn P. is 48 years old, a widow and has three children. She lives with her family in Takeo Province. To make a living, she sells fruit (largely mangoes) which she buys from people in her village or nearby communities. She commutes to the city everyday to sell her fruit, typically earning $13 per day. She also gets help from her children, who work in a local garment factory.

The financial crisis has made things difficult for businesses in Cambodia over the last year. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most, particularly people like Mrs. P.. In order to overcome her economic difficulties, P. wants to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike, which would allow her to increase her income by making it easier to gather items and carry them around.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ayele

texts.fr: Madame Ayélé est une revendeuse ambulante de pagnes de différentes catégories dans le quartier d’Atiégou à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un enseignant d’une école primaire et privée ; le couple a 04 enfants à leur charge. C’est pour soutenir financièrement son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants que cette dame a pris la décision en 2004 de se lancer dans la vente de pagnes. Elle vend le plus souvent de maison en maison ; aujourd’hui elle dispose d’une clientèle non négligeable. Pour renouveler son stock de pagnes, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter au Grand Marché de Lomé 20 pagnes Phoenix, 25 pagnes Sosso et 15 pagnes Hitarget.
texts.en:
Ms. Ayélé is an itinerant retailer of different categories of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) in the Atiégou district in Lomé.  She is married to a teacher at a private primary school;  the couple has four children to support.  Supporting her husband financially to educate their children is why this lady decided to embark upon selling pagnes in 2004.  Usually she sells by going from house to house; today she has a customer base that is not insignificant.  To renew her stock of pagnes, she's requesting a WAGES loan to go to the Grand Market in Lomé to buy several lengths of pagnes:  20 lengths of Phoenix brand , 25 of Sosso, and 15 of Hitarget.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy traditional cloth

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane J. is currently in the business of selling cold drinks in her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase another refrigerator to keep more drinks cold. Jane is 28 years old and is married to a husband who works as a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase another refrigerator to keep drinks cold

loans.name: Gloria Milena

texts.es: Gloria Milena A. D. T. resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Con tan solo 24 años D. edad Gloria ya es madre D. su primogénito llamado Walter D. 5 años D. edad, el esposo D. Gloria vive con ella y trabaja. Gloria muy consciente D. la difícil situación económica ha decido trabajar; y es así como atienD. D. su negocio en el mercado municipal D. Ahuachapán, donD. venD. variedad D. medicina popular, es decir sin necesidad D. prescripción médica, el crédito que solicita Gloria es para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria Milena A. D. T. lives in the Ahuachapán department. Gloria is only 24, and she has a five year old son, Walter. Gloria’s husband lives with her, and he works. Gloria is very well aware of the difficult economic situation, and she has decided to work. That is why she works at her business in the Ahuachapán municipal market. She sells a variety of popular medicines. That is to say, over the counter medicine. The loan that Gloria is asking for is to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour is 29 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a civil servant. She sells food spices like tomato paste, garlic, curry, etc. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profit during this season. She hopes to own a grocery stall in the future. She hopes for a loan of N120,000 to purchase more food spices to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food spices to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Almost everybody dreams of having a better future and uplifting their family's living conditions. One of those dreamers is Rosie R.. She says that she will do her best to meet the needs of her children. She and her husband are helping each other to be successful. Her husband is busy in the field while Rosie operates an eatery business – she sells food for lunches and snacks. Also, she has a small hog-raising business.

Rosie manages her business well because she knows that she can achieve her dreams with her profits. Her business is the key to fulfilling her dreams for her children. She wants her children to finish their education to alleviate their poverty. She believes that giving her children a good education is the best that she can do. Rosie wants to borrow 10,000 Philippine pesos for business capital.

loans.use: For business capital

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabali est composé de femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 26 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux et résident dans le quartier Massabla-coura de la ville de Bougouni qui relève de la 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des relations de commerce et essentiellement du commerce de condiments alimentaires. 
Dans l’intention de développer leur commerce en se constituant plus de stocks enfin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 20boites de 2kg de concentrée de tomate, 8 sacs de 25kg de sel de cuisine, 15 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et diverses autres qualités de condiments alimentaires. 
Les produits sont achetés auprès des grossistes de Bamako pour être revendus ensuite en détail dans le marché de Bougouni. Leur clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes et les condiments sont vendus au comptant ou à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes envisagent obtenir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA par mois qui sera réutilisé dans leur activité.
texts.en:
This Sabali group is composed of married women who have an average age of 26 and on average, 2 children. They live in nuclear families with their children and spouses in the Massabla-Coura neighborhood of the town of Bougouni which comes under the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

These women met through their businesses; they all essentially sell condiments. In the intention of developing their businesses and stocking up so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan; the preceding loan was correctly reimbursed.

With this loan, they intend to buy 20 tins of 2 kg each of tomato paste, 8 sacks of 25 kg of cooking salt, 15 packs of 100 individual Maggi cubes, and various other condiments. The products are bought from wholesalers in Bamako and are sold retail in the market at Bougouni. Their clientele is essentially composed of women, and the condiments are sold for cash or on credit. Each of the women expects to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA with this loan. The profit will be reinvested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for resale

loans.name: Value Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the group called 'Value Group' who have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 2,000,000 (or SLL 500,000 each). They are small-scale businesswomen who want a loan in order to further improve their businesses by adding more goods to their current stock. In this way, their living standard will improve, they can better provide for their children in terms of feeding, clothing them, and paying their school fees. 


Mamusu on the left is the leader of this group. Mamusu is approximately forty-five years of age, a widow with three children. Mamusu has been selling 'gara' clothes (locally dyed clothes) for many countless years. She will use this loan to further expand her business by buying lengths of white cotton, inks, caustic soda, powder and paying experts to make designs on the white cotton.

loans.use: Buy working materials like white cotton, inks, caustic soda, powder and pay designers to decorate the cloth

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su hijo en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su único hijo la llevó a empezar hace cinco años un negocio de comercio de ropa de manera ambulatoria. Gracias a los ahorros de su negocio pudo comprarse una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utlizado en el transporte de carga y de pasajeros) con la cual obtiene una ayuda importante para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Este vehículo es manejado por su hijo, brindando servicios dentro de la ciudad y en los pueblos aledaños.

Debido al tiempo de uso otorgado a la mototaxi y al estado accidentado de los caminos que comunican Lambayeque con sus pueblos, esta ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren urgente reparación. Por otro lado María desea ampliar sus ventas en esta temporada navideña pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción. Por estos motivos se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan brindarle reparación y mantenimiento a su unidad móvil y comprar más mercadería para ampliar su negocio.

Su más grande anhelo es ver convertido a su hijo en un profesional por lo que se encuentra juntando el dinero suficiente para inscribirlo en una universidad local. Ella es una mujer luchadora que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old, single and lives with her son in Lambayeque, 20 minutes outside of Chiclayo (Peru.)

The need to move the life of her only son forward brought her to start a mobile clothes-selling business five years ago. Thanks to the savings of her business, she was able to buy a "mototaxi" (a vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers,) with which she gets important support in the sustenance of her home. This vehicle is driven by her son, who offers his service inside of the city and in nearby towns.

The mototaxi now urgently needs repairs because use over time and the broken-down roads that connect Lambayeque with the near-by towns. On the other hand, Maria wants to increase her clothing sales this Christmas season, but she does not have the capital needed to do so. Consequently, she has seen it as necessary to ask for a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. This will allow her to send the mototaxi for repair and maintenance and buy more merchandise to enhance her business. Her greatest longing is to see her son as a professional and she is looking to collect the necessary money to register him in a local university. She is a fighter who has known how to move forward despite of difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of repairing their motorcycle taxi and purchase of clothing for sale

loans.name: Asoleaga

texts.en:
Asoleaga I. is 39 and married with 7 children (ages 8 - 19 years).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish . Asoleaga has many years of experience in this business.  Asoleaga needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 255 tala or US $106 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Asoleaga joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Asoleaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Asoleaga I. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.55 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.64 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Mrs. Ith U. is a 57-year-old farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice in Trapeang Chrey village, Takeo province. She is the mother of five children: three are employed in the garment factory and the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. San Chhou, is a construction worker who has a small salary to support his family. 

Although this couple works hard, they do not earn enough income to support the family. So, Mrs. Ith U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motorbike taxi driver to increase their income and improve their standard of living. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motorbike taxi driver

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
En la localidad de Quiindy en el Barrio San Lorenzo distante a 23km de la oficina de Carapeguá unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. 

Estas Señoras son activas la y todas de dedican a una actividad independiente así como al comercio de productos de la canasta familiar, confección de ropas, artesanía. 
Ellas buscando un poco más de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
En caso de la Sra, Juana Q. quien se dedica a la negocio de ventas de todo tipo de productos de la canasta basica familiar como fideos, panificados, leche, azucar, arroz y otros. El crédito que ella solicitó lo invertirá para la compra de estos productos. 
El negocio es muy visitado por todos sus vecinos y  la venta de sus productos es bastante buena, y esto ayuda a que la alimentación de su familia se sustente con los ingresos del negocio.
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual
texts.en:
In the Quiindy section of the neighborhood of Barrio San Lorenzo, 23 km from Carapegúa, some women of scarce resources found out about the Committee of Businesswomen program and decided to meet to receive information about the above-mentioned program.

These women are active, and they all work in independent businesses including the sale of traditional basket products, garment production, artisan work.

They are looking for a little more support through credit to boost their family incomes and improve their quality of life.

In the case of Juana Q., she works in the sale of various kinds of products from traditional baskets to noodles, bread, milk, sugar, rice and others. The loan that she requests will be invested in these products.

Her business is frequented by all the neighbors and the sale of her products is quite good. This helps her to feed her family and sustain them with the earnings from her business.

They need credit from this operation to invest in their respective work in order to achieve sustainable growth so that they can grow as a group and in their individual manners.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as meat, rice, noodles, clothes, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
For a poor woman like Genoveva B. growing a business is quite hard, especially when what she makes in a day is barely enough to provide for her  family's needs. Moreover, Genoveva is the sole provider for her two dependent children.  Her eldest daughter is 26 years old and unemployed because of low educational attainment, and Genoveva's youngest is still in school and soon will be in high school which means she will be incurring more expenses for her education.

Though Genoveva was able to successfully repay the loan she took out last year, she chose not to increase the amount of loan she is requesting now. She plans to use this loan to buy rice for resale.  The basis for the small amount she has requested is her capacity to pay. Hopefully someday, her eldest daughter will be able to help Genoveva in her business, or will find a job and be able to help with the family's expenses. 

Despite the poverty her family suffers presently, Genoveva still hopes that someday their standard of living be changed.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Lolita's Group

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the village of Cabgan, Pta. Miray Baliangao. Lolita is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Lolita is married and has three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a hog-fattening business venture in the agriculture sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling her pigs. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional piglets. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
