Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mrs. Kosal I. (in the picture), is a widow with two sons. One of her sons is an electrician and the other one weaves silk at home. She lives on an island on the Mekong River approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Kosal has been a silk weaver since she was 20 years old. Previously, she was part of a group loan that included two families and she was the group leader. Now she is asking for another individual loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is still new in his retail business as he has run his shop for only seven months. He takes care of his four-year-old son after separating from his wife.

Ben was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He wants to boost his business and that is the reason he has applied for this loan. He will buy dry foodstuffs in bulk to stock his shop. This will include maize and wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat.

Ben hopes to grow his business and even move to wholesale one day.

loans.use: To buy dry foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en: Sarmila M. lives with her husband and two sons in Thecho, Lalitpur, a fast-growing part of Nepal. Her older son is studying in the fifth grade and her younger son is in pre-school. Mrs. M. and her husband, Saroj M., earn a living making different types of traditional brass religious idols. She used a previous loan from Kiva to buy raw materials to make additional items to sell. Now she is applying for a new loan for the same purpose because she is committed to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Ña Agustina tiene 58 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos que también emplean sus esfuerzos en la actividad de sus padres. 
Se dedica en el alquiler de sillas, mesas, manteles, vajillas, cubiertos, salón, para eventos sociales como cumpleaños infantiles, quince años, reuniones de todo tipo etc., hace mas 10 años que esta en esta actividad.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo renovar los manteles y una parte de las vajillas, manteniendo en forma se muestran atractivos y presentables toda su decoración y ampliar así su demanda.
texts.en:
Doña Agustina is 58 years old, married, and has two children who help with her business. She manages a rental business where she provides chairs, tables, tablecloths, dishes, cutlery, and a location for social events such as children’s birthday parties, quinceañeras, reunions, and other occasions. Agustina has been in business for more than ten years.

With this loan from Fundación Paraguaya, she will be able to replace her tablecloths and some of her dishes because it is important to maintain an attractive and presentable setting so that she can increase demand for her service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tablecloths & dishes

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with one son who is working. Her husband works as a land officer. Mwanasiti owns a home with electricity and piped water. Her greatest expenses are electricity and water bills.

For the past thirteen years, Mwanasiti has been selling fruit juice as well as firewood to her neighbors. Her other sources of income are her husband's salary, house rent and selling milk from her cows. With this KES 40,000 loan, she hopes to buy more passion fruits and also a lorry of firewood. 

Mwanasiti faces the challenge of seasonality as the demand for her products is lower during the rainy season than hot weather. She decided to join Yehu because of the support it offers to women and the issuing of small loans without strong collateral.

loans.use: to buy passion fruits and one full lorry of firewood

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel G. is from the village of  Port Area, Iligan City. She is 24 years old, single, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $115 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Liezel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sangmahmad

texts.en:
M. Sangmahmad has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure, from a young age that his family never goes without daily bread. He is married with two children. Sangmahmad has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff. With a starting capital of $400 USD, and perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 5 years ago. He has expanded his business and today his family helps him with the business. Today he needs to buy additional foodstuff to increase the variety of his products. For this purpose, Sangmahmad is requesting a loan of $1500 USD. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.   
      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase supplies of foodstuff for increase the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy N. is 43 years old, single, and has three children aged between 11 and 14 years old. She sells food and fruit to walk-in customers in the city centre and her business is well known by the name Tutus Cafe. She has been in this business for the last five years.
Lucy says that business is very good and profitable. The only major challenge she has is lack of enough food supplies to make food for customers. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business does well. Lucy is taking a loan of 50,000 KES to replenish her stock of food items to enable her to make enough food to satisfy her customers' needs. In the future, she sees herself opening a hotel. She describes herself as hardworking and busy.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to make food for customers

loans.name: Arlyne

texts.en:
Arlyne D. is from the village of Brgy. Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Arlyne owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Arlyne has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Arlyne joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Arlyne is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Arlyne from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mrs. Sean K., who was born in 1975, lives in Pnov village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhornh Meas, are farmers who own four hectares of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a palm juice collector.

Because her field is infertile soil Mrs. Sean K. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will hire a plow machine to plow her field and hire farming laborers to grow rice.

She is a mother of five children. Two are seamstresses in a garment factory, one is a policeman, and two are in school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia R. R. es una mujer muy sabia, que conoce perfectamente que estrategias poner en marcha en cada momento de su vida, especialmente en lo que se refiere a su  negocio; al principio se dedicaba al comercio de prendas de oro, pero cuando se encareció esta mercancía y las ventas empezaron a descender y a generar menos utilidades, se dedicó a ir cambiando gradualmente su actividad, justamente con los mismos clientes que había ganado con la venta de joyas; así fue como inició vendiendo  legumbres, como lentejas, frijoles y también  arroz y aceite entre vecinos,  hasta que gradualmente fue atrayendo mas clientes y con ellos mas pedidos, generando la necesidad de aumentar la inversión, por eso hace ya siete años acudió a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado con cuatro financiamientos, con los que ha logrado diversificar sus productos y mejorar sus tiempos, incluyendo carne de cerdo los fines de semana,  productos lácteos todos los días y víveres dos veces por semana.  Todo este apoyo, su disciplina e interés de crecimiento, ha logrado   mejoría en todos los aspectos de su vida; con sus 68 años sueña con    aumentando el volumen de ventas y sus ganancias día a día, aunque la competencia es su máximo desafío y siempre la obliga a recurrir a  estrategias mercadologicas para permitirle  sostener sus clientes. Su credikiva es su quinto financiamiento con la organización, con él comprará arroz, harina, leche en polvo, pastas, productos de aseo y legumbres para surtir nuevamente su negocio y seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo y con él su sueño de continuar siendo exitosa.
texts.en:
Nidia R. R. is a very wise woman who knows exactly what strategies to implement in every moment of her life; especially in regards to her business. She started out selling gold jewelry, but when the price of gold rose, sales began to decline and profits fell, so she changed her merchandise. The same customers that she had sold jewelry to, she started selling them vegetables such as lentils, beans, rice, and oil. She gradually attracted more customers and more orders, creating a need for increased investment. Thus, seven years ago, Nidia went to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organization that has supported her with four loans. She succeeded in diversifying her products and improving timeliness to market. For example, she sells pork on weekends, dairy products every day, and food supplies twice a week. With all the support of FMSD, Nidia's discipline and interest in growing her business has improved all aspects of her life. At 68 years old, she dreams of increasing sales volume and profits every day. Competition is her main obstacle and she is always forced to use marketing strategies to hold on to her customers. This is Nidia's fifth loan with FMSD. She will buy rice, flour, powdered milk, pasta, toiletries, and vegetables to supply her business and increase her working capital. With this loan, her dream of continued success will be realized.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, powdered milk, pasta, toiletries, and vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Ntara Multipurpose Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
Enterprising and trustworthy T. Patrick of Ntara multi purpose group and aged 35, started up his hardware business over 2 years ago dealing in general building merchandise. Being strategically located in Ntara trading centre Ibanda, he gets many customers, earning him a profit of 400.000 Ugandan shillings monthly.  Patrick employs two casual labourers who help him with work in the shop, like lifting cement bags and iron bars. His main drawback is having small stock that cannot match the demand from the customers.

With this loan, he hopes to buy more stock of goods for the business, and this will help him expand business market and also earn more sales revenue to cater for the requirements of his family, educate his children, and also be able to progress economically.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the business.

loans.name: La Peñita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la Peñita porque la comunidad en donde viven las integrantes está rodeada de peñas, todas las mujeres de este grupo se conocen entre sí, son amigas desde hace mucho tiempo, decidieron formar el grupo. 
La señora Justina García se dedica la elaboración de zapatos, trabajando en equipo con su familia. Ella con el señor Fortunato Gómez Escalona y con uno de sus hijos, hacen: botines, bota de cierre, bota de escaramuza (jalisca), mocasín, choclo y botín con suela de tractor, venden al mayoreo y menudeo. El proceso de elaboración consta de los siguientes pasos: compra de materia prima, cortar la piel, coser, montar, acabado y diseño.  La señora Justina se dedica a los dos últimos, a hacer los acabados y el diseño de los zapatos.

El negocio se ha transmitido de generación en generación a través de la familia del señor Fortunato, es la tercera generación que se ha dedicado al negocio. Gracias al negocio sus hijos son profesionistas y uno de ellos piensa continuar con el negocio familiar, y en un futuro llegar a exportar sus productos.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Peñita” (The Little Cliff) because the community where the members live is surrounded by cliffs.  All the women in the group know each other; they have been friends for a long time and decided to form the group.

Mrs. Justina García manufactures shoes.  She and her family work as a team.  She and Mr. Fortunato Gómez Escalona with one of their children make ankle boots, laced boots, riding boots, moccasins, slippers and ankle boots with rubber tire soles.  They are both wholesalers and retailers.  The manufacturing process consists in the following steps: purchase raw materials, cut the leather, sew, assemble, finish and design.  Justina does the last two of these steps: she makes the finishings and the designs on the shoes.

The business has been passed down from generation to generation through Fortunato’s family.  This is the third generation in the business.  Thanks to the business their children are professionals and one of them plans to continue with the family business and in the future even export their products.

loans.use: To invest in the family shoemaking business.

loans.name: Sade

texts.en:
Sade is a married woman with two children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated her mat weaving business for over five years and sells to her neighbours from home. Sade faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to be self reliant in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 loan she wants to purchase weaving materials for weaving mats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for weaving mats for sale.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Хусаинова Зарина проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 32 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж на заработках в России. Сама Зарина имеет среднее образование. После отъезда мужа занялась бизнесом. Сейчас она арендует торговую точку на центральном рынке района, где продает детскую и женскую одежду. Зарина в основном привозит товар из города. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Zarina H. lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 32 years old, married and has 2 children.  Her husband works in Russia.  Zarina has a secondary education.  She started her own business after her husband left for work.  Currently, she leases a retail outlet at the district's central market, where she sells children's and women's clothing.  Zarina primarily brings her merchandise from the city.  She has been involved in this business for 4 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is a life long resident of Gyumri, located in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is a widower and he has no children. Gurgen has a high school education and has been running a small bakery for the past four years. Previously, he had been employed as a cook.  

Microfinance has enabled Gurgen to expand his business. His dream is to diversify his business in to other food processing goods. Gurgen also helps his extended family with his baked goods. He would like a loan to buy equipment in order to expand his production levels. This investment should increase his income by around 25 percent. He really enjoys being a baker and owning his own business.

loans.use: To purchase bakery equipment.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim S. is a 58-year-old widowed mother in Phnom Penh City. She has a son who currently lives with her in the family home. Her son is employed as a worker in a private factory and is also a bicycle repairman. Kim S. has been working as a primary school teacher for more than ten years in her community. She also provides a vehicle parking service in the school, which fetches her up to $7 a day. Kim S. said that her old motorbike has broken down and she spends much time repairing the vehicle. To reduce repair cost, she would like to request s loan from Kiva to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to replace a broken one.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 45 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijos que son menores de edad, y estudian en el colegio; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 3 años, esta empeñosa mujer se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, y ofrece durante todos los días en  sus ratos libres, a sus amigas y conocidas que suelen comprarle sus cosméticos con regular frecuencia. Le gusta mucho su trabajo  pues es tranquilo ya que le permite realizar sin problemas sus labores del hogar. Es así que, mientras camina o recoge a sus hijos del colegio va ofreciendo mediante el catalogo los productos; pero afirma que le disgusta cuando sus compradoras se atrasan en el pago puntual de los productos. Así transcurren los días de esta trabajadora mujer, muy dedicada que busca  brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos; y ya tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un  pequeño bazar, donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y también útiles escolares y juguetes. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que les permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en productos de belleza, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes que espera concretar para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 45 years old and she lives in her own home in the company of her three young children. They are all in school. Together they work hard every day to come out ahead. For the past three years, this enterprising woman has been selling beauty products of a well known brand name. And she sells every day during her spare time to her friends and acquaintances. They look to buy from her regularly. She enjoys the work because it is at a comfortable pace, permitting her to do her housework. When she walks to pick up her kids at school she makes her sales on the way, offering products from a catalogue. But she says she doesn't appreciate when the buyers get behind on their payments. This is how this enterprising woman spends her days. She is very devoted and she looks to provide her children with a good quality of life. She has many plans for the future. She wants to install a bazaar from where to sell her products in addition to school supplies and toys. This is the second loan she has requested through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making her payments on time. She doesn't want to cause any trouble for those individuals who are making this possible for her, allowing her to keep progressing in her work. Rosa's plans are to invest the loan requested in the purchase of beauty products. She has several orders that have been placed. Filling these orders will help her increase her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Carmen Luz; La socia tiene 51 años D. edad, es viuda  y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a prestar el servicio D. movilidad, la socia tiene una combi y la autorización D. transporte para llevar niños D. la escuela a la casa y viceversa, la socia también se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa para adultos, ella trae cada cierto tiempo en vacaciones escolares ropa D. la ciudad D. Lima D. las fábricas al por mayor y las venD. a sus amistades y amigos en general, la socia ahora requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ropa , ella estará pronta a viajar a la ciudad D. Lima y traer ropa para adultos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ropa.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Eternal Father" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

Her name is Carmen Luz, and she is 51 years old. She is a widow and has 2 children. Her work is providing transportation services. She has a van and has authorization to transport children to school and back home. She also works buying and selling clothing for adults. On certain occasions, during school vacations, she goes to the city of Lima and buys clothes on a wholesale basis, which she sells to her friends and acquaintances. She currently requires a loan to invest in buying clothing. She will soon be able to travel to the city of Lima and bring back clothing for adults. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying clothing. 

The borrower is happy with the loan offered to her, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Investing in clothing to sell

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores: ella cría cerdos, ovejas y aves domésticas en unos ambientes situados cerca a su domicilio, una vez que estos alcanzan un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta en el mercado D. su localidad. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo, que es profesor, con el sostenimiento D. la economía diaria D. su familia.

Genoveva desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado D. modo que sus animales se desarrollen D. mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 52 years old and married.  She lives with her family in the agricultural district of TambogranD.. This zone has a semitropical climate, and is mainly known for producing fruits like mangos and lemons. It belongs to the Piura province, and it is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells small animals.  She raises pigs, sheep, and poultry in some areas that are close to her home.  Once they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale in the local market.  The business serves to help her husband, a teacher, with the family’s daily finances.

Genoveva wishes to expand her business by purchasing more animals.  She also wants to buy balanced feed so that her animals develop in the best way and can be sold for a better price.  In order to achieve her objective, she believes it is advisable to request a loan of 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has nine children, five of whom are currently in school. Josephine has a garment shop, which she has run for over ten years.
To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 1,700,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials for making clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Josephine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making clothes for resale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok K., 52, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about $2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $5 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a weaving machine to start a new business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a weaving machine to start a new business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old. Lolita is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel, de 54 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa Sara  y tres hijos Josué de 7 años, Ana de 6 y Gamalie de 2 años de edad. Él se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, negocio que administra hace 10 años, surgió por la necesidad de poseer ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, el horario inicia desde 4:00am hasta las 2:00pm, trabajando únicamente dos días a la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos, ya que quiere aumentar la mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes más variedad, esta inversión mejorara su condición de comerciante, será más competente.
El objetivo de don Miguel es continuar trabajando fuerte para mantener a su familia y sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
Miguel is 54 years old and lives in Corinto, in Morazán department, together with his wife Sara and his three children: 7 year-old Josué, 6 year-old Ana and 2 year-old Gamalie.  Miguel's business is selling small electrical appliances.  He has been in this business for 10 years.  He started the business because he needed to make income in order to cover his family's needs.  He works from 4.00am to 2.00pm, two days a week.

Miguel is currently requesting a loan to buy electrical appliances as he would like to increase his merchandise so that he can offer his customers more variety.  This investment will improve his situation as a salesman and he will be more competitive.

Miguel's goal is to continue working hard in order to support his family and get them ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy small electrical appliances

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyz S., 39, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in Kochkor village, is married and has three young children. Her husband is a member of the local farmers’ community and since 1994 they have both been involved in farming and cattle breeding. The main challenge for Jyldyz is to devote the needed attention to both her children and her business. The couple enriched the family assets with a purchase of cattle for their farm. Jyldyz plans to spend this loan on purchasing more cattle for breeding and reselling.  

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel O. O. is a 33-year-old single man. He rears poultry so as to earn a living. He has been in the business for 11 years. So far, he has employed two people in his family.  

Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he is able to save his money with a group. Most of all, he is able get a loan easily. He hopes to open a big poultry farm in the future. He has requested 50,000 KES to add laying hens and enlarge the poultry house.

loans.use: to buy laying hens and enlarge the poultry house

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouma, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 29 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dosouma, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de pâte d’arachide, de galettes, de condiments alimentaires et de savons.                                                                                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouma sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de l’arachide, du mil, des condiments et du savon.                                                                        
SIRADJE F. compte acheter de l’arachide avec les revendeurs sur place et dans les environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place après transformation en pâte d’arachide au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en: The women of the Sabougnouma group are all married with a mean age of 29 and an average of three children.  They all live in traditional families in the village of N'Dosouma, under the prefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They met through family relationships, neighbors and friendships.  They sell peanut butter, pastries, condiments and soaps.  The women of the Sabougnouma group are in their first joint loan which will be used to purchase peanuts, millet, condiments and soap.  Siradje F. plans to purchase peanuts with the resellers both locally and in the surrounding areas.  She makes her sales daily after processing them into into peanut butter and she accepts both cast and credit from a clientele composed primarily of women.  She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA which she will be use to make her loan payments and social ceremony contributions and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase peanuts

loans.name: Josy

texts.en:
Josy is 43 years old and married with four school-aged children. She is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. To make a living, Josy owns and operates a business making and selling food. Her main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes and bibingka in the local community. Josy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Josy joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional ingredients and provide working capital. Josy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients such as sugar, flour, and rice. This is the second loan taken out by Josy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as sugar, flour, and rice

loans.name: Graciela Concepción

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos. Estudio  hasta  3ro de secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de artesanía como bordados, venta de granos de la región y frutas, cuenta que los bordados los lleva a la Isla los Uros y a la localidad de Juli.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles comprará diez sacos de papa. En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo quien es albañil.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y dice que los préstamos de Manuela le dan suerte.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of "3 de Mayo" community bank, located in Ilave district in the province of El Collao and the department of Puno. She is 46 years old and lives with her husband and her four children. Graciela completed formal education through the third year of secondary school.

She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she invested in her grocery business. Graciela is now selling hand-embroidered textiles, staple grains and fruit. She travels to Isla los Uros and Juli to sell the embroidery.

With this loan of 1,000 PEN, Graciela will buy ten sacks of potatoes. She and her husband, a construction worker, work together in business activities. Graciela's dream is to improve her house for better quality of life. She likes attending the bank's meetings and says the loans from Movimiento Manuela Ramos bring her good luck.

loans.use: To buy ten sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 32 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a machine to copy keys, a blowtorch for soldering, etc., for his locksmith workshop.

loans.name: Juan Benjamin

texts.es: El Sr. Juan de 40 años, con un  hijo y su esposa,  tiene ya  5 años dedicándose a la elaboración de zapatitos para niñas, realiza su trabajo en el domicilio de sus padres ya que actualmente se encuentra viviendo con ellos. El Sr.  Juan   se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido al crecimiento apresurado de su negocio ya que incluso los clientes le piden que realice calzados para mujeres, es cliente nuevo  de la institución, con el dinero del  crédito compra de maquina de costura, cuerina, plantillas, cartón, etc. para la fabricación y confección de las zapatillas, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old and has a wife and son.  He has been making little shoes for girls for five years.  He carries out his work in his parents' home as he is currently living with them.  Juan found himself needing to request a loan from our institution owing to the quick growth of his business as his customers are asking him to make women's footwear too.

Juan is a new member of our institution.  He will use his loan money to buy a sewing machine, leatherette, insoles, card, etc. for making his shoes.  He is a very hard-working person who is grateful to our institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, leatherette, insoles and card

loans.name: Namu

texts.en: Namu is 50 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and her husband is an engineer. They have three children ages 9 to 25 years old and all of them are attending school. For the past five years, she has been selling cement, charcoal and drinks wholesale. Her business happens to be the only source of her income, so she is greatly praising God for this endeavor. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cement, charcoal and drinks to sell to her customers. In the future, she plans to build a bigger store with a separate division for drinks, cement and charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase more cement, charcoal and drinks to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is creative and a hardworking mother. She doesn't want to laze at home and just do household chores. She wants to earn more money to provide sustenance for her family. She has four children, two of whom are attending school. 

Marites sells processed meat products such as hot dogs, longganisa and tocino (cured pork and sausages). She usually earns about 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month in this field of work. Aside from selling meat products, she also raises hogs for future merchandise. 

Marites hopes to strengthen her hog raising business, which is why she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines for her hogs. With the help of this loan, she can get higher profits from her hogs. Thus, it would help improve her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta is 39 years old and lives in a town called Sinkor. She is single and has three children who range in age from 11 to 23. All of her children live at home with her and are enrolled in school. She earns a living selling plastic dishes in a local market and is applying for a loan to buy more of these items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy plastic dishes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 58 years old and married. He runs a carenderia (eatery) located in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. He cooks viands everyday to sell to the people in his community. Cesar wakes up at 5 in the morning to start cooking since he has customers who come to eat breakfast.

Cesar requested this loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork, chicken, vegetables and spices. Cesar hopes to renovate his eatery in the future.

loans.use: buy pork, chicken, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Savriya

texts.ru: Саврия проживает в районе Рудаки. Она вдова. Ей 55 лет. У нее 5 детей. Ее дети имеют собственный бизнес. Сама Саврия имеет торговую точку на рынке, где продает женское нижнее белье. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 30 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Savriya lives in the Rudaki district.  She is 55 years old, a widow and has five children.  Her children have their own business.  Savriya has a retail outlet at the market, where she sells women's undergarments.  She has been involved in this business for 30 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Dinorah Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinorah es una señora de 31 años el cual vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace unos años que Dinorah tiene la necesidad de arreglar su hogar. 

En estos momentos lo que desea Dinorah es solicitar un préstamo por ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar materiales de construcción. Con esto espera terminar el arreglo de su casa y llegar a ofrecerle una mejorar condición de vida a su familia.  

Dinorah forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Dinorah is a 31-year-old woman living with her family in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón.  Mollejones is a community located 150 kilometers south of San José Province, Costa Rica’s capital.  It’s 850 meters above sea level.  Vegetables and coffee are farmed there and other activities, like cattle and pig raising, also take place there.  There are also some organic farming projects as well as some vegetables being raised hydroponically.  Besides agriculture, the community has repair shops, a supermarket, small restaurants and a furniture store.

Dinorah has needed to make some home improvements for a few years now.  At present, she wants to request a ¢500,000 (five-hundred thousand colones) loan to buy building materials and supplies.  With this she’ll be able to finish fixing up her house and provide improved living conditions for her family.

Dinorah is part of the “Bancruce” communal bank one of EDESA’s 110 social organizations in Costa Rica.  As a member, it’s received a micro loan that has allowed them to grow as micro entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Porn

texts.en:
Porn, 41 years old, is a worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is also a worker and earns $4 per day. They have three children and all of them are studying in school. Every month, she has to spend $83 on food, $15 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. She wants to feed pigs at home so that she can make other profit to support her family. She also wants to build a new house because her house now is not in good condition to stay in.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 31 años, está divorciado de su esposa, por ello vive solo en su casa propia ubicado en la urbanización de valle dorado, Pichari. Fredy siempre quiso tener una parcela agrícola donde pueda cultivar, porque desde muy pequeñito amaba la naturaleza y extraña mucho por las cosas que están pasando con el medio ambiente. Anteriormente sabia cuando llovía o no, sin embargo con el calentamiento global las cosas han cambiado, y todo esto hace que sus productos no produzcan la cantidad que debe, generándole perdidas económicas que no le son nada favorable. Por tanto las plantas requieren de más fertilizantes y cuidado frente a la plaga de insectos o algún tipo de hongo que perjudique sus plantas. Para Fredy es imporante cuidar su siembra ya que es su única fuente de ingreso. En un futuro desea plantae más cacao y producir en cantidades considerables, de esa manera captará mejores ingresos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará plantas de cacao.
texts.en: Fredy is 31 years old. He is divorced from his wife and so lives alone in his own house which is located in urbanization of Valle Dorado, Pichari. Fredy always wanted to have a plot of land on which he could farm since from a very early age he has loved nature. He is very concerned about what is happening to the environment. In the past, he would know whether it would rain or not, however, with global warming things have changed and all this means that his produce does not produce the amount it should, generating economic losses which are not at all favourable for him. Therefore his plants require more fertilizers and protection from insect pests or fungi that might harm them. It is important for Fredy to take care of his crop as it is his only source of income. In the future, he wants to plant more cocoa and produce in large quantities, thereby making a better income. This will be his second loan with MFP and he agrees to make his repayments on time. With the money he is asking for, he will buy cocoa plants.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Gonzalo Alejandro

texts.es:
Gonzalo Alejandro tiene 42 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 15 años de edad en el cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Gonzalo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad del producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia, vías de comunicación y las plagas. El sueño es que el hijo llegue a terminar los estudios.
Se considera una persona puntual, tranquilo y le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Gonzalo Alejandro, 42, is married and has one child.  He lives with his spouse and 15-year-old son in Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

The San José communal bank has 21 members and is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, 60 minutes from the office.  This bank focuses on short-cycle agricultural work growing corn, bananas, and cacao.

Gonzalo works in agriculture, growing corn, bananas, and cacao.  He buys and sells in the parish of San José del Tambo.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Mata Monte herbicide, fertilizer, and weed killer to keep the crops in good condition.

The loan will be a big help because he will be able to improve the quality of his product.  The challenges he faces frequently are competition, communication, and pests.  His dream is that his son will finish his studies.

He considers himself to be a punctual and calm person who likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizer, and weed killer.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 56 years old. She is married and has eight children.

She earns a living by farming sugar cane in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other tools for farming.

Myrna has been farming sugar cane for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other tools for farming.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace used her previous loan to lease land farming as well as buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. She was able to plant and harvest, thereby becoming very profitable.

She paid all her previous loan amounts well and in good time. This will be her seventh loan and she plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and plant potatoes and carrots during this planting season.

In the future, Grace hopes to improve her farming skills and get more income and be able to pay school fees for her school-going children as well as improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 29 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Tom has been working hard to manage his small shop, which provides computer services. 

To help expand his business, Tom has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more printing supplies and will help Tom generate greater profits and buy food to feed his family. Tom hopes that in the future he will be able to continue expanding his business. 

Tom is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tom who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more printing supplies.

loans.name: Virgillia

texts.en:
Virgillia is a widow. Virgillia is 53 years old and resides at Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Virgillia owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living, and she's been 30 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Virgillia is been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Virgillia wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 30, is married and resides with her husband and a kid in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store from her home. Her husband is a rice farmer. The grocery store is the main source of income for the family, so Chantha needs more funds to expand her business. This is her second loan request; this time, she is asking for a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more income. In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ebe

texts.en:
Ebe is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Ebe has a retail shop that sells home supplies, office supplies (like scissors and clips) and school supplies (like cellophane covers). She has had this business for 10 years. 

Ebe requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy more stock of home, office and school supplies to sell. Ebe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ebe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of home, office and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is married. Pacita is 54 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Pacita owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Pacita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter a 41 year old man is married and has been blessed with six children. He is a carpenter and has been in business for the past two years. He describes his business as very competitive. He was previously employed as a guard. He is a very hard working and trust worthy man. Faulu Kenya has helped him save his money for future purposes and also boost his business.
He hopes to be a rich man. He requires a loan of 10,428 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es:
Alfredo, es un carpintero que atiende su propio negocio, tiene 50 años de edad, es soltero pero tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad,  vive con sus padres, su madre tiene 67 años de edad y su padre 70 años de edad, en vista que sus padres ya son mayores don Alfredo debe cuidar que tengan alimento, vestuario y salud, el negocio lo atiende con ayuda de dos empleados de lunes a sábado y lo abrió hace 4 años, el oficio lo aprendió con el apoyo de uno de sus amigos.
Con el capital comprara madera, barniz, clavos, sellador, entre otros materiales importantes para aumentar la producción y calidad de los muebles, pretende tener una mejor situación financiera para pagar sus deudas y cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio y cuidar de sus padres lo mejor que se pueda.

loans.use: comprara madera, barniz, clavos, sellador, entre otros materiales importantes para aumentar la producción y calidad de los muebles

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs Faith O. is 30 years old, married with two children. She operates her business in Benin City, an urban center in Nigeria. She needs the sum of $400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie started to utilize her skills cooking to support her and her daughter after she was unable to find a job elsewhere. Now, she has expanded beyond friends and neighbors to now serving dozens of customers daily in a large, open-air courtyard that is filled with artisans and other vendors. Rosenie needs this loan to take her business to the next level so that she can improve her household income and provide a nutritious diet and sufficient clothing for her young daughter, who is very close with her mother - she even helps out her mother grind ingredients on Saturdays when she does not have school.

NOTE: Luisa has many friends in the community and is a dedicated member of her solidarity group. She represents nine other Esperanza micro-entrepreneurs, who will each receive an equal share of this $1,200 loan to invest in their respective businesses. Rosenie and the other members are responsible for making payments on this loan together and must help anyone in their solidarity group who may have trouble paying on time, which fosters accountability and social support.

loans.use: Purchase cooking ingredients, vegetables, a pot, a skillet and coals, matches, etc.

loans.name: Lidia Rufina

texts.en:
My name is Lidia M. and I have dedicated myself to selling new clothes for women, men and children such as t-shirts, button down shirts, blouses, pants, jeans, shorts, caps, socks and shoes. I have been involved in this activity for the last four years, with very good clients and I am able to sell my products in different private and state offices. At this moment I need more inventory in order to offer a better variety of products that are selling well. With the profits I will be able to cover the costs of expenditures as well as have a bit of money to remodel my home in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Lidia M. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballer y niños como ser camisetas, camisas de vestir, blusas, pantalones, jeans, shorts, gorras, calcetines, zapatos, actividad que realizo hace unos 4 años atras, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que vendo mi producto en diferentes oficinas del estado y privadas, en estos momentos necesito mas inventario para tener mayor variedad de productos ya que estos dias son buenos para las ventas, y con las ganancias que tenga poder cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar y tambien quiero ahorrar dinero para en un futuro remodelar mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase new clothes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 30-year-old mother of two, a resident of the Lumo area in Dar Es Salaam. Rehema operates a salon and has a shop alon side her salon selling both used and new clothes. She has been in business for the past seven years. She started with petty businesses but ever since she joined YOSEFO, her life has changed tremendously. She is a recipient of Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO) business training, which is conducted every year.

Her shop specializes in ladies' and kids' clothing; most of her customers in the salon are ladies. She can now afford to take her two kids to school, get a surplus to save, and pay back the loans she gets. Rehema is currently in need of USD 550 to buy a drier and chairs for her salon, and expand stock in her clothing shop as well.

loans.use: Buy equipment for her salon and expand stock in her shop

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
My name is Shahnaz B. and I am thirty-seven years old. My husband sells the knitted bed sheets, cushions, bags, etc that our neighborhood women make. Meanwhile, I sell clothes door-to-door in nearby villages. My eldest son works at a local factory after having completed the14th grade, while my other son is a tailoring instructor. Due to the income that my eldest son brings by working in a factory, I was able to marry off one of my daughters; the other two of my daughters attend school.

Eid is near and my customers are demanding me to sell cosmetics and jewelry with clothes as well. I need a loan of USD 250 to purchase the required supplies. I will make savings of the extra profits to help me marry off my daughters when the time comes.

loans.use: To expand knitting business

loans.name: Molimaufou

texts.en: Molimaufou is a 45-year-old married mother of 7 children who are all in school. Having a big family means financial obligations, especially education. She been has running her flea market stall for about a year. With the support of her husband they have managed to overcome their financial problems. Molimaufou is planning to extend the size of her flea market.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts to sell at her flea market stall

loans.name: Ocosinguensas 1 Group

texts.es:
Luvia Marisol has a small restaurant in her home, where she serves regional cuisine for breakfast and lunch. She is 38-year-old widow with one son. With this business, she is able to cover the household expenses. The other members of the group have other occupations: Lizbeth Guadalupe (casual restaurant), Lilia Caritina and Catalina (cosmetics and perfume sales), Julia (mini market), Francisca Rosario and Viviana Elizabeth (sale of pork).

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

LUVIA MARISOL TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA UNA COCINA ECONOMICA EN DONDE ATIENDE A PERSONAS QUE DESEAN DESAYUNAR O COMER OFRECIENDOLES UNA VARIEDAD DE COMIDA TIPICA DE LA REGION. ELLA TIENE 38 AÑOS, UN HIJO, ES VIUDA Y CON EL NEGOCIO SE AYUDA CON LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES. LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL EQUIPO DESEMPEÑAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES TALES: LIZBETH GUADALUPE (COCINA ECONOMICA), LILIA CARITINA Y CATALINA (VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS), JULIA (TIENDA DE ABARROTES), FRANCISCA ROSARIO Y VIVIANA ELIZABETH (VENTA DE CARNE DE PUERCO).

loans.use: Invest in kitchen essentials

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia M. is a 64-year-old woman whose husband, Carlos M., passed away two years ago.  Together, they had two sons who have both become educators, and who both live with her to offer support and help.  
In order to survive financially, Constancia decided to open a small commercial business for everyday goods.  With the help of her sons, Constancia’s store has receive much approval and has grown into a beautiful little grocery store; the only one in the neighborhood. 
Constancia is asking for a loan so that she may buy sugar, oil, yerba, refreshments like beer and soda, dairy products, assorted breads and more.  This will enable her and her sons to continue expanding their business, their sales, and consequently their incomes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like sugar, oil, yerba, beer, soda, and    dairy.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur A. is a 27-year-old farmer who sells milk and dairy products to the local people. He has three years of experience in this field. He applied for $1200 USD to purchase two milk cows, one for $500 USD and the second for an estimated cost of $600 USD.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Dilora

texts.en: O. Dilora is 27 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and sells children's clothing. She imports goods from China and sells them at low prices, thereby acquiring many wholesale customers. She also deals at the trade outlet that is located in the local bazaar.  She is applying to Kiva for a loan of $475 for 3 months to import new seasonal goods.

loans.use: Importing seasonal goods.

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia, 47, is married with no child and lives with her husband in the Herrera community of Santo Domingo. For more than eight years, she has been operating a cafeteria which is well-known and visited by people of the community.

Francia plans on offering new typical Dominican dishes to her customers. This way, she’ll attract new people to her business and she’ll be able to increase her revenue. Francia hopes her business will allow her and her husband enjoy their golden years.

loans.use: To purchase many goods to keep operating a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Ameyor

texts.en: Ameyor D. is a fishmonger. She is married and has 1 child. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then later sells the fish to her customers. She wants to increase her stock to meet the demand of her customers, so she is asking for a loan to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Mukankaka

texts.en:
The client, MUKANKAKA M., was born in 1966 in Gikongoro, the south western province of Rwanda. She is married to NTAGENGERWA Eugene, has 8 children and takes care of two more orphans. She has a senior 4 secondary education, and has 13 years of experience in tailoring and in selling different types of clothes she has made.

She makes different models of clothes as she is sharing a tailoring workshop with others. She also sews clothes to be rented for wedding ceremonies. She likes Vision Finance Company because she feels the company meets her need for the loan she is requesting.

The loan will help her to buy different colors and piece of cloth and thread in a larger quantity so as to boost her sales and maximize her profit. She believes that the loan will improve her own and her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy different colored pieces of cloth and thread for tailoring business.

loans.name: Union Y Amor (Unity & Love) Group 1

texts.en:
Juana is the mother of 4 children, ages 20, 21, 29 and 32. She is also the proud grandmother of 2, ages 6 and 16. Juana has a small business cooking and baking various foods like bread, chicken, and fried foods such as empanadas. She then sells her goods to a traveling salesman who will travel around to various communities on a motorcycle or in a car. This way Juana is able to work from home and be close to her family. She also sews clothing that she then sells in the community. Business can be hard sometimes when there is not enough demand for her products. Having a loan helps her to better weather the dry spells of business and to continue progressing.

Juana has successfully paid back 5 loans to Esperanza International and is now requesting her sixth loan. With the money, she hopes to expand her businesses even more to better proviD. for her family. She wants her children to be able to finish their educations and find good jobs.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to bake and sell more food products

loans.name: Mahkamtosh

texts.ru:
Mahkamtosh S. lives in the Vakhsh region. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. She has her own business. She brings cotton oil from Dushanbe and sells it in locally for a better price. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. She would like to obtain a loan to purchase goods. This will help her increase turnover and attract new clients. She plans to repay the loan within a 9 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Шарипова Махкамтош жительница Вахшского района. Возраст 47 лет , замужем и имеет пятерых детей . Занимается бизнесом . Привозит из города Душанбе хлопковое масло и продает у себя в районе по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить товар . Это поможет ей увеличить объем продаж и привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., aged 44, joined TYM Fund in 2004. Nowadays besides farming, she buys pigs and sell pork. Every day, her husband buys pigs and slaughters them and she sells this pork at markets. On festive days, the demand for pork usually increases and her family may gain an income of CND 300,000 per day. With a stable income from pork trading, she and her husband have more money to send her daughter to university in Ho Chi Minh city. For the next loan cycle, they want to borrow VND 9 million to invest in this business.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo José y con sus cinco hijos, Diego de 19, Juan Carlos de 15, Adriana de 1, María Laura de 13 y Karina de 09 años.  Trabaja en la venta y confección de ropa, en un local que alquiló para este fin.  Desde hace diez años se dedica a esta labor, a la cual que le dedica tiempo y esfuerzo, vendiendo las prendas durante toda la mañana y parte de la tarde, para tener mayor ganancia.  A Lourdes le encanta su trabajo, ya que su facilidad de palabra y su carisma hacen que convenza muy fácilmente a la clientela, la parte difícil, radica en que al estar casi todo el día en su tienda, no puede ver a sus hijos y atenderlos como a ella le gustaría.  Lourdes trabaja muy duro para hacer estudiar a sus hijos y darles estudios profesionales.  Con el dinero del préstamo aumentará el stock de su tienda, para que esté mejor abastecida y tenga mucho más que ofrecer.  En el futuro Lourdes quiere que su tienda crezca y poner sucursales en toda la ciudad de Juliaca.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a 40 year old woman who lives with her husband Jose and their 5 children - Diego, 19, Juan Carlos, 15, Adriana, 1, Maria Laura, 13, and Karina, 9. She works creating and selling clothing in a space that she has rented for that purpose. For the past 10 years she has worked hard at this job, selling her products in the morning and into the afternoon in order to increase her profit. Lourdes enjoys her job, as her charisma and way with words make her a natural salesperson. The hardest part of her job is the fact that she spends almost the entire day in the store, and is not able to see and care for her children in the way that she would like to. Lourdes work s hard to get her children to study so that they can study a profession. With the money from this loan she will increase her store's inventory and to have a better supply to offer her customers. In the future, Lourdes would like to see her shop grow, and open branches throughout the city of Juliaca.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the store's inventory

loans.name: Kimsol

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsol S., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Tha Ron, 26, were married in 2001 and have one daughter. The family lives along national road number five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Kimsol has been a mason for ten years. He does his work in the village and the surrounding area. His wife has been a garment factory worker for eight years. The couple is in the process of building their new home.

So, Kimsol is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase wood materials to build his house.

loans.use: To purchase wood materials for building his house.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn M. is a villager in the Kampong Chrey village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land he uses to cultivate rice. 

His wife, Mrs. Mao Touch, owns a small restaurant where she sells rice to the villager and passengers. Even though they have different businesses, they earn too little income to provide a decent life for their household. In order to improve the living conditions, Mr. Thorn M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. 

He is 55 years old and the father of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another helps the mother;s business. The others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is also presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy O. lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She buys coconuts to resell in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. She would use the rest of the money to purchase a cart to transport her coconuts to sell door-to-door. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Nuo Chor, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sophy O. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is pictured on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and a cart to transport them

loans.name: Mary Namwanje   ‘S Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of a four member group. She is 31 years old and married with 4 children, between 6 and 12 years old. All her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a rented one-room house in which two people stay. They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Mary sells second-hand clothes in the Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. She works six days a week and rents her business premises for 80,000 per month. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Before resorting to selling clothing she first sold vegetables but because they were perishable she changed to clothing. Mary sells both retail and wholesale. She has been in this business for the last ten years and has been in MCDT for five years, now servicing her tenth loan and working all along with the same groupmates. Mary‘s monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes and aspires to own a permanent shop.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Bakir

texts.en:
Bakir M. is a 42-year-old cattle breeder who raises livestock in the small village of Imishli. He has been engaged in this business from a young age because his father and grandfather were farmers. He got experience in looking after cattle and does not have any higher education.

Bakir is married and has two children, who are studying at school. Bakir would like to expand his business and purchase two more calves and fodder.

loans.use: Purchase two more calves

loans.name: Raihona

texts.ru: Райхона уже получала займ на КИВА. С прошлого раза в ее личной жизни произошла большая перемена – Райхона развелась со своим мужем. Теперь она проживает одна со своими детьми. Несмотря на тяжелую экономическую ситуацию Райхона продолжает заниматься предпринимательством, так как это единственный источник дохода для ее семьи. Полгода назад она ее ездила по окрестным базарам. Сейчас она арендует небольшой прилавок на центральном рынке города и там торгует. Уже на новом месте она приобрела много новых постоянных клиентов. Сейчас наступает сезон продажи весенней одежды и Райхона решила обратиться в Микроинвест для получения нового займа.
texts.en:
Raihona has already received a loan from Kiva. Since the last loan there has been a big change in her personal circumstances - Raihona and her husband divorced. Now she is living alone with her children. Despite the tough economic situation, Raihona continues as an entreprenuer, as business is the sole source of income for her family. Six months ago she traveled between the outlying markets. Now she rents a small stall at the city's central market and sells there. She has already earned many new and regular customers at the new location. The sales season for spring clothes is beginning now, and Raihona decided to request another loan through Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for the spring season

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has been a milk seller in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 10 years. She belongs to Sayuni Group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 35. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more milk for re-sale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business

Ruth is 45 years old, married, and has six children: ages 24, 23, 20, 18, 16 and 14. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more milk for re-sale

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad tiene 20 años, vive con su madre y hermanos en la casa propia de sus padres.
