Se dedica a la fabricación de yeso, el cual sirve para la construcción y acabado de las casas; esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde su adolescencia, ya que sus padres le enseñaron a desempeñarse en esta labor y con el tiempo le han dado la entera responsabilidad. Soledad cuida de que cada parte del proceso sea cuidadosamente cumplido, porque de ello depende que el producto sea de calidad, también se encarga de proveer todos la materiales e insumos necesarios que se requieren para manufacturar el yeso en la fábrica artesanal que posee. Su trabajo requiere de bastante esfuerzo físico, por lo que Soledad trabaja incansablemente para lograr lo ingresos que serán de beneficio para su familia. Para el futuro quiere agrandar y mejorar la infraestructura de su fábrica, para así aumenta su producción. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de haber sido admitida  en el banco comunal, y tiene muchos deseos de seguir adelante. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de una camionada de leña y petróleo que son los combustibles indispensables que hacen funcionar el horno de cocimiento del yeso que produce su fábrica.
texts.en:
Soledad is 20 years old and lives with her mother and siblings in her parents house. She works at making plaster which is used for the construction and finishing of houses. She has been developing this trade since her adolescence when her parents taught her how to carry out this work, and over time they have given her the entire responsibility. Soledad takes care that every part of the process is carefully completed because that determines the quality of the product. She is also in charge of providing all of the materials and ingredients needed to make the plaster in their workshop. Her work requires a certain amount of physical strength, and so Soledad works tirelessly to earn the income that will benefit her family. For the future, she wants to enlarge and improve the infrastructure of her factory in order to increase production. This is the first time the she has sought a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is very please with having been accepted by the communal bank and she has a great desire to get ahead. The money that she is requesting is for the purchase of a truckload of firewood and fuel oil. These are indispensable for fueling the furnace in which they fire the plaster which her factory produces.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fuel for the furnace.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeurn L. lives in Ta Preak village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Ya Sorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Although this couple works hard they still earn too little income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Saroeurn L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is a 49-year-old mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. She and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: A wooden house in Kompong Cham Province is the location of Mrs. Heang S.'s home and grocery store, a business she has operated since 2005.  This mother of two children, expecting a third within three months, usually purchases produce in bulk on credit from a market supplier, earning an average income of $2.00 per day.  Her husband, On Sar, 26, is a local physician who owns a small pharmacy for selling medicines.  Heang is requesting a loan for her husband to buy additional medicines to meet patients’ needs.

loans.use: To buy additional medicines to meet patients'  needs.

loans.name: Rors

texts.en:
Rors C., 42, is a fantastic mother who earns money to make sure her four children attain an education.

She and her husband use a small pigpen that they built to raise pigs. They also generate other profits by fishing in the Tunle Sap River, which is full of fish. Rors will use the loan to purchase a piglet and poultry to breed, and for more fishing tools.

loans.use: Purchase piglet and poultry to breed.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Шухрат мужчина 26 лет. Женат и отец 4-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Шухрат занимается откормом и продажей скота со своим отцом. Шухраи с юности помогал отцу ухаживать за домашнем скотом. У Шухрата есть стадо мелко рогатого скота, примерно 15 овец, 5 коз и 4 коровы. Свой скот Шавкат реализует у мясников. Шавкат очень признателен нашей организации хочет в дальнейшем развиваться.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is a 26-year old father of four. His wife is a homemaker, and she also tends to the cattle that Shuhrat raises and sells, together with this father. Ever since Shuhrat was young, he has helped his father raise cattle. Now he has around fifteen sheep, five goats, and four cows. Shuhrat sells the cattle to butchers. He is grateful to our organization and wants to develop further. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Otunoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Отуной- женщина, которая кредитуется несколько лет.Она торгует на рынке Худжанда детской и женской обувью. Сейчас у неё ассортимент шлёпанцев и летних басаножек. 
На запрашиваемый кредит Отуной хочет съездить в Истаравшан и с оптового рынка закупить новые виды летних шлёпанцев и сланцев. Отуной благодарит KIVA за поддержку в финансировании и понимании.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Otunoy is a woman who has been our client for several years. She sells women's and children's shoes on the market of Khujand. Right now in her assortment are sandals and slippers. She wants to use the loan to travel to Istaravshan and buy new types of summer sandals and slippers at the wholesale market. Otunoy is thanking Kiva for the financial support and understanding.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand children's shoe sales

loans.name: Benkadi 2 De (Benkadi  Fofodiana) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de FOFODIANA,  commune de Tingolé,  sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et  tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 22 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, de Marka-Coungo et  de Fana à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 2 are married women who average 33 years of age and 5 children. They live for the most part in polygamous families in the village of FOFODIANA, in the community of Tingolé, sub-prefecture of FANA (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum, peanuts, and beans. They are on their fifth experience with the institution. All the past loans were repaid without any difficulties at all. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor farm supplies and equipment and to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 22 hectares. A portion of their production is for their own consumption. The other portion is sold to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of Tingolé, Marka-Coungo, and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and minor supplies

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhon C. is a villager in Kgnauk Pong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She faces a problem on the farm because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in the fields. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan. She will also buy fertilizer to feed the soil and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Sao Hang, is a driver. Mrs. Sokhon C. is forty-seven years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To hire laborers and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Cette dame a pris la décision en 1998 de vendre à la fois des produits d’alimentation générale , elle y a associé après la vente des produits génériques pour aider financièrement son mari conducteur de taxi à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 04 enfants. Elle exerce cette activité en bordure d’un boulevard très fréquenté dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Actuellement elle a besoin de lancer une nouvelle commande de certains produits manquants ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 10 boîtes de paracétamol, 15 boîtes d’aspirine, 02 emballages de papiers hyégéniques, 10 boîtes de sardines et 15 cartons de savons de toilettes de différentes sortes. Cette femme a tissé au fil du temps un réseau de clients qui lui ont toujours été fidèles. Elle compte sur ce réseau commercial pour vite rembourser son crédit.
texts.en:
In 1998, this lady decided to sell grocery items.  She has included with it the sale of generic pharmaceutical products to help her taxi-driver husband financially in providing for their four children.  She has been operating this business along a very busy boulevard in the Hédzranawoé district in Lomé.  Currently, she needs to initiate a new order of certain products that are in short supply; this is why she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 10 boxes of paracétamol, 15 boxes of aspirin, 2 packets of toilet paper, 10 cans of sardines, and 15 boxes of bath soaps of different types.  As time went on, this woman wove a network of customers, who have always been loyal to her.  She is counting on this commercial network to repaid her loan quickly.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items and pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 38 years old.  She is managing a direct selling business and at the same time, does vending of different items such as vegetables, food snacks and so on.  For 19 years being involved in the business, Genalyn was able to finance her family and sends her children to school with her weekly average income of only PHP1, 000. 

She always plans to expand her business, but difficulties of life and lack of financial capital hinders her business plans.  But Genalyn remains strong and determined to work hard for her family, and to have a productive business. She is now requesting to avail the amount of PHP12, 000 that will be added in her business capital for her vending and direct selling.  
	
She is married to Leonardo Sr., a security guard, they have one daughter and she is already in her fourth year high school. They peacefully live at Barangay Namnama Cabatuan, Isabela, it is a rural and plain area. Their house is located at the back of their community center. She kept on working so hard, for the better future of her family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Three years ago Martina W. had a fish-selling business. She decided to venture into farm produce because she could run it from her home, unlike the fish business where she had to travel long distances to buy fish to sell. Martina is married and the mother of three children between the ages of 15 and 21. She plans to expand her farming area and to buy more seedlings and fertilizer. For this she needs a loan of Kshs.10,000.

loans.use: Buy seeds and expand farming.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta H. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Vicenta is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Vicenta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of condiments such as onions, tomatoes, bell peppers, and others for sale. Vicenta has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Vicenta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Vicenta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married entrepreneur from Skvira, where she sells women’s clothing, office supplies and groceries in the local markets. Valentina owns 3 vending locations at 3 different markets in the region. She has been in this business for 10 years. She currently has about 100,000 Grivnyas invested in her business; her average income is 28,000 Grivnyas a month, and her monthly net profit doesn’t exceed 8,000 Grivnyas.  

Valentina is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. We believe her natural ability to please her customers, by guessing their needs and offering speedy courteous service, will help Valentina achieve her goals, sustain her success and consequently win at the entrepreneurial game.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: American Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'American' Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, they will make more sales and better profit. As their profit-to-sales-margin increases, they will better support themselves and their children.

The leader of this group, Mohamed K., is on the left. Mohamed was born in Makeni. He is age thirty-seven, divorced with four children. His children are attending schools – three in secondary school and one in primary school.

Mohamed sells soft drinks, cigarettes, mints and chewing gum. Mohamed has got four years of experience in this type of business. With his share of the loan, he will invest in his business by buying more crates of drinks, cartons of mints, chewing gum, and cigarettes.

loans.use: Buy drinks, mints, chewing gum, and cigarettes

loans.name: Mame Kene

texts.fr:
-Mame Kene D. habite dans la localité de Camberene .Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2007 et n’a jamais bénéficié  de prêt. Elle est commerçante  depuis 4 ans et s’adonne à la vente de tissus  et d’habits prêt a porter. C’est une parente bénéficiaire  mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Les moments qui lui procurent beaucoup de plaisir sont les moment s ou elle procède au choix et l’achat de ses marchandises au marche Sandaga de Dakar. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs afin d’augmenter son stock de marchandise en cette  période de préparatifs des fêtes de Tabaski et de fin d’années. Avec ce prêt elle espère accroitre ses bénéfices et augmenter son fond de roulement au bénéfice de son commerce.
Madame D. une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Mame Kene D. lives in the borough of Camberene. She has been a member of U-IMCEC since January 2007 and has never benefited from a loan. She has been a retailer for the past four years, selling cloth and ready-to-wear clothing. She is a parent beneficiary, married and mother of two. The moments that give her most pleasure are when she selects and buys her supplies at the Sandaga market in Dakar. She is requesting a loan for 150,000 francs to increase her stock of merchandise during this period of preparing for Tabaski and year-end celebrations. She hopes with this loan to improve her business by increasing her profits and working capital. Mrs. D. is a beneficiary of the Protocol between U-IMCEC and the Development Program for Children and Families "Seydina Issa Laye". This program seeks to decrease poverty within the community and above all protect children from impoverished families. Thanks to this cooperation, beneficiary parents can obtain credit under more flexible conditions than with ordinary credit. Since this protocal started in December 2008, 120 parents have obtained financing for sums ranging from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Rocio pertenece al Banco Comunal “COMUZONE” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 47 años es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.
 
Rocio es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y se las ingenio para hacer su propio negocio de venta de chocolates, nuestra socia nos cuenta que ella misma elabora las chocotejas (La chocoteja es un delicioso y agradable chocolate, inventado en el Perú). La socia también se dedica a la venta de juguetes de recreación en la puerta del colegio “Uriel Garcia” del Cusco. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica al negocio de venta de chocolates y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como chocolate, manjar, envoltura y moldes para los chocolates.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our partner Rocio is a part of the Communal Bank “COMUZONE” of Asociación Arariwa. She is 47 years old and has three children. Rocio is a hardworking and enterprising mother who supports her family and has the ingenuity to create her own business of selling chocolates. She told a loan officer that she makes the "chocotejas" (A delicious and enjoyable chocolate invented in Peru). She also sells toys at the entrance of the Uriel Garcia high school in Cusco. She has had the chocolate sale business for four years which has done well thanks to the efforts that she puts into her work. Rocio will use this loan to buy ingredients like chocolate, manjar (caramel), wrappers and molds for the chocolates. She is grateful for the opportunity that this loan provides and she is committed to keep the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients like chocolate, manjar, wrappers and moldes for the chocolate

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia O., 73, is making sure that she helps the families of her children.  She was once married to Jose O. Sr., who has passed away.  Tobether they had eight children. Now, in order to extend help to her grandchildren, she tries to make sure that she earns more than enough money for herself.  She has been managing her own variety store for 32 years.

Eugenia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than six years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy added stocks for her store.   

Eugenia is seeking an 8,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying toiletries, basic commodities, and rice for her store.

She prays that her children can have jobs so that they can help with their family's expenses. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying toiletries, basic commodities, and rice for her store.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 35 years old and is married with four children who are 2, 3, 10 and 11 years old. She and her family live in the Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Jeanne is a proven entrepreneur and she has been selling a variety of drinks in her pub. The business hours are from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Jeanne is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of adding a large quantity of beers so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers. With this loan, Jeanne hopes to increase her sales as well her profits.

If this plan is successful, Jeanne will continue helping her husband to build a secure future for their family and, in addition, she will try to create some other sources of income in order to increase her profits and give more jobs to the people in her community.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of beers

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is married with one 26-year-old son. As a busy entrepreneur, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for almost twenty years. Her husband is a tricycle driver in the neighborhood.

Susie would like to receive a loan of 45,000 PHP in order to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store. She is planning to purchase additional products such as rice, sugar, gasoline, eggs, and cooking oil. Susie believes that offering a wide assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and maintain customer loyalty in the community.

Since 1996, Susie has been a dedicated and model member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines. She has demonstrated regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Susie's long term goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store, and start a savings account for her grandchild's education. Through hard work and determination, Susie is focused on improving her quality of life with the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.

About ASHI:
Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as rice, sugar, gasoline, eggs, and cooking oil

loans.name: Cristeta's Group

texts.en:
Cristeta D. C. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 55 years old. Cristeta is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cristeta D. C.'s Group.

Cristeta is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Cristeta owns & operates an agricultural business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Cristeta has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cristeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Cristeta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cristeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Yesjan

texts.en:
Yesjan is 25 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His family live together with Yesjan's parents in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Presently, he operates a manufacturing Kazakh souvenir and instrument business in his town. Yesjan makes Kazakh traditional instruments called dombra, and other souvenirs to sell. He started his business in 2001, when he learned how to manufacture Kazakh traditional instruments and souvenirs from his father. Yesjan has steadily expanded his business, and gained valuable experience in previous years.

Nowadays, his working capital exceeds 300,000 tugrugs. He sells 5-6 dombras per week for 20,000 tugrugs. Furthermore, he has a loyal customer base because of his well-designed and high quality products. Yesjan has been planning to expand his production line and will use a variety of materials, including iron, for his products in the future. He is a very hardworking person who has great communication skills. Yesjan is requesting a 800,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of materials for the upcoming month when demand for dombras is very high.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana M. prepares Fante kenkey for distribution to her customers at Akotokyire who then resell it in smaller quantities. Fante kenkey is a type of kenkey found mostly in the Central and western Regions of the country, specifically the Fante’s area.

Nana has been through senior high school. She is married and has two children and supports her husband in taking care of the family. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of maize to prepare Fante kenkey to be able to distribute more to her increasing customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to re invest into her business.

To prepare her kenkey she buys maize from the market, soaks it in enough water to soften the maize. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it for the next day.

She divides the dough into two, uses one for her firm half-cooked dough (mixes it with water to get it into a porridge form and cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture to the dough) and mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough.

She moulds the result into balls and wraps them in plantain leaves that have been dried. She then cooks them again till they becomes soft to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce, with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey or any other kind of meat or fish.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of maize for preparing Fante kenkey

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and is married with a child who is 12 years old and attends school.

Florence is a friendly and hardworking woman. She sells motor spare parts and loves this business because of the profits that she makes. She has been in this business for a long time and she hopes to excel in her business.

Florence is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel D. G. tiene ya más de un año con su negocio de taller de herrería. Le está haciendo falta el techo en el patio ya que es donde el realiza sus trabajos, con el sol y las lluvias no a podido terminar los pedidos que tiene pendiente, porque nada mas trabaja por la mañana, decidió construir un techo de lamina y madera y así lo pueda proteger del sol y la lluvias mientras este trabajando.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora. Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de sus trabajos de herrería, ya que el negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Daniel D. G. has been operating his blacksmith business for more than a year. He needs to build a roof over his patio since that is where he performs his work. Due to the sun and the rain, he is not able to finish his outstanding orders and can only work in the morning. He decided to install a roof made of tin and wood so that he can be protected from the sun and the rain while he is working. Dante is requesting a loan so that he can buy the necessary materials to complete this improvement. He plans to repay the loan using part of the earnings from his blacksmith business, which is the source of income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a roof over his work area

loans.name: Carmen Del Pilar

texts.es: El solicitante vive en casa de sus padres los cuales son clientes de nuestra entidad financiera. Tiene un credito hipotecario. Cuenta con un negocio de zapatos en la galeria Gamarrita hace 2 años. Tiene buena experiencia crediticia con CREDISCOTIA y CMAC ICA. El destino del credito es para compra de mercaderias referente a la estacion
texts.en:
The loan applicant lives in her parents house and they are also Kiva loan recipients. She has a mortgage and has had a shoe store in the Gamarrita shopping mall for two years. She has good credit with CREDISCOTIA y CMAC ICA. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for the season.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise Purchase

loans.name: Howell

texts.en: Howell C.'s main source of income comes from providing a computer video games service to local community members. He is 26 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. Howell has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Howell joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. Howell is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more materials needed to provide the service. This will be his fourth loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide computer video games

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela trabaja como empleada de limpieza, a la vez es artesana. Teje chompas y esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso, tiene 3 hijos todos están a su cargo. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Brasil  de la ciudad del  Alto. 

El préstamo que ahora solicita a través de Kiva, lo destinará para la compra de  lana por cantidad  para su actividad el tejido de chompas.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro; el análisis socioeconómico muestra su capacidad de pago y la necesidad que tiene para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Graciela works as a cleaning employee, and at the same time she is also an artisan. She knits sweaters, and this activity is her main source of income. She has 3 children in her care. Her home is located in the Brasil area of the city of El Alto. The loan she requests now through Kiva will be used to buy wool in bulk for her activity of knitting sweaters. This is her first loan with IMPRO, and their socioeconomic analysis shows her ability to pay, and the need that she has to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wool to continue her business knitting sweaters to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella T. is from the village of Dalig Viejo, Burgos. She is 59 years old. Estrella is married. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28 year old single woman living with her parents in Lebanon. She established a mini-market in her town in 2009, after having had previous experience in this occupation for 5 years. She helps her family through her business income, in collaboration with her brother. She offers food products, cereals, detergents, etc. Her mini-market is situated in a busy area, so there are a lot of customers who pass by her shop. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 to increase her shop's inventory. She is certain that with the help of the loan, her business productivity will be increased.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in her picture, not indicating her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

loans.use: To increase her shop's inventory.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena  tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su  casa propia. Hace más de 20 años que ella posee animales ovinos en su establo, por lo que los lleva a pastear en el campo todos los días, asimismo su esposo y sus hijos comparten esta tarea, pero hasta hace 4 años se dedica a elaborar bordados artesanales. Por otro lado tiene extensiones de terreno de las cuales cultiva papa, olluco y maíz; siendo lo cosechado vendido al mercado de la ciudad mas cercana de su comunidad. Le gusta trabajar en el campo, puesto que le permite cubrir la necesidades de su familia, es por ello que desea seguir creciendo tanto en la agricultura, como en la elaboración de bordados ya que lo considera como un negocio muy rentable. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su campaña de siembra y también en la compra de hilos de colores y telas.
texts.en:
Magdalena, age 49, lives with her husband and their six children in her own house. She has had sheep in her stable for over 20 years. She takes the sheep to the field to graze everyday. Her husband and her children share this work. Four years ago she started making handmade embroidery. She also has an expanse of land where she grows potatoes, “olluco” (an Andean tuber), and corn. Once they are harvested, they are sold in the market that is in the city closest to her community. She likes working in the field because it allows her to cover her family’s necessities. That is why she wants to continue growing in agricultural as well as making embroideries, which she considers to be a very profitable business. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she has always demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments. Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. She is grateful to the people who will fund the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy sacks of fertilizer for planting season. She will also buy different colors of thread and fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different colors of fabric and thread to continue embroidering

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 34 years old and has five children who range in age from 2 to 10 years.

Antoinette sells beer. She works with her husband and they have done this business for seven years. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of beers for her bar in order to make more profits.

Antoinette’s dream is to have a wholesale store in the future where she hopes to sell many crates of beer and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy a variety of beers to sell

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es:
Álvaro C. es un hombre de 45 años, que vive y tiene un negocio en Puerto Colombia, un municipio a 15 minutos de Barranquilla ubicado a la orilla del mar, lo cual da cuenta de su  vocación turística y es allí donde familias barranquilleras, se acercan los fines de semanas a divertirse y a darse un baño de mar, lo cual ha potenciado la sostenibilidad de la microempresa  de Álvaro, que es la preparación de un delicioso arroz chino, que vende de manera ambulante, en su carrito de madera  y con el cual ha logrado apoyar el crecimiento de sus tres hijos en las edades de 9 a 21 años de edad . 
El credikiva es el primer crédito de Álvaro, con el cual comprará materias primas en mayor volumen, como víveres para la preparación de su arroz chino y también reparará su carruaje de ventas. El negocio de Álvaro nació hace un año y desde entonces, se levanta muy temprano, prepara su arroz chino, con el apoyo de sus hijos que también trabajan en este negocio. Álvaro produce un promedio de 35 libras de arroz diariamente y las vende en los horarios de 10:00 AM a 2:00 P.M, en porciones de a $1000 COP, esto hace atractivo el que mucha gente quiera comprarle,  además del sabor inigualable que tiene su producto y de ser el único que vende de manera ambulante en todo el municipio; Con su rutero   su venta está asegurada, pues el arroz chino está muy acreditado entre sus clientes que día a día generan otros potenciales. Su sueño es continuar con su negocio generando  mas utilidades, para seguir financiando los estudios universitarios de su hija mayor y a mediano plazo planea abrir un local en el cual venda su arroz y otras comidas.
texts.en:
Álvaro C., 45, lives and has a business in Puerto Colombia, a town that is 15 minutes from Barranquilla and at the seashore which makes it a tourist destination for families from Barranquilla who come to spend the weekends there to have fun and enjoy the sea.  This makes Álvaro’s micro  business profitable.  He prepares delicious Chinese-style rice that he sells in an itinerant manner using a wooden cart.  This business has allowed him to support the development of his three children who are between the ages of 9 and 21.  This is Álvaro’s first Kiva loan that he will use to buy larger amounts of ingredients to make his rice and also to repair his sales cart.

Álvaro’s business was born a year ago and since then he gets up very early to prepare the rice with help from his children who also work in the business.  He makes an average of 35 pounds of rice per day and sells from 10am to 2pm.  Each portion costs $1000 COP.  This is a very affordable price which causes many people to want to buy from him.  Besides, his product’s flavor is unequaled and he is the only vendor who sells throughout the town.  His sales are guaranteed along his route because the Chinese-style rice is highly rated by his customers who daily produce more potential customers for him.

His dream is to continue with the business generating higher profits in order to continue to pay for his oldest daughter’s university education.  Also, in the not too distant future he wants to open a shop to sell his rice and other dishes.

loans.use: Will buy ingredients, like foodstuffs to make his Chinese-style rice, in quantity as well as repair his sales cart.

loans.name: Belgica Nancy

texts.es:
Bélgica de 31 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciales informales), ella confecciona ropa y tiene un negocio de comidas típicas. 

Empezó a trabajar en un taller de confecciones de ropa, cuando aprendió hacer casi todo tipos de ropa compro maquinas especializadas para que el trabajo se le haga mas fácil y ganar mas dinero, poco a poco con esfuerzo y la ayuda de su mama a incrementado su taller de confección y costura, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta que acaba los pedidos. También tiene un negocio de comida típicas. 

Para tener una mayor producción de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, cocina, sillas para su negocio de comidas ya que quiere asegurar el futuro de su hijo por lo que esta embarazada. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de confección con empleados que le ayuden.
texts.en:
Bélgica is 31 years old and lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil (an urban zone where the majority of the inhabitants are informal businesses). She makes clothing and has a business selling traditional food.

She began working in a seamstress shop, where she learned to make all kinds of clothing. She bough special machines so that the work would be easier and she could earn more money. Little by little with great effort and help from her mother she has grown her seamstress business. Now she works from 8 AM until she finishes her orders. She also has a business selling traditional food.

In order to have a greater clothing production she wants to use the loan to buy fabric, kitchen items, and chairs for her food business as she wants to ensure her child’s future as she is pregnant.  In the future she wants to have a seamstress shop with employees to help her.

loans.use: Fabric, Kitchen items, Chairs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes K. runs a business selling beans and rice at the market. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell. Agnes is 26 years old and is married to a builder. She has 2 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is an active entrepreneur who manages a sari-sari (variety) store. Her previous loan from Kiva partner, ASHI, provided working capital to expand her business and purchase more inventory. With the previous loan, Consolacion noticed that her monthly income almost doubled because she attracted more customers with her additional stock.
Prior to working with ASHI, Consolacion had no access to capital to support her business dreams. Positive growth from her business has helped Consolacion finance her children's education. Since joining ASHI, Consolacion has experienced positive changes in her life and used the additional income to support her family's daily expenditure. She hopes her business will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family.
Consolacion is now requesting a Kiva loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase more foodstuffs for her store. This will allow her to grow her business further so that her family experiences a life that is full of fulfillment. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Consolacion is hopeful that her business endeavor will provide a steady income and improve her family’s quality of life, which is currently underneath an umbrella of poverty. She hopes that her business will expand so that they are able to make some savings for future use.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her store

loans.name: Huanish

texts.en:
Huanish H. is a 41 year-old single father who lives with his sibling and child in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Huanish has been making framing materials (walls, ceilings, etc.)  for such homes for the past 2 years and has gained a significant experience as a craftsman. 

Huanish operates his business with help of his sibling and usually produces framing for gers according to his customers' orders. He typically spends 200,000 MNT to make a ger's wooden frame and earns 200,000 MNT in profit.  In the winter months, Huanish operates a firewood-selling business to supplement his earnings. Huanish says, " All I want is to provide a good education for my only son."  He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials and supplies for his ger frame-making business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and supplies

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en: To make a living, Jonna M. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods in her community. She is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Pag-asa, Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. Jonna has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Jonna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jonna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Jonna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk foods. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk foods

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, es una exitosa mujer joven y trabajadora de 23 años, que vive en casa de sus padres; junto a su esposo Jaime, de 26 años y su hijo menor Yosmel, de 3 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. La actividad principal de Maribel es la agricultura, donde sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arvejas, y demás productos oriundos de la sierra peruana. Los cuales siembra hace ya 4 años, y según afirma con el esfuerzo diario, y los constantes cuidados que le brinda en compañía de su esposo, podrá obtener muchas ganancias, y con ello invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas.  Ya está dando el primer paso, con la adquisición de un espacio en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde podrá obtener mejores ganancias, ya que está en un lugar estable. Pero no solo a eso se dedica Maribel, pues en sus tiempos libres, ella prepara biscochuelos y panes. Lo que más le gusta a ella es “estar activa y lograr sus objetivos”.Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socia de su banco comunal, se compromete en participar de manera activa y responsablemente. De obtener el crédito solicitado, está pensando invertir en la compra de más sacos de abono para esparcirlos en sus diferentes cultivos.
texts.en:
Maribel is a successful and hard-working young woman of 23.  She lives in her parents' home together with her husband, 26 year-old Jaime, and her 3 year-old daughter Yosmel.  They live in their own home which is located in the village of Cumutay.

Maribel is in the farming business.  Her main crops are potatoes, peas and other products that are native to the Peruvian mountains.  She has been growing crops for 4 years and she says that her daily hard work and the constant attention that she gives to her crops, with her husband's help, will make a lot of profits.  She will use these profits to invest in buying more farmland.  She is taking her first step by acquiring a space in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma where she will be able to obtain better profits since it is in a stable place.  However, Maribel doesn't just grow crops.  In her spare time she also bakes sponge cakes and bread.  What she most enjoys is "being active and achieving goals".

This is Maribel's second loan with MFP and, as a member of her community bank, she pledges to take part in an active and responsible manner.  She plans to invest her loan in buying more sacks of manure to spread over her different crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Sabeela Hamid Raza's Group

texts.en:
Sabeela is the wife of H. R.. She lives in Khanewal, Pakistan, an area that is famous for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for over 9 years.
 
She is 41 years old and runs a sewing business. She collects orders from her neighborhood clients and earns income after completing them on time. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. 
 
She is expert in her work and can sew designer and non-designer dresses very easily. She learned these skills from her mother and they are now earning a good profit for her.
 
She is also a very good wife and mother who works full time in her household and takes care of her family. She is the mother of an only son who is 5 years old and has not yet started attending school.

Her husband is also involved in sewing. He is a tailor who is proficient in sewing men's clothes. His tailoring shop is located in the market and he is well known in his area for the quality of his work.

Sabeela has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner, to expand her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine which will help her to produce good quality work and to complete her orders on time to raise her income. She is very confident that her business will be improved with the help of an investment. 

She is a regular Asasah borrower and this is her second loan application. She paid the installments on her previous loan on time and never missed any meetings.
 
In the photo, Sabeela is the woman who is holding the group's Asasah passbook.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: Bernardina, es una mujer alegre, de 36 años. Su familia lo integra su esposo Emerson, y sus 5 hijos todos ellos menores de edad; en armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer es la agricultura, siendo sus principales cultivos el café, plátano, y palta. Tiene 12 años dedicándose a ello y lo que más le gusta es comenzar la búsqueda de los primeros granos maduros de café durante el inicio de la cosecha. Su dedicación y el amor que brinda a sus cultivos, hacen que sus productos sean de buena calidad. Por ello conocedores de su buen trabajo los comerciantes de café de la ciudad de Villa Rica, la buscan constantemente. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está segura podrá salir adelante. Bernardina tiene un vivero de 2 mil plantitas de café, por ello con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar personal para que le ayuden en trasplantar café.
texts.en:
Bernardina, 36, is a cheerful woman. Her family is made up of her husband, Emerson, and their five minor children.  They live in family harmony in their own house located in Unión Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).

Bernardina is a farmer; her main crops are coffee, banana and avocado.  She’s been in this line of work for 12 years and what she enjoys the most is looking for the first ripe coffee beans at the beginning of the harvest.  The dedication and love she provides her crops result in good quality products.  Because of this her work is well known and coffee merchants in the city of Villa Rica seek her out constantly.

She is a member of the “Prestatarios de la Unión” (La Unión Borrowers) and this is her first loan with MFP where she is sure to get ahead.  Bernardina has a nursery with 2000 coffee seedlings so she is asking for a loan to hire personnel to help her transplant coffee.

loans.use: To hire personnel to help her transplant coffee.

loans.name: Chey

texts.en:
Chey P., 52, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. 

P. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of US $5 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $25 on food and US $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase a threshing machine to improve the farming business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a threshing machine to improve the current business

loans.name: Umnotho Group

texts.en:
Bongekile is 49 years old and a single mother with 4 children between the ages of 2 and 14 years old. She cares for 4 children. She runs a retail business in Nkandla in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. In the photo she is in the center raising her hand. 

She hs been in this business for 10 months and sells chicken in farm villages and pension spots. She says that the main challenge to her business is customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time. She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy clothes. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her profit, add more stock, support her family and allow her to build a house. In future, she would like to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase things currently not available in his general store

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from dried fish vending.  Norma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for fishing

loans.name: Gelinda

texts.en:
Gelinda is a 48-year-old married woman living in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has two children aged 24 and 21. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for 20 years. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Gelinda sells her rice and pigs at the market.

Gelinda's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, piglets and feed. She hopes for her piggery and rice farm to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed

loans.name: Super Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Super, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de chaussures et pratiquent le maraîchage.                                                                                                                              
Les femmes du groupe Super sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des chaussures et des semences pour le maraîchage.                                                                         
La cliente SITAN B. compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs de Falako pour revendre au village. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Super group, all married, are on average 35 years old with 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Nalla, sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through connections with family, friends and neighbors. The women sell condiments and shoes. They also work as market gardeners.                                                                                                                              
The women of the Super group are on their first group loan which will be used to buy condiments, shoes and seeds for market gardening.                                                                         

Sitan B. plans to buy condiments from the sellers in Falako and re-sells in her village. She makes sales every day, for cash and on credit, to customers who are both men and women.

Sitan expects to make an average monthly profit of 7,500 CFA francs which will be used to pay the loan installments, pay for contributions to social ceremonies and the rest will be re-invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is from the village of Suarez, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Adela is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Adela owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells bananas and coconuts in the local community. Adela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Adela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Adela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts

location.town: Suarez, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Sasa

texts.en:
Sasa is 24 years of age and married with one child. Sasa owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business. Sasa needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Sasa joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sasa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Tashinga B Seke South Group

texts.en:
This is 65-year-old Ruth (in the middle) from Chitungwiza, a high-density suburb about 30 km. from Harare. She is married with three children, all attending school. She also cares for four dependents.

Ruth runs a clothing business selling ladies clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge faced is the lack of capital to meet her order demands. Ruth has requested a loan of $400 to buy shoes and suits for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family’s cash flow and quality of life.

In the future, Ruth plans to have her own clothing shop and see her grandchildren through their education.

loans.use: to buy stock such as shoes and suits

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is a married man with two children; one attends school while one is too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman selling second-hand clothes which contributes to his other source of income. 

For the past five years, he has operated a scrap metal selling business, selling as retail to his local neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of scarcity in scrap metal supply. He dreams of expanding and becoming a wholesale supplier of scrap metal in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase scrap metals for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase scrap metal for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres en Acción nace hace más de tres años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, en estos más de dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente. Son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de ayudarse mutuamente y de esa manera generar mas ingresos para sus hogares.
La Sra. Nelly se dedica a la venta de bebidas hace ya unos años, es muy conocida en el barrio por todos sus vecinos. Se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Le gustaría algún día poder ampliar mas su negocio.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra d mas bebidas, como ser gaseosas, cervezas y demás para el abastecimiento de su local de bebidas.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres en Acción” (Women in Action) committee was born over three years ago through the initiative and support of another committee that was working in the same place.  This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo.  In the more than two years of intense work it has grown both socially and economically.  They are known locally as very hard working women.  They joined together to mutually help each other out to generate more income for their homes.

Nelly has sold beverages for several years now.  She is very well known by folks in her neighborhood.  She considers herself to be a very hard working, tenacious woman.  She’d like to expand the business some day.

She asks for the loan to buy more beverages like soft drinks, beer and others to stock her establishment with beverages.

loans.use: to buy beverages like beer, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mahmadsobir

texts.ru: Махмадсобир проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Махмадсобир зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Дома он создал все условия для разведения скота. Кредит берет для закупа трех голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mahmadsobir lives in the Rudaki district.  He is 34 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education.  His wife is a homemaker.  Mahmadsobir earns his living by breeding cattle.  He breeds cattle at his home, where he created all the necessary conditions for this business.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of three cows.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, age 42, owns and operates a shop where she sells fish, such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She and her husband have four children.
 
She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 in order to buy fish to offer for sale in her shop.
 
Paulina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya, is aged 24, and is still single. He has been in farming for 3 years and currently employs three farmhands who help in producing sugar cane, vegetables and onions which are sold to the local market.

Meshack has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 KES, this being his second loan request after successful repayment of the first one. He says this will help him purchase a motorcycle for a transport business. He remains optimistic he will manage to benefit from the current boom in the transport industry and expand his farming business to dairy too.

Meshack says the outbreak of diseases during rainy seasons remain a challenge to farmers. He adds that Juhudi loans really cater for small holder farmers needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 48-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has a fishing business. Her husband is a fisherman and is the one who mainly operates their fishing boat. Elvira helps by selling his catch at the market. Elvira does her best to improve their business and support her family.

Elvira requested a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and gear. This loan will help Elvira and her husband have more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and gear

loans.name: Mwasada

texts.en:
Mwanasada is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past twelve years, she has operated a charcoal and firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her charcoal-selling business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase food and clothes for the family during the celebrations after the month of Muslim fasting called the month of Ramadan. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing for the family

loans.name: Lice

texts.es:
Lice, de 46 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, esta casada y vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 21 años quien es estudiante y aún depende de ella, ya que esta en planes de sacar su titulo universitario. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de ropa, mercadería que lo obtiene de la ciudad de Lima y los vende a crédito y al contado, ya sea para amigos y familiares. Muchas veces espera en su casa a que vayan los clientes, pero en otras ocasiones sale a la casa de ellos para colocar sus diversos productos. Tiene cinco años haciendo este trabajo y en ocasiones la ayuda su hija, quien vende dichas prendas a sus compañeras de la universidad. Le gusta su trabajo, pues como dice: "El tiempo es muy importante cuando uno mismo se sabe organizar y disponer" afirma; y como en este trabajo dispone de su tiempo le parece un buen trabajo. Espera poder mantenerse con este ritmo, ya que más adelantes desea diversificar su venta con zapatos y algunos accesorios. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, le esta yendo muy bien en su grupo, y espera poder seguir así. Asimismo agradece mucho la oportunidad que le dan de poder invertir y hacer crecer su capital, por lo que espera nuevamente su apoyo. 
Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería en prendas de vestir y ayudará a su hija para que pueda sacar su titulo, cuya profesión es la de contadora pública.
texts.en:
46-year-old Lice is an entrepreneurial and very hard-working woman.  She is married and lives in her own home together with her husband and her 21-year-old daughter who is a student.  Her daughter is still dependent on her as she is in the process of obtaining her university degree.  

Lice's business is selling clothes.  She obtains her merchandise in the city of Lima and sells it on credit and for cash to friends and family members.  She often waits at home for her customers to come to her but sometimes she goes to their homes in order to show them her products.  Lice has been in this line of work for five years and her daughter sometimes helps her, selling the garments to her university friends.  Lice enjoys her work.  She says: "Time is very important and you must know how to get organized and plan your time well".  In this business, Lice is able to plan her own time and therefore it seems like a good job to her.  She hopes to be able to continue working at this rhythm as, in the future, she would like to diversify her business by starting to sell shoes and some accessories.

This will be Lice's fourth loan from MFP.  She is doing very well in her group and she hopes to keep it up.  She is very grateful for the opportunity that they give her to invest and grow her capital and so she is hoping once again to receive support.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy merchandise (clothes) and to help her daughter so that she can her obtain her degree.  Her daughter has studied to become a certified public accountant.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and pay for her daughter's degree

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 55, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mario, a maintenance staff worker, and mother to four children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Erlinda operates a retail business. What she basically does is buy accessory products and items from wholesalers, then sell them per item at a profit. Her products are hair clips, ribbons, head bands, and the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 17,000  PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of accessory products and items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Erlinda hopes to have a bigger store and dreams to be able to give her children a good education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of accessory items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge, con el préstamo anterior ha podido construir una parte de su vivienda. El es un hombre muy honrado.

Es solicita un préstamo para poder acabar su vivienda, ya que se acerca la navidad y la esposa le dijo que hiciera todo lo posible para que puedan pasar bien esa fecha tan inolvidable.Su sueño es que su casa esté terminada.
texts.en:
With his previous loan Jorge has been able to build part of his house.  He is a very honest man.

He is requesting a loan to be able to finish his house.  Christmas is approaching, and his wife told him to do everything possible so that they are able to have a good day on this unforgettable date.

His dream is for the house to be finished.

loans.use: to purchase cement and blocks.

loans.name: Colonia Modelo Group

texts.es:
La señora Simona, de 59 años de edad, vive en un Barrio suburbano de San Pedro Sula, madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 27, 26, 16 y 14 años de edad. Sus dos hijas menores estan estutiando.
