Al no tener ayuda económica de su esposo, ella decide iniciar un negocio que le genere ingresos para el hogar y estudios de sus hijas. y  hace  aproximadamente 8 años  que vende ropa, nueva y usada y venta de carteras, sus ventas son a domicilio. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas para vender.
Este es su primer prestamo con ODEF, y lo ha invertido en compra de mas ropa para incrementar el inventario , ya que va aprovechar la temporada alta de navidad.
Todo este esfuerzo es para lograr que sus hijas terminen sus estudios. 

Doña Simona (En medio, de blusa color Rosado), es miembro de un grupo llamado COLONIA MODELO, que esta formado por dos personas más, la señora María Reina y Danubia. Doña Reina( Derecha, la de blusa color café) de  54 años de edad se dedica a la venta de comida en una cafetería,  Danubia  (a la izquierda, la de blusa color Blanco)tiene 32 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de productos ARABELLA (cosméticos) y ropa. Cada una ha solicitado un préstamo de L.5,700.00, haciendo un total en grupo de L.17,100.00.
texts.en:
Simona is 59 years old, and she lives in the suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  She is a single mother, and she has four children; ages 27, 26, 16, and 14.  Her two youngest daughters are in school.

Not having financial help from her husband, she decided to start a business to generate income for her household and for her daughters’ education.  She has been selling new and used clothes and wallets for approximately eight years.  She sells door to door, and her daughters help her sell.

This is her first loan with ODEF.  She has used it to buy more clothes in order to increase her inventory.  She is going to take advantage of the peak Christmas season.  All of this effort is to manage to have her daughters finish their education.

Simona (in the middle with the pink shirt) is a member of the Colonia Modelo group.  The group is comprised of two other people, María Reina and Danubia.  Reina (right, with a brown shirt) is 54 years old and she sells food in a cafeteria.  Danubia (left, with a white shirt) is 32 years old, and she sells Arabella products (cosmetics) and clothes.  

Each one of them has requested a loan for 5,700 lempiras, which makes the group total 17,100 lempiras.

loans.use: to buy clothes and wallets to stock her inventory.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 42 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines. Myrna has a shop that sells snacks such as pancakes, rice cakes, and banana cues  (This is is a popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar). She has had this business for 10 years. 

Myrna is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Entesar

texts.en:
Entesar is a 42-year-old woman and a mother of two children.

Entesar is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Entesar is looking to expand her business and increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Tomas Martin

texts.es:
Tomás Martín tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 11, 8 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Tomás se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 15 años  , Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Pueblo Viejo.

Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la siembra de maíz, arroz y poder comprar los abonos agrícolas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos sin ningún tipo de problema. El sueño es poder comprase un tractor. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Tomás Martín is 31 years old, in a common law relationship and has three children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 11, 8 and 5 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Las Palmas” communal bank are located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.  Tomás is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for 15 years.  His purchases and his sales take place in Pueblo Viejo.

He is asking for the loan to work his corn and rice crops and to be able to buy agricultural manure.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy supplies problem-free.  His dream is to be able to buy a tractor.  He has had no type of problem and in his free time he enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Bukhchuluun

texts.en: Now he needs to increase his store working capital for the more sales volume in the further. It is important and beneficial for his business future. Therefore the loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the large amount of groceries for increasing the working capital of his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase the large amount of groceries for increasing the working capital of his grocery store.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 62 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor.  She is married with five adult children.

To earn a living, Loreta has a business selling of viands (delicacies). She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work.  Loreta has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her viand business. Loreta has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 1 year.  In the future, Loreta hopes to sustain her business and have maintenance capital.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her viand business

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya, where she has been producing and selling mainly maize, vegetables, tomatoes, and milk for the local market. She is married with two children aged 12 and 8 years. She has been in farming for 3 years and employs two farmhands.

Peninah has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming by buying poultry birds. She says there is a ready market for poultry products and she wants to exploit the opportunity and raise her financial income.

She notes lack of capital and unreliable rain as the main challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a responsible housewife who aims to improve her status of living and to give her children a better life. She is now 56 years of age and has three grown-up children. Due to financial burden, she helps her husband in managing their corn farming business to ensure a high production. They planned to expand their corn plantation to increase their yield and income to satisfy their necessities and save for future emergencies.   Despite the hardships they encountered in farming, they have the determination to work out their plan. 

Virginia is asking for an additional capital of PHP 46,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost in planting corn. She believes that the loan will help them to work out their plan and hopes that they will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost in planting corn

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gejas Shg Group

texts.en:
These eleven women from a small village of the Koraput district, Odisha, India, stepped out and made a self help group called "Gejas Shg" to work together and make their families' lives easier. All members of this group are involved in different business activities to earn some money so that they can help their families. All are very responsible and help and support each other.

Ritanjali is the group member chosen as their president and Kiva representative. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Ritanjali. She is a 31-year-old married lady living with her three children and her husband. She has been engaged in paddy cultivation for the last 10 years. Her husband helps her with this activity. Currently she is earning 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. She is not able to produce more paddy due to bad quality seeds and fertilizers as she is not able to invest more money. She has a plan to purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation so that she can produce more paddy and can improve her standard of living.

Ritanjali and her group members have requested a loan of 165,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to built a house for her family. She is very happy and thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 39-years-old and married who has four children and she is living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Her main business is rice farming and sometimes she supplements the income bu working as a paid worker. She has been in these businesses for 10 years. She earns 30,000 KHR per day.
She has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use the loan portion to buy pesticides, fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to timely grow her rice so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont issues de la même famille. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Houedassi (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 52 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Houedassi est mariée a certain François. Le couple a six enfant, dont certains scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Houedassi vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les charges familiales sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Houedassi prépare de la nourriture et vend son domicile depuis vingt six ans. De façon secondaire, a son activité Houedassi vend aussi des charbons et des fagots de bois. Houedassi s’approvisionne dans un marché du bénin. Dans le but de diversifier son activité, Houedassi ensemble avec les membres du groupe ENAGNON sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, des condiments, de l'huile végétale, du charbon de bois et du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en: Bernardo is 37 years old he works as an employee for an industrial plant he is the father of one son and he is the owner of the house where he lives with his family  he needs a loan to fix a room at his house Bernardo is the only one that works at his house so he needs your help he is and old employee so he has a secure job You can see in the picture that the room has some troubles

loans.use: to fix a room at his house

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: 45-year-old Mr Vincent A. lives in an urban area in Edo State, Nigeria.  He learnt his trade for six years, after which he opened his own business in 2001. He says if the amount is loaned to him, it will help him expand his business.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in rice farming

loans.name: Pilar Serafin

texts.en:
My name is Pilar C. and I sell churros, candies, chocolates, marshmallows, pencils, sodas and kool-aid. I have had my business for one year. My clients are good because I am located near a bus terminal. Mi goal is to increase the variety of the products I sell, therefore Increasing sales and be able to cover my family's and my home's expenses with the extra earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Pilar C. me dedico a la venta de churros, confites, chicles, bombones, culey, refrescos, lapices, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, mis clientes son buenos ya que estoy ubicado cerca de una terminal de buses, mi meta es tener mayor variedad de productos, para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder cubrir con los gastos de mi familia y mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase churros, candies, chocolates, marshmallows, pencils, sodas and kool-aid.

loans.name: Mariana Aracelly

texts.es:
Mariana is 29 years old and is from Mérida, Yucatán. She is single and has 2 sons who are 6 and 8 years old. Five years ago, due to unemployment and the need to support her kids, she started her own business selling food. She started offering her products to friends and neighbors, but soon she had a lot of clients. It has not been easy to bring up her kids alone, but the well-being of her family comforts her.

In order for her business to continue growing, Mariana now needs a loan of $275 which she will use to buy ingredients to make her products. She promises to repay this amount over a period of 4 months. Mariana thanks you for the support and trust you have put in her. Know that your support will do great things for her business and her family. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariana tiene 29 años de edad, es originaria de la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad, ante la falta de empleo y la necesidad de obtener la manutención de sus hijos, desde hace cinco años inició su propio negocio con la venta de comidas, comenzó ofreciendo sus productos a vecinos y conocidos pero pronto logró hacerse de un buen número de clientes. No ha sido fácil para Mariana tener que sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola, pero el bienestar de su familia la reconforta.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, ahora Mariana necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Mariana agradece mucho el apoyo y la confianza que depositas en ella y sabe que con tu ayuda podrá hacer grandes cosas para su negocio y su familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Nieve

texts.en: Nieve is 33 years old and is mother of three beautiful girls of 15, 14 and 10 years old.  Six months ago, she started a little business with the purpose of tending to her girls' needs.  The father of her daughters doesn’t live with them and is not regularly contributing to solving household problems.  She is now selling clothes, shoes, curtains, sheets for beds, and other houseware.  As she began the business with a very small amount of merchandise, she now wants to have sufficient inventory to offer to clientele.  This way, people will have more purchase options when visiting her business. The loan requested will positively help this woman achieve her goals and help her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes, curtains and other goods in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Truy

texts.en:
Mr. C. Truy and his wife Mrs. Pov Kimloin got married in 1991 and have two sons and a daughter. All three of their children attend school. The couple has been raising pigs and brewing rice wine since 2000. Besides raising pigs and brewing rice’s wine, Truy also grows rice. Truy and his wife were not able finish primary school.

This is Mr C.'s first loan from MAXIMA. Heis requesting $1,000 to purchase 2 pigs, repair the existing pigpen and grow rice.

loans.use: Purchasing 2 pigs, repairing pigpen, and growing rice.

loans.name: Lesly Charo

texts.es:
Mrs. Lesly is 29 years old and currently lives in the Lamas district of Lamas, San Martín. She has two seven-year-old children, and is a single mother. Mrs. Lesley devoted herself to her household work and to caring for her family, and once in a while she would help her mother-in-law prepare cecina, a dried, smoked meat product. They depended on her husband’s income until she decided to dedicate herself to creating cecina and chorizo, a spicy smoked sausage. Seeing the need for additional cash, she also decided to join the “Ciudad de los Tres Pisos” (City of Three Floors) communal bank.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S./300.00, she was able to purchase hogs to expand her business. She makes the cecina using facilities in her home, while selling the finished product in the city market in Lamas. Later, with her earnings and with other loans received from the communal bank, she buys more pigs to continue growing her business. With this loan for $525, which she will repay in six months, she will purchase live pigs to be sacrificed, and with their meat, she will make cecina, chorizo, and other products to cover the demand of her customers. She dreams of running a restaurant that serves traditional dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lesly tiene 29 años de edad, actualmente vive en el distrito de Lamas, provincia de Lamas, departamento de San Martín. Tiene dos hijos de siete años, es madre soltera. La señora Lesly se dedicaba a las labores de su hogar y al cuidado de su familia y de vez en cuando apoyaba a su suegra en la elaboración de cecina, prácticamente dependía del dinero que ganaba su esposo, hasta que decidió dedicarse a la elaboración de cecina y chorizo, viendo la necesidad de capital también decidió ingresar al banco comunal “ciudad de los 3 pisos”.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/: 300.00 pudo comprar cerdos para incrementar su negocio. La elaboración de la cecina lo realiza en las instalaciones de su casa, mientras que el producto terminado es comercializado en el mercado municipal de lamas, posteriormente con sus ganancias y con los otros préstamos que recibe en su Banco Comunal adquiere más cerdos para seguir creciendo con su negocio. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará cerdos vivos para ser sacrificados y con la carne elaborar cecina y chorizo y otros derivados para cubrir la demanda de su clientela. Sueña con tener un restaurante de platos típicos.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Rukminah

texts.en: Rukminah, 35, is the mother of 3 children and sells flavoured ice at her house, earning about US$ 1 a day. Her husband, J., sells bags door-to-door around the villages and earns about US$ 20 a week. She is requesting a loan of US$ 75 to add to her business capital and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Adding to her small business capital

loans.name: Busiya East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret K.. She is currently in the business of chicken rearing and is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed. Margret is 43 years old and is a widow with five children. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 28000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build better business premises. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Florence N., Lovis M. and Olivia N.. Florence N. has a business in sugar cane growing and wants to add to her business. Lovis M. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase the stock of clothes. Olivia N. operates a business of sugar wax selling and wants to add more capital.

loans.use: To expand poultry business and also improve quality of chicken

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam S., age 62 and her husband, age 67, run a carpentry store, making wooden furniture, such as windows, doors, chairs, and tables. They make an average of about $5 each day. All of her family members, including two children, live in a small wooden house built partly inside the carpentry store, which is the life blood of her entire family. The photo shows one of her sons working in the carpentry store.

The rainy season is a big concern of Mrs Sam S.'s family because some parts of her carpentry store are prone to flooding and some of her wooden furniture becomes soaked and rotten. Mrs. Sam S. would like to request a loan of $1200 to fill up the land so that this will not happen again in the future.

loans.use: To fill the land under her store to protect the store from flooding during the rainy season.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Before becoming dedicated to selling clothes, Felicia occupied her time tending her wine cellar, but she had to abandon doing that because it did not go so well. That it is why, four years ago, she began selling clothes on foot in a market. Her husband works as a chauffeur for the department of transportation. Both are in charge of the maintenance of the home and of their children, who are of school age.

She feels content with her work. Nevertheless, at 52 years she has not yet lost the hope of fulfilling the dream to have a snack bar in her house. For this she doubles her efforts to work, but she needs to save a lot of money to begin to invest in her dream.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Antes de dedicarse a vender ropa, Felicia ocupaba su tiempo atendiendo en su bodega, sin embargo dejo de hacerlo porque no le iba tan bien. Es por eso que, hace cuatro años vende ropa como ambulante en un mercado. Su esposo trabaja como chofer para el ministerio de transportes. Ambos se ocupan del mantenimiento del hogar y de sus hijos aun en edad escolar.

Ella se siente tranquila con su trabajo, no obstante, a sus 52 años aún no pierde las esperanzas de cumplir el sueño de tener una fuente de soda en su casa, para esto se esfuerza el doble al momento de trabajar, pues necesita ahorrar un monto de dinero para empezar a invertir en su sueño.

loans.use: To invest in her clothing sale business.

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr:
Born September 1st, 1960 in Cotonou, Mrs. Angèle H. is divorced and the mother of a child for whom she is solely responsible. She is a retailer of charcoal, sacks of corn, manioc flour, drums of oil and other daily food products in the city of Cotonou. She is very reliable and this will be her fourth loan. She is lacking financial means to stock various products. She is seeking this loan to supply and satisfy her customers because demand is strong.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 1 septembre 1960 à COTONOU, dame H. Angèle est divorcée et mère d’un enfant dont elle a la charge exclusive. Elle est revendeuse de charbon, de sacs de maïs, de farine de manioc, de bidons d’huile et autres produits de consommation courante dans la ville de COTONOU. De bonne moralité, elle est à son quatrième crédit. Elle manque de moyens financiers pour l’approvisionnement des différents produits. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner et satisfaire ses clients car la demande est forte.

loans.use: Purchase of 40 bags of charcoal, five of corn, and five of manioc flour, as well as 10 drums of oil

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou S. is a young woman who was born in Fatick in 1973. She is married and lives with her children in the district of Som in THIES. She does commerce on a small scale with various goods in a canteen located near her home. With this loan, she intends to buy merchandise to bolster her inventory in order to improver her income.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

aissatou S. est une jeune femme née à fatick en 1973.elle est mariée et vit avec ses enfants au quartier som de THIES .elle fait du petit commerce de marchandises diverses dans une cantine située près de chez elle .avec ce pret elle compte acheter des marchandises pour renforcer ses stocks en vue d'améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Thi Vinh's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Vinh (ID Number 03110033), born in 1973, would like to borrow 3,180,000VND to expand her confectionery shop. Her family owns this small shop to meet the demand of all the local people so she always needs more capital to purchase more goods. Her husband works in a steel and iron factory with other men in the village. Her family's average monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 250USD). However, this income is still not enough as she has to raise 3 school-going children. She has asked her neighbours to join her and form a group to apply for loans. She was voted to be the group leader. Her group also consists of:

Mrs. H. Thi Nha (ID Number 03110029), born in 1983, would like to borrow 3,180,000VND to purchase more wood to craft.

Mrs. Dam Thi Hang (ID Number 03110031), born in 1987, would like to borrow 3,180,000VND to invest in breeding pigs.

Mrs. T. Thi Luan (ID Number 03110032), born in 1985, would like to borrow 3,180,000VND to purchase more wood to craft.

Mrs. K. Thi Bao (ID Number 03110030), born in 1984, would like to borrow 3,180,000VND to purchase more wood to craft.

The total amount requested is 950USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Trần Thị Vĩnh (Ms 03110033), sinh năm 1973, mức vay: 3.180.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở rộng cửa hàng bán bánh kẹo.Gia đình chị có cửa hàng nhỏ phục vụ những người dân xung quanh nên luôn cần vốn để có thể mua được nhiều mặt hàng hơn. Chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm sắt cùng những người trong thôn, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Song, gia đình chị còn nhiều vất vả vì vẫn còn phải nuôi 3 con ăn học.Chị đã mạnh dạn rủ những người hàng xóm thành lập tổ vay vốn và chị được bầu làm nhóm trưởng. Trong nhóm chi có: Hoàng Thị Nhạ (Ms 03110029), sinh năm 1983, mức vay: 3.180.000 vnđ để mua gỗ về đục gọt đồ thủ công mỹ nghệ. Đàm Thị Hằng (Ms 03110031), sinh năm 1987, mức vay: 3.180.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Trần Thị Luận (Ms 03110032), sinh năm 1985, mức vay:3.180.000 vnđ để đầu tư gỗ đục gọt hàng thủ công. Kiều Thị Bạo(Ms03110030), snh năm 1984, mức vay: 3.180.000 vnđ để đầu tư đồ gỗ mỹ nghệ.

loans.use: invest in confectionery shop

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is a wife of A. A. and lives in a small city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and shoes. She has been living with her family in this city for the last 45 years. Naziran baji is a mother of two daughters. Her family has a decorative embroidery business. Naziran baji and her daughters make embroidered dresses, and her husband helps them by selling those dresses in a big market. She is out of stock now; because of that, she is losing her customers. She is applying for a loan to buy material (thread, cloth) to fulfill the orders of her customers.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Yasmeen baji and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy a power loom machine. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine. Khadija baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material to fulfill the orders

loans.name: Sinet

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinet S., 36, and her husband, Mr. Heang Hao, 36, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 1994 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them study in local schools.

Mrs. Sinet has been growing rice since 1979. She grows in her small farm far from home for selling and for food. Her husband has been a policeman for over ten years. Sinet is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for growing rice.

loans.use: For purchasing rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 36 años, es madre soltera de dos niñas Milagros de 4 y Mariela de 1 añito.   Se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 10 años cuando trabajaba para otras personas, pero finalmente decidió independizarse y poner su propio negocio, es así que compró su triciclo y desde entonces se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria.  Elsa  prepara la comida desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y la vende desde las 11 hasta las 2 de la tarde, tiempo en el cual su triciclo se rodea de muchos clientes, ansiosos por degustar sus deliciosos potajes.  Le gusta mucho cocinar, pero las subida de los precios hacen que los ingredientes sean mucho más caros y que cada vez se le haga más difícil mantener el precio de sus preparaciones, pero a pesar de estas dificultades, se mantiene firme para poder realizar todas sus metas.  Su deseo es superarse a favor de sus hijas, a las cuales quiere brindarles todas las comodidades y que tengan mejores posibilidades para ser profesionales en el futuro.  Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará más ingredientes y algunos utensilios de cocina para mejorar la atención a su clientela. En el futuro, quiere poner un negocio fijo, aun no decide cual pero puede ser un restaurante o una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 36 year old single mother of two little girls, Milagro age 3 and Mariela age 1. She has been selling food for 10 years when she worked for other people, but she finally decided to become independent and open her own business, so she bought a tricycle and since then has been selling food as a street vendor. Elsa prepares the food very early in the morning and sells form 11 until 2 in the afternoon, during which time her tricycle is surrounded by many customers anxious to enjoy her delicious dishes. She very much likes to cook, but the rising prices make her ingredients much more expensive, but in spits of these challenges she stays firm in being able to make her goals reality. Her wish is to be successful for her daughters, to whom she would like to provide all the comforts she can and she hopes that they have better possibilities to be professionals in the future. With the money she is seeking she will buy more ingredients and some kitchen utensils to improve her customer service. In the future she wants to open a business in a permanent location, she still hasn’t decided of this will be a restaurant or a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of ingredients and utensils for her food business

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea K., 30, and her husband, Mr. Phy Nhem, 42, live on an island in the Mekong river, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1997 and have one daughter who studies in the local school.

Sophea has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old. It is a skill she learned for her sister. Her husband has been a silk weaver since he was married. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.  
 
Sophea is requesting a loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Assana

texts.en: Assana A. is married and has 4 dependents. She completed her education through junior high school. Since 2000, Assana has sold groceries in Abura. Her husband is a teacher. Assana uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Assana will use the loan to increase her stock of groceries for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Assana plans to save toward building a family house with her husband.

loans.use: Assana will use the loan to increase her stock of groceries for sale.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid K. is 32 years old and married with four children. The family lives with his parents in Shewa, Jalalabad city, Nangarhar province. He is a teacher at his village's school, and he also has a lot of experience in agriculture because he owns land in his village.  

Walid has two sons and two daughters who are very happy. His two sons attend school and also want to get a higher education. With this in mind, Walid has a plan to open a store in the school and has requested a loan for this purpose.

Therefore he contacted the lenders of AFSG to take out a loan to buy some supplies such as notebooks, pens, pencils, sharpeners, and other things. He will also use his own capital. He would like to thank Kiva and its lenders very much for their support.

loans.use: To buy some supplies for his school store.

loans.name: Berna Babi ‘S Group

texts.en:
Berna is the leader of a five member group. She is 33 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 10 and 17. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house in which five people stay. They have electricity and piped water at home and the family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Berna owns a poultry farm with about 300 birds and sells eggs to nearby shops. She works seven days a week. She hires a vehicle to buy chicken feed. She sells to an average of twenty customers a day and to all categories of people. Berna has been in this business for the last ten years and has been in MCDT for six years. She is servicing her sixteenth loan, working all along with the same group mates. Agiri wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of chicken feed. She also aspires to own at least 700 birds.

loans.use: To buy more feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao D., 31, is married and sells charcoal in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has been in this business for about six years. She makes US$3 every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a recycler and earns $1.5 a day. She and her husband have five children. Three are students and two are too young to attend school. Mrs. Mao would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport charcoal.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca  inició el negocio porque es una actividad que le gusta, ya que en la juventud estudio belleza y posteriormente vio que tendría buenos ingresos y decidió dedicarse a ello.
Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1996 inició trabajando en sociedad con su hermana, en un salón de belleza, después decidío independizarse con el apoyo familiar y emprendío sola su propio negocio en otro lugar. 

A través de volantes dio a conocer sus servicios como cultora de belleza, empezo con sus vecinos y la calidad de su trabajo la fue recomendando, posteriormente hizo promociones para atraer mas gente, de donde obtuvo buenos ingresos lo que le permitió equipar el local.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para  tener mejor calidad de materia prima pues es mas alto el precio, así como diversidad de  productos, lo que será atractivo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca began her beauty salon business because she enjoys the work. She studied beauty when she was younger, and later realized that it could earn her a good income. She began working in March 1996, initially working together with her sister in a beauty salon. Later she decided to start her own business with the support of her family, and opened her own salon in another location.

She started with her neighbors and soon was recommended for the quality of her work. She also ran promotions to attract more clients, growing her income and enabling her to better maintain her salon. Blanca will use the loan, which she'll repay in 8 payments, to purchase better quality supplies and products which her clients will appreciate.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase higher quality products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Ibou

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibou G. est un tailleur marié qui a son propre atelier depuis 30 ans. Il dispose une bonne clientèle, et il sollicite ce prêt pour acquérir une machine à coudre marque gros fil pour mieux confectionner les nouveaux modèles des femmes. Ses revenues lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille et aussi de renforcer son activité de tailleur.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibou G. is a married tailor who has had his own workshop for 30 years. He has a numerous clientele and he is requesting this loan to acquire a sewing machine for heavier fabrics so as to be better able to sew up-to-date fashions for women. His income allows him to support his family and also to bolster his tailoring business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Dalma

texts.es: La señora Dalma G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en el Jr. Sargento Lores cdra. 03 – Caserío La Libertad, Distrito D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 32 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella. Con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia emprendió su  negocio D. Venta D. Abarrotes, que desD. sus inicios  dio buenos resultados, por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y al gusto del cliente En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son moradores D. la comunidad, vecinos y amigos. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 que cancelará a un plazo D. 06 meses, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela, Hoy se siente muy feliz del trabajo y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dalma G. is a member of the “La Libertad” community bank. She lives in Sargento Lores block 3 – Caserío La Libertad, in the Bellavista district, San Martín department. She is 32, married, and has 2 dependent children. On her own initiative and with her first loan of 300 PEN, she started her business of selling groceries. Because of the quality of her products, the reasonable prices, and her customers' requests, the business has done well from the beginning. She still runs the business, which is located in her house. Her primary customers are residents of the community, neighbors, and friends. With this loan of 2,000 PEN, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy more products to stock her store like rice, sacks of sugar, eggs, items for personal hygiene, house cleaning products, packages of soft drinks, sweets, and other products to keep her customers happy. She feels very happy about the work and service that she gives. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes that they continue to help many families and women entrepreneurs for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries: rice, sugar and other wholesale products

loans.name: Khir Mohammad

texts.en: Khir Mohammad is the son of M. G.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 years old. He is married with six children. All the children are students except one who helps his father in his business. Khir Mohammad has a general store in which he sells different kinds of things. He would like to expand his business and purchase the things which are in demand in his market. He wants to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. He is thankful to all lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy more items for his store

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Greetings from Antoinette M., a 39-year-old single woman with one child of 2 years and four orphans she takes care of. They have the following ages: 18, 20, 23, and 24. She lives in the Ngoma district in the western province of Rwanda.

Antoinette M. does her business in Ngoma district where she owns a shop and sells different kinds of merchandise, mostly consumables. She is seeking a loan of $900 USD from Vision Finance Company. She started this business in 2005 and does not have an employee. She starts working at 5:00 A.M. and finishes at 10:00 P.M. every day. Before getting the loan, this entrepreneur earns approximately $90 as a monthly profit.

Ms. M. hopes to expand her business and will reinvest the increased profits in her business. She will also have more savings.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan R., 59, is married to Saroeun, age 66. Phan R. and her husband generate their daily income by selling chickens. They normally buy chickens at the cheapest price from the people who live in the rural areas and retail them at better price in the local busy market. This couple has been blessed with four children: two are married and the others are still young. Phan R. will be using a loan to accrue capital for her commerce, to buy more chickens to sell. (The picture is Phan R.'s husband).

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell

loans.name: Shyryl

texts.en:
Shyryl D. is a rice grower. She started her business a long time ago using a 2-hectare farm that she inherited from her parents. Her husband Ronaldo D. is the one managing their farm. As parents, they do all they can to provide their children a bright future by working harder in the fields.

As she aspires for an abundant harvest, Shyryl thinks of buying fertilizer, pesticides, herbicide and other farm needs. She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. The loan will help her achieve the maximum yield from her farm. "In that way our household cash flow would be easily to manage," she said.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and other farm needs

loans.name: Shohib Group

texts.en:
Safiullah is the group leader of Shohib group. This group is made up of four members. All of them would like to expand their businesses and support their families as well. They have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. 

Safiullah is an electrician. With the loan, he wants to buy some required electric equipment for his small shop to grow more.

Shazia is a painter. She is a very hardworking woman who has great experience in painting. With the loan, she wants to buy colors, brushes and the other needed materials. 

Afghan Gul, who is another member of Shohib group, would like a loan for her tailoring business. She has been a tailor for more than 10 years. She can sew different designs of clothes and has a good monthly income. She has lots of problems with her old sewing machine. She wants to buy a new one. 

And Noria wants a loan for her brother’s bicycle shop to buy the necessities.

They would like to state that Kiva is an effective process that supports the entrepreneurs so they can improve their businesses.

loans.use: Purchasing equipment needed to grow their businesses

loans.name: Kobada 2 De (Kobada Nokabougou) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOBADA 2  est composé de dix femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de NOKABOUGOU,  commune de Tingolé, sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Les membres de ce groupe sont en  partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un appui financier pour exercer leurs activités hivernales qui sont entre autres la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution, tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés correctement.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 23 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, Marka-Coungo et Fana, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The KOBADA 2 group is made up of ten married women who have an average age of 40 and an average of 6 children. The majority live in polygamous families in the village of NOKABOUGOU, in the commune of Tingolé, in the sub prefecture of FANA, in the second administrative region of Mali. The members of this group are in partnership with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution with the goal of having financial support to practice their winter occupation which is, among other activities, the cultivation of sorghum, peanuts and beans. This is their fifth experience with this institution, and all previous loans have been correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and small farm equipment, and to pay the hoeing and labor expenses to maintain 23 hectares. They will consume one part of their goods and the other part will be sold in the Tingolé, Marka-Coungo et Fana markets to a clientele made up of men and women. They count on making an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs after the campaign.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing et small farm equipment.

loans.name: Olusola

texts.en: Olusola is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ergash

texts.en:
K. Ergash, a 44-year-old man, is married with seven children. Ergash is a farmer. He plants watermelon, corn, wheat, rice and pumpkins. He comes from a farming family and he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. His wife (in the photo) is his biggest supporter. She helps him in any way she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, he would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve Ergash’s income and his family's living standards. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Kojoki

texts.en: Kojoki B. is currently in the business of selling at the shop and is requesting a loan to purchase and stock more items in her shop to sell.  Kojoki is 38 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase and stock more items in her shop to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
57 years old Jose B. grows rice for a living. This has been his family's livelihood since he first married his wife Meralinda. They have one child. He said, “ Farming is our only source of livelihood. Sometimes we failed to have a good harvest but we are resilient and able to survive the many challenges”. Aside from farming, Jose B. also earns income by selling drilling materials. 

He wants to expand his farming business. Now, he needs additional capital to buy more farming necessities and to pay for laborers who help prepare the soil for planting. The loan is truly helpful in sustaining this family livelihood in their pursuit of having an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky B. is from the village of Damulog, Bukidnon. He is 34 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Ricky owns and operates a business making and selling designed walls made of bamboo materials. These are usually used as walls or siding of cottages or even houses in the local community. Ricky has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ricky joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ricky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Ricky is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ricky from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. p> *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James K. is a 38 year old gentleman who is married to Eunice Musenya. They have four children who are all of school going age. James has been running a boutique in Naivasha town for the last four years.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. This is James’ second loan with KADET. He used his first loan to move the business to more a decent premise. With this second loan James intends to improve the boutique by adding more stock in readiness for the Christmas season when he expects to make a great sale.

He hopes to convert his retail shop into wholesale in the nearest future.

loans.use: To improve his clothes boutique by adding more  variety and stock

loans.name: Mario Alfonso

texts.es: Mario Alfonso tiene 35 años de edad el tipo de negocio que este tiene es la elaboración de gorras y mochilas hace diez años que labora en el. Es casado tiene tres hijos a su cargo con las edades de 11, 8 y 4 años. El crédito que este solicita es para la inversión de compras de tela para las gorras, hilos y zíperes. Inicio como una necesidad ya que no tenía ningún oficio y tenía que mantener a su familia .El sueño de él es que uno de sus hijo el cual padece de leucemia pueda recuperarse ya que el tratamiento para dicha enfermedad es costoso.
texts.en:
Mario Alfonso is 35 years old. The type of business that he has is the manufacturing of caps and backpacks. He has worked in this for ten years. He is married with three dependent children ages 11, 8, and 4 years old. The loan that he is requesting is for investing in the purchase of fabric, thread, and zippers for the hats. It started as a need since he had no job and had to support his family. His dream is for his son who suffers from leukemia to recover as the treatment for this disease is expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Masele

texts.en:
Masele T. is 63 and married with 6 children (ages 22- 35 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Masele has many years of experience in this business.  Masele needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 tala or US $63 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Masele joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Masele's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Masele T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.9 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.9 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.55 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.89 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Torn

texts.en: Mrs. Torn T. is 31 years-old and lives in Tonle village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Bros Loem, is a construction worker. Since her husband's job earns insufficient income to support the family, she decided to request a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 Riel from Kiva partner AMK to buy a motorbike for her husband to become a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Torn T. is the mother of three children who are all students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hermenegildo Veron de 50 años esta casado con la señora Claudia Ramirez de 40 años, poseen 3 hijos cursando el colegio actualmente.
El señor trabajo 11 años para una empresa privada y se jubilo con los años y con los ahorros que poseía mas la jubilación que cobro abrió  una peluquería que administra su señora. Tambien posee una mercería en el mercado en donde el es encargado y administrador, sus mayores clientes son los visitantes del mercado.
En el futuro le gustaría  abrir una tienda con local propio y que sus hijos concluyan la universidad ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar su carrera universitaria.

El préstamo fue invertido en la compra de artículos para mercería como son hilos, agujas, gomas, botones etc.
texts.en:
Sr. Hermenegildo Veron is 50 years old and married to Sra. Claudia Ramirez, who is 40. They have three children who are currently attending high school.

Hermenegildo worked for a private company for eleven years. After he retired, he used the savings he accumulated over the years to open a beauty salon that his wife operates. He also manages a vending post at the market where he sells sewing supplies. His main customers are visitors who come to the market. In the future, he would like to have his own location where he can open a store. He hopes to see his children complete their university education since he did not have the opportunity to finish his college degree.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy sewing supplies such as thread, needles, elastic bands, buttons, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread, needles, elastic bands, buttons, and other items

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en: To make a living, Pedra B. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 60 years old, widowed and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of El Salvador, Misamis Oriental. Pedra has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Pedra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Pedra is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie T. is from the city of Aguada, Ozamiz City. He is 44 years old. Ronnie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ronnie owns and operates a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from motorcycle-transport services. Ronnie has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Ronnie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronnie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Ronnie from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong L., 60, is widowed and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnam Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She has a business of selling various kinds of groceries, which provides an income of about USD 7.13 per day.  L. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store.

In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua B. is divorced and has five dependents. She has a junior high school education. Ekua goes to Techiman in the Brong Ahafo Region to buy plantain, pear or avocado, cassava, banana and other food in bulk to sell at Akotokyire. Ekua uses the income she acquires from the sale of the food to educate, clothe and feed her dependents. Ekua will use the loan to purchase additional food to be able to supply most of the market women living within her area. With the new income from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional food to supply most of the market women living within her area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
Elvio tiene 23 años, es soltero, vive el barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Caacupe con sus padres. 
Es comerciante desde hace más de 4 años, se dedica a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante, realizando sus ventas y cobranzas en una motocicleta que adquirió gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación que le imprime a su actividad, cuenta con clientela formada con aproximadamente 100 clientes, quienes constantemente acuden a él para solicitarle algún tipo de prenda de vestir que está acorde a la moda ó el gusto de cada uno de ellos.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo renovar su stock para estar acorde a la estación entrante (otoño, invierno), entre otros productos para poder hacer frente a los numerosos pedidos que tenia.
texts.en:
Elvio is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the San Francisco neighborhood in the city of Caacupe. He has worked in retail trade for more than 4 years; he sells door-to-door, making his sales and collections using a motorcycle that he acquired through the effort and dedication that he has put into his business. He has a regular customer base of about 100 customers, who constantly look to him to request some type of garment that is in fashion or in accordance with their tastes. With the loans that he has taken from the Fundación Paraguaya, he was able to renew his inventory with garments appropriate for the coming season (fall, winter), and buy products to fill the numerous orders that he had.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy jackets, sweatshirts, pants, sweaters and other cold weather clothing

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario G. Ortiz cuenta con una vivienda que heredo de su padre el cual en vida les repartió a todos sus hijos. Ahora Mario ve que la casa esta un poco deteriorada por fuera, la tela ya esta un poco antigua la cual necesita arreglarla; es por ello que el pide el apoyo para que su vivienda este en mejores condiciones. Para poder Mario realizar su proyecto y vivir en una casa digna el necesita dinero para comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario G. Ortiz owns a house that he inherited from his father, which in life he shared with all of his children. Mario has noticed that the exterior of that house has deteriorated some. The plaster is a bit old which needs to be fixed. For this reason, he requests help to improve the condition of his house. To complete this project and live in a dignified house he needs money to pay for materials and labor.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Phelix

texts.en: Phelix I. is 27 years old, single and has two children aged three years and nine months old. His business is located at Khayega, a very busy market in Kakamega. He has been supplying milk to the shopkeepers, schools and local customers. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the large number of other people in the area doing the same kind of business as his. The customers are spoiled by the  choices. There are also some of his debtors who do not pay on time as per the agreement. However, he works very hard to keep her business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more general items to expand his business. He hopes to be a supplier of milk in the Western province. He describes himself as visionary, hardworking, and flexible.

loans.use: To buy more items to expand her business

loans.name: Manko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MANKO composé de (12) femmes a été formé depuis le 14/12/2008 au sortir de la formation du comité de gestion du Banc Villageois de TouB. Séras1 dont ledit groupe de solidarité fait partie.  Les membres du groupe sont du même quartier et ont longtemps travaillé ensemble depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont eu à mené beaucoup d'activités ensemble, elles font des tontines, des rencontres, etc. Ce qui justifie le nom du groupe "MANKO" qui signifie UNION. Ces femmes sont toutes mariées et mères au moins de 3 enfants, et leurs âges varient entre 30 et 55 ans. Les différentes activités pratiquées dans ce groupe sont l'embouche, la vente de bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois,la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide,et le petit commerce. Ce présent crédit leur permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises pour développer leurs activités ci-dessus. 

Yaye Rama B., à l'extrême gauche de la photo, voilée en bleu et mise en médaillon est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de savon, de l'encens, et de pagnes. Avec son nouveau prêt elle pourra développer et faire la promotion de son activité commerciale. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la nourriture et la santé.

nb. Binta Bâ n'étant pas bien visible sur la photo a été cochée comme absente.
texts.en:
The MANKO solidarity group, consisting of twelve (12) women, was formed on December 14, 2008 at the end of training by the management committee of the Banc Villageois of TouB. Seras1, to which the group belongs. The group members are from the same neighborhood and have been working side by side for many years. They are involved in a lot of activities together, including tontines, meetings, etc. This justifies the name chosen for the group, "Manko", which means UNION. All these women are married with at least three children, and their ages range from 30 to 55. The various activities of the group include livestock fattening, selling firewood and charcoal, processing and selling peanut oil, and small trade. This loan will allow them to stock up on supplies and develop these activities. Yaye Rama B. is in charge of the solidarity group. She appears at the extreme left of the picture, wearing a blue veil and shown in the inset. She is 50-years old, married and the mother of six children. She runs a small business selling soap, incense, and pagnes (colorful African cloth). Her new loan will allow her to develop and promote her commercial activities. Her goal is to increase her savings and contribute financially towards providing for the family’s needs such as food and healthcare. Note: Binta B. was marked as absent as she cannot be seen clearly on the picture.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and expand the solidarity group's commercial activities

loans.name: Roza's Group

texts.en:
Roza B., 56, is happy to be leading this wonderful group of borrowers located in Toktogul. The office in Toktogul recently started working with Kiva, so Roza’s Group is one of the first Kiva loans here. Roza is married with one 23-year-old son. Her son is a student and her husband works in the Registry Department of the state. Roza wants to use her loan to complete the construction of a store. She has already begun the process, but she needs more materials, and needs to hire help. Once the store is built, Roza plans to set up her business.

Roza has three partners:

Alchabu K., 42, is married and has two sons and a daughter—15, 10, and 6 respectively. All her children study at school. Four years ago Alchabu started selling convenience goods. At first, she had to rent a kiosk to sell her goods, but later on she was able to purchase it and expand her business. Her initial investment was 3000 soms and today she makes a profit of 5000 per month. She wants to use this loan to purchase more goods to increase the selection of goods at her kiosk. Alchabu dreams of opening a big store some day.

Seidimambet T., a widower, is 59 years old. He has one son and two daughters: 23, 21, and 13 respectively. Seidimambet’s work is to transport goods by carts carried by livestock, he also breeds livestock. Three years ago, with 5000 soms, Seidimambet purchased livestock for breeding—with that profit he bought a donkey then made a cart and began transporting goods in this way. Today he makes a 3000 monthly profit. With this loan Seidimambet plans to purchase more livestock for breeding, he wishes to increase the number of cattle he owns.

Member Batma T. is a 53-year-old married woman with one daughter and one son—both 21. Her children are students and her husband is retired—he often helps her breeding livestock. Batma’s principal job is working as a phone operator; she has been doing this for five years. Some time ago, Batma took out a loan in order to purchase livestock. With her profits, Batma was able to pay for her son’s university education. She would like to use this loan to buy more cattle so that she can make a larger profit and contribute to her son’s wedding.

loans.use: To complete the construction of a store

loans.name: Mary Saint

texts.en:
Mary Saint G. is from the village of Pagalungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 27 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Mary Saint owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing, shoes and bags in the local community. Mary Saint has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Mary Saint joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Saint has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Saint is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Mary Saint from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Lenny S. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Lenny is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lenny owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lenny has been engaged in her business for over 23 years. She hopes to improve her harvest the next time.

Lenny joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lenny is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lenny from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their house.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Fuerza Y Accion Group

texts.es: La Señora Mercedes es Presidenta del Banco Comunal "Fuerza y Accion", es conviviente y tiene tres hijos en el colegio. Hace un año que trabaja con Edaprospo y hace 6 que tiene un negocio de cosméticos, empezó con productos que ella tenía de varios catálogos y ahora tiene muchos más productos como: cremas, champú y diferentes tipos de cosméticos en general. Usará este crédito para comprar productos de belleza. Le gustaría seguir creciendo y obtener un monto más alto para ayudar a su familia, construir su casa y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives with her partner and has three children who are all in school. She has collaborated with Edaprospo for a year and she’s had a cosmetics business for six years. She started out with several products she had from various catalogues and now has many more products like: creams, shampoos and different kinds of cosmetics in general. She will use this loan to buy more beauty products. She would like to continue growing and to obtain a larger loan to help her family, build her house and help her children with their higher education expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Ada

texts.fr: Monsieur Ada N. habite dans la localité de Dalifort. Il est marié et âgé de 49 ans. Monsieur N. a choisi son activité de commerce de pièces détachées par amour et il  évolue  dans ce secteur depuis longtemps. Son activité consiste à acheter en gros les pièces détachées, à les stocker dans son magasin et à les revendre a ses clients chauffeurs. Il est membre de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 2 ans et il sollicite un crédit de 130 000 frs dans le but d’augmenter son fond de roulement. Ce financement pourra lui permettre de consolider ses gains financiers et de mieux prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Ada N. lives in the Dalifort area. He is 49 years old and married. Mr. N. chose to start a business selling spare parts because of his love for it, and he has developed his business in this field for a long time. His business consists of buying spare parts in bulk, stocking them in his store, and re-selling them to his driver clientele. He has been a member of the Dalifort local fund for 2 years, and he is seeking a loan of 130,000 F with the goal of increasing his working capital. This loan will allow him to consolidate his financial earnings and better provide for his family. prendre en charge sa famille.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Felipe de Jesús V. C. esta casado con la señora María Magdalena desde hace 7 años de los cuales surgieron 2 hijos que están en edad escolar y que aun dependen de su ellos. Felipe de Jesús desea construir una barda en la parte de atrás para protegerse de los robos y así tener a su familia segura, para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra. 
La esposa y el trabajan en maquiladora para poder cubrir los gastos de la familia para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Felipe de Jesús V. C. has been married to María Magdalena for 7 years.  They have two school age children in their care.

Felipe de Jesús wants to build a wall in the rear of his property to protect himself from robberies and keep his family safe.  To do so he needs to buy building materials and supplies and pay for labor costs.

Both he and his wife work in an assembly plant to meet family expenses and offer a better quality of life.

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos, es transportista publico de trufi inter-ciudad La Paz – El Alto; tiene tres hijos y vive en la casa propia en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de un motor y caja de transmisión para su vehiculo, pues necesita inmediatamente una reparación para seguir funcionando en optimas condiciones.

 Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y el primer vía Kiva. El estudio del flujo de caja le permite acceder a este primer crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, is a public transportation driver on the La Paz-El Alto inter-city route.  He has three children and lives in his own house in the neighborhood of Ciudadela Ferroviaria in the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to buy an engine and transmission for his vehicle and to also repair it.  He needs repairs immediately in order to keep the vehicle running in top condition.

This is his first loan with IMPRO and also with Kiva.  The study of cash flow allows him to access this first loan.

loans.use: To purchase an engine and transmission for a public transport vehicle.

loans.name: Muyurina Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Muyurina inicia su ciclo Nro 20 con 15 socias. Maria es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene una niña D. 2 años. Maria se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores como son cuyes, gallinas y chanchos, tambien realiza labores D. agricultura sembrando verduras como: col, lechugas, espinacas entre otros.
El préstamo que solicita Maria lo invertirá en la compra D. cebada para sus cuyes y afrecho para sus chanchos. Maria aprendió D. la crianza D. animales menores y siembra D. sus padres, ahora ella lo realiza independientemente con la ayuda D. su esposo, comercializa sus animales menores en los recreos D. Muyurina, los cuales tienen mucha demanda, las verduras que siembra las venD. en el mercado mayorista D. Nery García. Maria tiene en Finca 2 ciclos le gusta mucho las reuniones porque con ellas aprendió a ahorrar y trabajar. Su sueño es tener una granja D. cuyes y poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Muyurina communal bank is starting its 20th cycle with 15 members.  María, 28, is group President.  She is married and has a two-year-old daughter.  She raises guinea pigs, chickens and pigs and also farms vegetables like, cabbage, lettuce and spinach, among others.
