The loan that María is requesting will be used to buy barley for her guinea pigs and bran for her pigs.  María learned how to raise small farm animals and farming from her parents.  Now, she works independently with her husband’s help.  She sells her animals, which are in high demand, in Muyurina’s markets and she sells the vegetables she grows in the Nery García wholesale market.

María has been with Finca for two cycles and she enjoys the meetings very much because she has learned how to save and work in them.  Her dream is to have a guinea pig farm and to be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy barley and bran.

loans.name: Urbaba

texts.en: Urbaba R. is a 49 year old entrepreneur who has run her own business for the last four years. She is married and has three children. Urbaba currently has three head of cattle and wants to increase the number  to 5. She and her husband work together in the business. Urbaba has applied for a 1000 AZN loan in to purchase two more head of cattle.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (two cousins). Betty lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.   

Betty has a retail shop business. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Betty sells her products in a shop by retail means. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenge(s)for Betty includes thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to build more rental rooms.

Betty has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more boxes of soap, cartons of salt, bags of sugar and maize flour and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, bags of sugar, cartons of salt, bags of maize flour and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Guillermo Horacio

texts.en:
Guillermo is fifty-one years old. He lives in the district of Las Lomas in northern Peru. Las Lomas is a semi-tropical zone just a few hours away from the coastal desert in the province of Piura. It is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise animals. Guillermo is single. He lives in a home which he owns and shares with his older sister.

Guillermo raises sheep and cattle in corrals behind his home. He raises the sheep for their meat and sells them in the local markets, once they reach the appropriate size. The sheep meat serves as an important role in the nutrition of the local population and in the cultural traditions of Peru. Guillermo raises the cattle for milk. He sells the milk to the municipality.

In addition to his animals, Guilmero owns a hectare of land in the region which he inherited from his parents. He has a portion of the land planted with mature lime trees and another portion is planted with maracuya (a local fruit somewhat similar to the pomegranate which grows on a vine). He harvests the fruits regularly, selling them in local markets to wholesalers or to local factories.

This will be Guillermo’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to use the funds to purchase additional balanced feed for his animals. He hopes that the investment will improve the health of his animals and also improve their production.

loans.use: Purchase additional balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Duo Solidario Galilea Group

texts.es:
Duo solidario  GALILEA

SONIA CECILIA T. V..

ella tiene 22 años de edad es soltera,ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica, cortes, blusas, delantales etc. Su negocio lo realiza ambulante, en Su localidad Solicita el cedito para la compra de ropa tipica 

CRISTOBAL T. V..

tiene 55 años de edad tiene tres hijos, el se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica cortes,delantales,blusas, el vende su producto en su localidad tambien tiene un su terreno en donde cultiva café, su credito lo necesita para poder surtir su mercaderia, en compra de ropa tipica  , porque en esta epoca hay venta de su producto.
texts.en:
'Galilea' Solidarity Group

Sonia Cecilia T. V. is 22 years old, single, and sells traditional clothes, skirts, blouses, aprons, etc.  She carries out her business as an itinerant street vendor in her area.  She is requesting this loan to buy traditional clothes.

Cristobal T. V. is 55 years old and has three children.  He sells traditional clothes, skirts, aprons and blouses.  He sells his products in his area.  He also has a plot of land where he grows coffee.  He needs a loan so that he can stock his business with merchandise, buying traditional clothes, because he sells a lot of his products in this season.

loans.use: Traditional clothes

loans.name: Jaileth

texts.en: Jaileth B. is from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 22 years old. Jaileth is single and has an infant. To make a living, Jaileth runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste. Jaileth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Jaileth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jaileth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jaileth is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jaileth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for the preparation of juices

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a very supportive lady and a caring housewife. She stays at home and fulfills her household responsibilities efficiently. She has very good administrative abilities and handles the expenses of her home with great responsibility.  She also does embroidery part time for her neighborhood clients to help her husband financially.  She lives with her family in a three room brick house in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is the 2nd largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She has been living there in the area of Daata town for past 18 years. She is the mother of 2 sons and 4 daughters. Her sons work in a factory for a meager income and her daughters stay at home and help their mother in her household work. 

Her husband’s name is M. S., and he manufactures furniture to order. His furniture showroom is located in the market, and he has a good number of clients who give him good orders of furniture.  Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to further expand her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails and furniture polisher, etc., which will help him produce good quality furniture.  He will display it in his show room for selling. He has been in this business for the past 10 years, and Zahida is hopeful that, after the loan investment, his business will improve further and so will the living standard of the family as well. 

This is her 2nd loan application from Asasah.  In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy woods, nails and furniture polisher for furniture making business

loans.name: Concepcion's Group

texts.en:
Concepcion G. is from the village of San Luis, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43 years old and the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Concepcion is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $94 a month for these activities.

In 2006, she joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila sells women’s clothing at the central market in Nova Kahovka town. She has been in this business for five years. She’s got 7,000 hryvnias invested in inventory. Her monthly income is about 7,000 hryvnias. Ludmila enjoys her business very much and would like to develop it further. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 Ukrainian hryvnia to purchase inventory for the spring and summer seasons. She hopes to make additional income and invest most of it back into the business. Ludmila is married with two grown-up sons.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the spring and summer seasons.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar V. lives with her husband and children in Talin city. With joined family efforts they are engaged in agriculture, which generates the main income for the hard-working family. To improve her family’s living conditions, Gohar has started to make bread, doing night shifts at the local bakery. Gohar would like to grow the family business. With this loan, Gohar will be able to purchase cattle food and 6 heads of cattle.

loans.use: cattle food and 6 heads of cattle

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz M. is 53 years old. He lives in the village of Pshaveli, Kakheti Region. Teimuraz is married and lives with his wife, Leila, his mother, his 28-year-old son, his daughter-in-law and two grandchildren – a 7-year-old boy and a  5-year-old girl. The children go to school.

Sheep-breeding is the main source of income for the family. Teimuraz sells sheep's milk cheese, wool, and lambs. Also, the family has agricultural land with an area of 3 ha, where maize is grown. Along with the above-mentioned, Teimuraz in involved in another family business;  they sell flour locally. The total monthly income of the M.’s family amounts to 1200 Laris. 

Teimuraz requested a loan from Credo for plowing the land where maize will be sown. The other part of the loan will be used for purchasing feed for sheep. The increase in income will  contribute indirectly to the further expansion of their sheep-breeding business – earned income will be used to cover family daily expenses and Teimuraz won’t have to sell the lambs. This will expand the herd of sheep and thus the income received from sales of sheep cheese and wool will increase.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for land cultivation and feed for sheep.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es: Leonora tiene 34 años, es una mujer activa y trabajadora, vive en su propia vivienda junto a su pareja Filomeno de 36 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Nancy de 11 años y Maykol de 08 años de edad a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Leonora, es el cultivo café, cacao y palillo sobre tierras que compró con sus esfuerzos. Ella labra sus tierras con el apoyo de su pareja y de los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo, asimismo le ayudan a sacar la maleza de sus campos, así como se dedican a cosechar y trasladar los productos recolectados hasta las carreteras para luego ser llevados para su comercialización. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir con la plaga de insectos que se apoderan de los brotes de sus cultivos. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. Se siente muy contenta por ser socia de su banco comunal y aporta de si misma por el desarrollo de su grupo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Leonora is 34 years old and a very active, hard working woman.  She lives in her own home with her partner Filomeno, 36, and their two beloved children: Nancy, 11, and Maykol, 8.  They want to provide the children with a better quality of life.  

With much effort, Leonora bought land to cultivate coffee, cacao and make toothpicks.  She works her land with her partner’s help, and with the field workers who provide support.  They also help weed the land and gather harvests to the roads, so that they can then take them to market.  

Leonora has done this for fifteen years.  What she likes most about her work is the liberty that she has over the use of her labor, since she decides what is best for her crops.  What she considers most difficult is fighting the plague of insects that take over crop shoots.  But today, Leonora’s main priority is to buy new land so that she can expand.

This is her ninth loan with MFP.  She knows that she needs to be punctual in her payments and wants to access a subsequent loan.  She is very happy to be a part of her communal bank and contributes to the development of the group.  With the loan, she will purchase cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.use: buy cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en: Gerry is 41 years of age with five children. He is married to a farmer. They live at Baranggay Disimuray, Cauayan City, Isabela, Philippines. He earns approximately PHP 25,000 every cropping. He's been in his business for almost 30 years. He is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase fertilizers to supplement his corn farm. He will use his profits for their daily expenditures. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support his business to improve and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for his corn farm

loans.name: Kum

texts.en: Mrs. Kum is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of two school-aged children who have been living in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband are local farmers who have been planting a variety of crops for years. They normally work together in the fields growing rice, and they often succeed with good crops. Now Mrs. Kum needs money to buy a plot of fertile land to expand her farm, and has requested a loan of $700.

loans.use: to buy a plot of fertile land.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She also earns more income from fish and vegetable vending.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like pants, t-shirt, sandals, etc.

Leonora has been supplementing her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is a single man who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for his younger siblings. 

For the last two years, he has operated a spare parts shop. He sells retail to his neighbours and passersby. Calvin faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. He dreams of becoming a leading spare part dealer in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase motorcycle spare parts like spokes, tyres and oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts like spokes, tyres, and oil.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: El Señor Luis es cliente nuevo de la institución, el sr.  Fernando vive en la zona de chasqui pampa en la casa de sus padres, el tiene su movilidad y su terreno en Ovejuyo,  Luis trabaja en una línea de taxi trufis  desde hace cuatro años el es muy activo en el sindicato y sus compañeros lo conocen por ser muy colaborador el préstamo que esta solicitando es para la compra de llantas para  la movilidad ya que sus llantas ya están muy usadas y no quiere tener problemas en el transporte de sus pasajeros, es una persona joven y muy trabajador agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Luis is a new client of the institution.  He lives in the chasqui plains area in his parent's house.  He has his car and his land in Ovejuyo.  Luis drives on a taxi-trufi line (a fixed route taxi).  He has done this work for four years.  He is very active in the union, and his colleagues know him as being very cooperative.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase tires for his car since his tires are very used and he does not want to have problems transporting his passengers.  He is a young person and is very hard-working.  He is thankful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan, age 54, operates a clothes sales business in his town. He started this business in 2005. In addition, he runs a business trading plastic bowls and bottles. He collects used cans and bottles in bulk. He plans to obtain a large storage facility where he can load and store large quantities of cans and bottles. 

He is a diligent man who is planning to expand his business in the future. He says, "Because of insufficient collateral, I am having difficulty receiving loans from banks." He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more bottles and to increase his working capital.

Jargalsaihan lives with his wife in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. His wife is an inspector who works at a public organization. All of their children are grown and live separately.

loans.use: to purchase more bottles

loans.name: Hazel Grace

texts.en:
Hazel Grace is 22 years old and a single mother of one child.  She lives in Bliss Caipilan, Siquijor, Siquijor Province.  

Hazel Grace is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for just three months.  She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase feed and medicines for her pigs.

Hazel Grace has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for two months.  In the future, Hazel Grace hopes to help her family and support their basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for medicines and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru:
Кумри умная и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 6 детей. У них очень большая семья и им нужна дополнительный доход. По этой причине она начала заниматься купля продажей тканей и продовольственные товары. Она очень старается улучшить свою семейную жизнь и обучить своих детей на престижных школах и  университетах. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000$ США для покупки школьных униформ и канцтовары, потому что скоро начинается время учебы и все приготовится в школах. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Kumri is a smart and kind woman.  She is a married and loving mother of six children.  Because she has a very large family, she needs additional income.  This is why, she started to buy and sell fabrics and food products.  She tries hard to improve her family life and ensure that her children attend prestigious schools and universities.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of school uniforms and supplies because school year is about to start, and everyone is getting ready for school.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms and supplies

loans.name: Rogen

texts.en:
Rogen is 37 years old and married. He has 2 children aged 14 and 3.

Rogen is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He grows rice crops to sell. Rogen earns about 4800 PHP per month doing this farming. He plans to use his loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Rogen hopes to have a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement is a hardworking businessman aged 32. He is married and has three children who are still in school. He does photography to earn a living.  He also owns a barber shop which earns him extra income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business into wholesale. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a camera.

loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Naranbaatar is 31 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a house in the Hentii province of Mongolia. One daughter goes to school and the other one goes to kindergarten. His wife is unemployed. 

He started his business in 2009 by driving a taxi in the local town. He used to drive an old car. With his business profits, he purchased a Japanese car. He mainly goes for a taxi call service which brings him a quite sufficient amount of income. His income is the main financial source for this family. 

He is a diligent and open-minded man who says "I have many friends from my work. I feel good when people say 'Thank You' while getting out of the taxi." He is requesting a 1,000,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Sohoueto De Womey 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SOHOUETO DE WOMEY 2 est composé de dix huit personnes qui sont toute membre d'un ancien groupement et habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Antoinette Lydie est celle qui à la main levée sur la photo. Antoinette Lydie est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Philippe. Le couple à quatre enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Antoinette Lydie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Antoinette Lydie mène comme activité la vente des chaussures. A côté de cette activité, Antoinette Lydie prépare de la nourriture( pâte de riz préparée à vapeur)qu'elle vend au Bénin.Antoinette Lydie mène cette activité il y a deux ans environ. Antoinette Lydie s’approvisionne en chaussure et en riz dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Antoinette Lydie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO DE WOMEY 2,un premier crédit.
texts.en:
SOHOUETO DE WOMEY 2 Group is made up of eighteen persons, who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. They were all members of a previous group.

The group's representative, named Antoinette Lydie, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 40 years old and married to a welder named Philippe.

The couple has four school-attending children they still have to support. The children live together with their parents. Antoinette Lydie didn't attend school much.

To provide for herself and her children, she sells shoes. Besides, for about two years, she's been preparing food (steam-cooked rice pasta) and selling it in Benin.

Antoinette Lydie gets her rice supplies from one of Benin's markets. Eager to satisfy her customers and increase her revenue and income, she's seeking her first loan, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy shoes and rice

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus cuatro hijos de 16, 12,9 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, a los que quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en su casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Luz es la venta de plátanos, para lo cual a acondicionado una mesa en el frontis de su casa para expender esta fruta, pero en las tardes vende comida, para ello incluye una mesa mas grande donde pueda sentarse sus clientes. Lleva dedicándose a esta actividad durante cinco años, y nos comenta que son sus hijos quienes más la apoyan en este trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico, para apoyar a su pareja en los gastos de su hogar, por ello se siente cómoda y contenta. Por otro lado considera rentable la venta de comida y espera mas adelante ampliar su negocio y montar una bodega. Este sería el préstamo número diez con MFP, considera a las personas de su grupo amables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más ingredientes para la preparación de comidas como arroz, fideos, pollos, pescados, aceites, huevos, y también invertirá en la compra de plátanos .
texts.en:
Luz, 40, is a hardworking, enterprising woman living with her spouse and four children who are 16, 12, 9 and 2 years old respectively; she loves them very much.  They live together in a house that belongs to them.

Luz’s activity is banana sales.  She has a table in front of her house set up to sell this fruit.  However, in the evenings she sells food and for that she adds a larger table where her customers can sit down.  She’s been in this business for five years and she comments that her children are her best helpers.  What she enjoys about her work is that it produces income to help her spouse cover household expenses so she feels comfortable and happy about this.  On the other hand, she considers the sale of food to be profitable and hopes later on to expand the business and set up a grocery store.

This will be loan #10 with MFP.  She considers the members of her group to be kind and mutually supportive people.  She will use the requested amount to buy more ingredients to prepare her meals like rice, noodles, chicken, fish, oil and eggs and will also buy bananas.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food and also to buy bananas.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer lives in the Mombasa area of the Coastal Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. Two of the children are in school and the last one is too young for school. She was introduced to Milango by a friend last year.
 
Janeffer opened this business through the proceeds from a fast food business and has been in operation for four months. She intends to use the loan of KSH 50,000 to purchase two sewing machines to increase her operations.
 
Janeffer has learned that there usually occurs high sales during the December celebrations. She has given herself the ambitious target of establishing a tailoring school in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 27 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines.  Annaliza has a shop that sells dried fish and homemade sausages or longganisa, which she has been doing for three years. 

Annaliza is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of dried fish and raw ingredients for longganisa.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Annaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and raw ingredients for longganisa (homemade sausages).

loans.name: Wesakulila Shg Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Wesakulila SHG Group in Western Kenya! Fred is the facilitator of the Wesakulila SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Fred is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate his children and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Fred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Fred was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Fred will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gloria Beatriz

texts.es:
Gloria Beatriz tiene 26 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con la mamá y con  los hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.
Gloria se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 8 años. Las compras y las Ventas lo realiza en Ventanas y en Pueblo viejo. Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la siembra de maíz y compra de abonos agrícolas.
Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a comprar semillas. El sueño es poder tener una casa.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Gloria Beatriz is 26 years old, she is single and she has two children. She lives with her mom and children, who are 7 and 5 years old, in the Canón Ventanas province of Los Ríos.

She is a member of the communal bank Las Palmas, located in the the Campo Alegre area which is part of Cantón Baba. They carry out agricultural work.

Gloria has been working in agriculture and sowing corn for the past 8 years. She carries out the purchases and sales in Ventanas and in Pueblo Viejo. She is requesting the loan for sowing corn and to buy agricultural fertilizers. The loan will help her to buy seeds. Her dream is to have a house.

She hasn't encountered any problems. In her free time she likes working.

loans.use: to sow corn and to buy agricultural fertilizers.

loans.name: Urishboy

texts.ru: Уришбой отец шестерых детей, женат, ему 58 лет. Сам занимается откормом и продажей скота. А также имеет доход с воскресного базара, где перепродаёт скот. Сейчас у него 6 баранов , и на получаемый кредит он хочет купить два мешка корма для них. Он ответственный и пунктуальный клиент в «Арванде».
texts.en: Urishboy is a married 58-year-old man with six children.  He is engaged in livestock fattening and sales.  Urishboy also resells the livestock at a farmers market, which is an additional source of income for his family.  As of today, Urishboy has 6 sheep.  He wants to get a loan to buy two sacks of feed for his sheep.  Urishboy is known to be a responsible and punctual client at MDO Arvand, LLC.

loans.use: To buy feed for livestock

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Raising ducks is the primary source of income for Liza, a certified resident of Villa Salvador, Lapaz. She is 40 years old and is married with two children. As of now, Liza is requesting a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase baby ducks to raise for sale. She hopes that she can get the loan she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is a 28-year-old, married woman with one child. Her child is 7 years old.

To earn a living, she works as a farmer in Kitale, Kenya. She explains that she has been farming for four years and currently operates her farming business with the help of one farmhand. She grows maize, beans, and tomatoes to sell at the local market. She notes that price fluctuations in crops and high input costs are her primary business challenges.

Selly is requesting a loan in the amount of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says that the dairy cow will provide her family with milk for consumption and for re-sale purposes, and will thereby generate additional income to help meet her family's needs. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Grupo Zunilito Sector Campo Group

texts.es:
Iris es una mujer de 35 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre siete y dieciocho años, ellos viven en una comunidad de zunilito.
Iris (la primera del lado izquierdo) trabaja mucho para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, ella se dedica a la repostería profesional, con esta actividad lleva 4 años de dedicarse a esta labor, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación, pero también es vendedora ambulante de comida.
Iris con el afán de mejorar sus servicios hacia sus clientes a decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de moldes y bases para pasteles, pues la competencia casa día es más fuerte por esa razón ella debe ir mejorando la presentación de su producto. Su gran esperanza de vida es tener su propio local de negocio y que su negocio sea grandemente reconocido.

loans.use: Compra de moldes y bases para pasteles.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mrs. Mabel O. is a married woman with two children.  She is 38 years old and she lives in Benin city in Edo state of Nigeria. She acquired formal training for two years before she finally opened her own business in 2005. She plans to increase her business with the amount stated.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Sadat

texts.en: Sadat M. (employee pictured) owns a small stand at the local bazaar in the small town of Khachmaz, located in the Northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Sadat sells many different items at his stand: hair brushes, belts, radios, bags, clocks, toys and more. He would like to increase the quantity and variety of his inventory to include more items that people use in their daily lives in order to increase his daily sales.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children – her daughter is 13 and her son is only a year and a half old. She and her husband have run a vinyl window installation services business for six years. She gets about 50 orders a month. Every order can require up to 10 window installations. Currently, Irina and her husband make about $2,000 – 2,500 in net profit a month. 

Irina’s business is constantly growing. One of the advantages she has in the competitive windows market is her direct connection to vinyl window manufacturing companies. Her little office is very popular in the small town of Izyum. Irina can hardly handle the high demand she’s facing now.  

Irina realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business. Loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and expand her business. She would like to help more people make their homes comfortable and cozy , so she is requesting a loan for $500 to hire two more work crews who would help install vinyl windows and blinds. She believes this will not only help her business grow, but will also provide jobs for many unemployed people in her little town. Irina is hoping to use generated profit to buy a more spacious house for her family and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Bolívar

texts.es:
Description of the Business

Mr. Bolivar sells clothing in a mobile- informal way, he gives credit facilities to the people in the nearby towns from where he lives. This business started with his $150 dollars of his savings, from a store he had in his house. His sons help him out in the business and his wife sells typical dishes on the weekends.

Use of the Loan

He needs this loan because he wants to buy more products at bulk price and therefore have better prices for his clients. He also wants a store in his house so he can also show the products that he sells on the streets.

Personal Information

He is 57 years old, he has two children who go to school and he lives in a cement house, he lives in a stable family home. He main goal is that his business will provide for his children’s education and that he will have a peaceful old age.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Bolívar tiene un negocio de venta de ropa que vende de forma ambulante y a crédito en los pueblos cercanos a la cuidad donde el vive. Este negocio lo comenzó con la ayuda de sus ahorros productos de la tienda que puso en su casa. Con $150 dólares, además sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio y su esposa también trabaja vendiendo platos típicos los fines de semana

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito porque tiene el afán en comprar la mercadería a precio de mayorista y así tener mejores precios y buenos productos para sus clientes. Además ya ha adecuado un local en su domicilio para también tener en exposición los productos que expende en la calle

Información Personal

El tiene 57 años y dos hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurar la educación de sus hijos y tener una vejez tranquila

loans.use: Comprar mercaderia al por mayor

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria works in the creation of art textiles and sells them to the wholesalers who visit her community. In addition, she helps her husband selling flowers. She is 31 years old, has 3 children, and belongs to the group Estrellas 1 together with Mrs. Maria P. Gomez (artisan) and Mrs. Catalina P. Hernandez (artisan). They will pool together their loans and buy cloth in great quantities and also embroidering thread wholesale, and then they will share the materials, thus increasing their income on the sale of their artwork.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA , se dedica a la confección de prendas artesanales y las vende a los mayoristas que visitan su comunidad además apoya a su esposo en la venta de flores , ella tiene 31 años , 3 hijos , pertenece al grupo Estrellas 1 junto con doña María Pérez Gómez (artesana) y doña Catalina Pérez Hernández (artesana). Ellas juntaran sus préstamos y compraran telas por cantidades grandes y también hilos de bordar en el mayoreo y después se las repartirán entre ellas obteniendo de esta forma más ganancias al vender sus artesanías.

loans.use: Buying cloth and embroidering thread.

loans.name: Sadbargul

texts.ru:
Sadbargul K. is 41 years old, has a secondary education is married and has 4 children. Sadbargul has a sales point at one of the markets in Yavan, “Tichorat.” She sells wedding supplies, including ethnic wedding dresses and accessories. She will use the loan to purchase new products.

Sadbargul purchases products in Dushanbe from private manufacturers. She has been in this business for 9 years. Wedding season starts in the spring and those getting ready for weddings start purchasing items 3-4 months according to local custom. By purchasing products for sale, Sadbargul will provide a selection of wedding products for her clients in their own region. She plans to pay the loan back over an 8 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Комилова Садбаргул, возраст – 41 год, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Садбаргул имеет торговую точку на одном из рынков города Явана под названием «Тичорат». Вид товара который она продает это свадебные принадлежности, которые включают в себя национальные свадебные платья и аксессуары к ним. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый товар. Товар она приобретает в городе Душанбе у частных производителей. Данным видом деятельности клиентка занимается уже в течение 9 лет. Так как весной начинается пора свадеб, тот кто готовится к этому мероприятию начинают приобратать необходимые вещи для свадеб за 3-4 месяцев вперед, согласно национальным обычаем. Приобретя новый товар на полученный кредит для жителей данного района будет существовать выбор при покупке свадебнных принадлежностей, при этом не выезжая за пределы своего района. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product offering

loans.name: Fesuiaina

texts.en: Fesuiaina was born and grew up in rural area but married a man from and moved to Alaoa Apia. She is 25 years old and has one son.  Trying to learn the ways of town living is hard but Fesuiaina has to do something to earn money for her child and her family. She is applying for her first loan to buy seeds and other stuff for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Emin

texts.en: Emin, 40, is the mother of a daughter aged 7. Her husband, S., sells recyclable materials and earns about US$ 2 a day. So to earn some extra income for the family, Emin sells snacks such as biscuits, crispy chips, etc., earning about US$ 20 a week. She needs a loan of US$ 75 to add to her small business capital and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her small business capital

loans.name: Kyerinda East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth K.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feeds and bring more chicks. Ruth is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a veterinary assistant. She has 6 children and her children go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add in business Ruth has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Safina B., Jesca W. and Suzan N.. Safina B. has a business in beauty parlor and wants to buy more cosmetics, oils and lotions. Jesca W. is currently operating a business in coffee selling and wants a loan to increase capital. Suzan N. operates a business of beauty parlor and wants to boost business by purchasing a variety of cosmetics.

loans.use: To boost poultry business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick, a resident of Buyege in Kasanje, is a health worker at Buyege Health Center and has a 4-year-old poultry farm at home. He is 31 years old and married with 4 children, including 2 girls and 2 boys, and he cares for 5 of his other relatives. His wife has a salon in Buyege, and so his family is not doing very badly. He needs a loan to help partly with the expansion of his poultry building and partly with buying more chicks, since the previous loan helped with buying chicken mash and paying school fees for his children. His dream is to have as many as 1000 chickens, since he has enough space for expansion.

loans.use: Patrick intends to expand his poultry building to accommodate the chicks he will buy using this loan.

loans.name: Mema

texts.en:
Mema is 25 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 3 years old. Mema is a tailor and she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy another sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Poukdiwindé

texts.fr:
Mr. Poukdiwindé L. was born on 14 February 1969 in Dapaong, a city situated in the far north of Togo. He is married and has four (4) children. In 1998, he created an establishment selling spare parts in the Agoè region. This loan, his first, will allow him to stock up on car and motorcycle parts.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur L. Poukdiwindé est né le 14 février 1969 à Dapaong ville située à l’extrême nord du Togo. Il est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Depuis 1998 il a crée un établissement de vente de pièces détachées dans le quartier d’Agoè. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de s’approvisionner en pièces de véhicules et en pièces des engins à deux roues.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle and car parts to supply his shop, and make sure that he can meet his customer demands.

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en: Adama S. is 36 years old and married with 5 children. Adama and  her husband  own small stalls of used clothes in the town of Makeni.  Her husband assisted her in establishing the business 3 year ago and, with her previous loan from SMT, she diversified the business.  The other 4 goup members own small grocery shops in the same town. Adama S. is the group leader, and the members are requesting the loans in order to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stocks of used clothes and groceries

loans.name: Tiessiri (Courage) Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Tiessiri group are married women with an average of 42 years of age and 7 children. They live with their husbands and children in polygamous families in Djinina, a village in the Fana area (Koulikoro region in Mali). The Tiessiri group trades various items: peanuts, cowpea flour, gathering products (shea tree), eggs, etc. This group is made up of relatives, neighbors and friends and has borrowed together from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution for the past 3 years. This is their eighth group loan and all previous loans were refunded in time. The group members buy their peanut and cowpea supplies in Djinina and its surrounding villages. They each store their items in a joint store until they have sufficient quantities for sale. They usually carry out their cash sales on market days at the Fana and Marka coungo village stands to a mainly female customer base. For peanuts and cowpea supplies, their customers come to their village from many different areas such as Bamako, Koulikoro and Ségou. With this loan they would like to buy 120 kilogrammes of peanuts and 20 kilogrammes of cowpea, bought at an average costs of 275FCFA and resold at 375FCFA. This will allow them to attain an average monthly income of 20,000FCFA which will be help them build their businesses.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva translator

Les membres du groupe Tiessiri sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’age de 42 ans et 7 enfants .Elles vivent avec leurs maris et enfants dans des familles polygames à Djinina un village de la sous préfecture de Fana( Région de Koulikoro République du Mali) Le groupe Tiessiri fait le commerce d’articles divers : arachide, farine de niébé, produits de cueillette (zaban, karité) et des oeufs etc. Ce groupe constitué de consanguins de voisins et d’amies emprunte ensemble à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. IL est à son huitième prêt solidaire et a correctement remboursé tous les précédents. Les membres se ravitaillent à Djinina sur place et dans les villages environnants pour l’arachide et le niébé .Elles disposent chacune dans sa concession conjugale d’un magasin dans lequel elles entreposent jusqu'à avoir la quantité destinée à la vente. Elles effectuent leurs ventes (articles divers : cueillette, ramassage etc.) généralement les jours de foire sous les hangars destinés à leur village à Fana et à Marka coungo au comptant à une clientèle féminine. Pour l’arachide et le niébé des clients de provenances différentes : Bamako, Koulikoro, Ségou etc viennent s’approvisionner auprès d’elles jusqu’au niveau du village. Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter : 120 kilogrammes d’arachide et 20 kilogrammes de niébé acheté à un prix moyen de 275FCFA et revendus à 375FCFA dégage un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20000fcfa qui servira à essentiellement renforcer les activités.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma baji is a wife of N. A. and lives in a small city named Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this city with her family for the last 22 years. Her house is based in one room where she and two more family members live. Najma baji is a housewife but she makes thread and sells it in market to earn profit. Her husband has an electronics shop. Najma baji has one son, and he is 16 years old. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy electronic supplies (washing machines, stoves) to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Allah Rakhi baji and Sugran baji each want a loan to buy thread to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy embroidery material (thread, cloth, and needles).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods

loans.name: Stella Y.

texts.en: Stella Y. S. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Stella sells groceries like canned tomatoes, milk, soft drinks, and others at Elmina, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a trader. Stella uses her income to pay for utility bills and other family expenses. Stella will use the loan to purchase boxes of milk, Milo, bags of sugar, and other groceries. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella plans to invest in a building project she has started with her husband.

loans.use: Stella will use the loan to purchase boxes of milk, Milo, bags of sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mrs. Ry Phon's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of eleven people who all live in Da Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and Mrs. Ry P. is the village bank president who was selected by the members. She is a healer who cures patients in the local village. Since she now has a lot of patients, she does not have enough money to purchase more medicine for her patients so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sout, is a cow breeder who raises three cows. Mrs. Ry P. is 55 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Lan Y. does not come to take a loan but her husband is so he is presented in the picture.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: These people would like to improve their small businesses, such as by purchasing more medicine to cure patients.

loans.name: Bich

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Bích năm nay 33 tuổi, hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Thị Trấn Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương.Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Bích là chăn nuôi và buôn bán thịt lợn. Hàng ngày anh Lân chồng chị đi mua lợn về thịt còn chị Bích bán trực tiếp cho bà con tại chợ. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng lại đem về cho gia đình chị  nguồn thu nhập rất ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đình chị Bích cũng có rất nhiều thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tới chị dự định xin vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 7 con lợn thịt về chăn nuôi sau đó sẽ cung cấp thịt lợn cho bà con trong dịp Tết nguyên đán sắp tới.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Bich is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 children in the town of Ninh Giang, province of Hai Duong. Presently their main source of income is from raising pigs and selling their meat. Every day her husband, Mr. Lan, would go purchase the pigs, and she would sell the meat at the local market. The work is hard but it brings them a stable income. With their income of 183 USD per month, it helps her family in repaying the loans. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to buy additional 7 pigs to raise, and subsequently to sell their meat for the upcoming Tet Holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Javlonbek

texts.en: Javlonbek A. lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan where he was born in 1975.  With God's help he has become an excellent supplier of vegetables for his community.  He is responsible for four people (a wife and three children) and earns his family's living with his farming.  He knows all the ins and outs of this business, in which he has 5 years of experience.  His great trump is his production of vegetables in the off-season; however, in order to accomplish this, he needs investment for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni ($450 USD) so as to supply enough to meet the demand.  This will allow him to better provide for his family.  Let's help Javlonbek as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Yan Y. is a villager in Taing Bampong village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a hectare to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Duck Sok, is a breeder who raises cows and pigs. Since these two businesses are going well, he wants to expand them so Mrs. Yan Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow and three more pigs for her husband's business. Mrs. Yan Y. is 58 years old and the mother of a child who is a basket maker.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow and three more pigs for her husband's business.

loans.name: Kampala Road-Sharifa Namusoke Group

texts.en:
Sharifa N. (2nd right) is 38 years old. She has 3 years experience in snack-making. Sharifa is popular in Bombo town for her mouth-watering pancakes, samosas, and cassava chips. Her business earns her a profit margin of 20% of sales.

Sharifa needs a loan to purchase cassava, wheat flour, millet flour, peas, cooking oil, and charcoal. Her dream is to run a retail shop. She is married with 4 children, all of them in school. She therefore hopes to educate her children up through university.

loans.use: Purchase cassava, wheat flour, millet flour, peas, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Yean R., 66, is a widow who lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She grows and sells rice and earns approximately $4 every day. She receives some support from two of her childR. (pictured here). One is a farmer and the other is a garment factory worker. Mrs. Yean is asking for a loan to purchase a grinding machine. She will rent this mill as a service to the local farmers.

loans.use: grinding machine

loans.name: Bakhtawar  M. Ibrahim Group

texts.en:
Bakhtawar baji is a married woman and a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband is M. I. who has been running a CD shop in the market. People come to him to buy CDs. 

Bakhtawar baji is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her sons work in a factory on monthly wages. Her daughters stay at home and do household work. Bakhtawar baji is involved in a knitting business. She knits bed sheets and sofa covers and sells them in a cloth market and earns a profit. She saves her income in a committee and plans to marry off her elder daughter with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to buy more CDs for her husband’s CD shop. 

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy CDs for a CD shop

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Madame Fama F. est une vendeuse de petit déjeuner depuis plus de 10 ans au quartier Mbour 1 de Thiès Elle est marié, et voulant diversifier ses sources de revenues, elle sollicite ce prêt pour se lancer dans le commerce des body et des parfums et aussi renforcer son kiosque pour le petit déjeuner ou elle a une bonne et fidèle clientèle. Les revenues lui permettent de soutenir son mari sur les dépenses familiales.  Madame F. a déjà reçu deux crédits auprès de l’IMCEC et elle les a bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fama F. has been selling breakfast for more than 10 years in the Mbour 1 neighborhood of Thiès. She is married and, wishing to diversify her income sources, she is requesting this loan to begin a little business selling personal hygiene products and perfumes and also to reinforce her breakfast nook business where she has a good and faithful clientele. The income allows her to help her husband support the family. Mrs. F. has already received two loans from IMCEC, and she reimbursed them correctly.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: begin selling perfumes and bolster her breakfast nook business

loans.name: Erkin

texts.ru: Эркин Рузиева – женщина 44 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она наша давняя клиентка. Уже четыре года, как она у нас кредитуется. 4 года назад она начинала с уличной торговли возле школы. У нее был маленький столик, на котором она продавала несколько тетрадей разных видов и ручки. Сейчас у нее есть канцелярская лавка на рынке «Фаровон» города Гафурова. Товар ей привозит фирма, которая занимается импортом канцтоваров. В будущем Эркин планирует расширять бизнес, и открыть свой канцелярский магазин в центре города Гафурова.
texts.en:
Erkin R. is a 44 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 3 children. She is a long-term client. She has been a borrower for four years now. 4 years ago she started from street sales near a school. Erkin had a small table on which she sold several kinds of notebooks and pens. Now she has a school supply stall and the “Farovon” market in Gafurov. A firm that specializes in the import of school supplies brings her the products. In the future Erkin plans to grow her business and to open her own school supply store in the center of Gafurov.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of school supplies

loans.name: Bonotoy

texts.en:
Bonotoy A. is a very cheerful woman. Her parents previously traded cattle so she became involved in this business at a very early age. These days trading sheep is one of her family’s indispensable sources of income. Bonotoy also grows rice and different vegetables in her plot of land as another business activity. Together with her husband, who is also farmer, she is providing her dear four children with education and necessary foods thanks to her business ventures.

Bonotoy would like to have capital to invest in her sheep trade business and make enough profits to install basic services in her home. Bonotoy waits for your kind answer.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for sale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Mrs. Daisy B. D. has been a Paglaum member under the PDP-LP program for almost one year and one month. She resides at Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis, Occidental and is married to Romulo D.. She's in good standing and currently she's requesting her second loan for additional capital for her business, which is nipa vending. If it is God's will, she plans to buy her own boat that her husband will use in fishing. And for her family, she wishes that her children will able to finish their school through college.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Despite the hardships of life, Geraldine still believes that parents should be the best model for their children to follow someday. She and her husband sacrifice much so that their children may have a better future. Geraldine is married to Jose F. of Barangay San Leonardo in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya where they currently live. They belong to a poor family and were not able pursue a college education. Their two children are studying in the elementary school right now. Geraldine, with the help and support of her husband, is doing her best to give them enough support. 

She maintains a hog-raising business in their village in which she has a simple but powerful way to generate income. Her husband is a construction worker in their area. Geraldine is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders to further sustain and grow her business. She also hopes someday to establish a general store to generate a daily income aside from hog raising.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Promise Masika Topista Group

texts.en: M. Topista is a married business lady, aged 30-years, blessed with three children. The children all go to school. She has had a business of buying and selling palm oil for one year. She is using the loan to add capital and increase on her inventory of palm oil. She purchases the palm oil from Congo, to sell in Uganda. M. Topista is an active lady whose dream is to construct a residential house.

loans.use: To add capital and increase inventory of palm oil from Congo.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel A. is from the village of Bayabas, in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old. Rachel is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rachel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Rachel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rachel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the twelfth loan taken out by Rachel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kobada 4 De (Kobada Nokabougou) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOBADA 4 sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans,  4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de NOKABOUGOU,  commune de Tingolé, sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont en  partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un appui financier pour exercer leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont entre autres la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été remboursés correctement.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 21 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, Marka-Coungo et Fana, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group KOBADA 4 are married women who average 34 years of age and 4 children.  The women living for the most part in polygamous families in the village of NOKABOUGOU, in the community of Tingolé, sub-prefecture of FANA, (2nd administrative region of Mali). They are in a partnership with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work, which includes growing sorghum, peanuts, and beans.  They are on their fifth experience with the institution.  The past loans were correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor farm supplies and equipment and will cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 21 hectares. A portion of their production is for their own consumption.  The other portion is sold to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of Tingolé, Marka-Coungo, and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 40,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia H.  D. L. resiD. en Apopa municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Con 30 años D. edad Marta  es una mujer casada con Ramón quien trabaja como comerciante aportando a la familia $150.00 US, con ellos viven sus dos pequeños niños que se encuentran estudiando. Marta coopera con los gastos económicos D. la familia, hace cuatro años ella monto un pequeño puesto en una escuela donD. venD. pupusas, papas fritas, panes entre otros, las ventas D. Marta son seguras por poseer una clientela estable y ahora ha decido aumentar su producción ya que a veces no logra cubrir la demanda D. sus productos, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima que le permita elaborar mayor cantidad D. sus platillos.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 44-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Youssef has owned a shoe shop since 1994. He has requested a loan of 3,000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase the new shoe winter collection. This is the first time that Youssef has requested a loan.

Youssef is special in his work because he offers good quality and choice of shoes. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Youssef first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding by opening another shoe shop.

loans.use: To purchase the new shoe winter collection

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites runs a manicure and pedicure business. She also manages a small variety store for additional income. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5000 from Kiva. Marites works diligently so she can send her children to college. She is hoping to provide them with all their needs so that, some day, there will be greater possibilities for them to uplift themselves and their family.

Marites is a woman who has a strong fighting spirit. She never considers problems to conquer her life because she has a principle that says “If you let your worries conquer you, you will never win.” Marites is 34 years old and is married to Samuel L., who carves wood and assembles simple furniture that they purchase in their village.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Contact Group

texts.en:
Contact Group is a group of five borrowers led by Batu G.. She is 45 years old and the single mother of seven children aged 8 to 22 years old with educational levels of 4th through 12th grade. Batu is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in Banjour, a newly-built community for poor people who can't afford to buy town lots. It is situated in Virginia, north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Batu’s business is selling food ingredients. She buys food ingredients wholesale like salt, seasoning, bouillon cubes, onions, tomato paste, etc., and sells retail to the residents of Banjour. She has been running this business for three years and hopes to get into a used car business and become one of the biggest businesswomen in Liberia.

Everyone at Batu's business place sells the same goods and that makes for competition. To counter this, she parcels her goods in bigger quantities and differently from other vendors and she also gives her customers a good approach in order to get more customers.

Batu needs this loan in order to purchaS. new goods to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education to prepare them for the future.

loans.use: To buy new goods to improve her business

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Mariza C. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old and single. To make a living, Mariza owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. Her main source of income comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Mariza has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month.

In 2009, Mariza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Mariza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mariza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en: R. James is the leader of his lending group in Ntungamo. He is a hard working man, married with four children aged 12, 10, 7 & 4 years, all in primary school. James has been selling agricultural produce in Rwabashenyi Cell for 10 years and he is able to make 65,000/= profit a week. He sells mostly matooke and he is doing well because he has better yields now that he takes loans to improve them. He hopes to be able to make more profits from the same yields as well as being able to educate his children to the University level. James needs a loan to be able to improve his banana plantation by acquiring more manure and fertilizers for better output.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is fifty-five years old. She is married with nine children. Currently three of her children are in school.

Ama is a petty trader who trades in tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish etc. on top of table in the local market. She has been in this business for the past thirty years.

She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital. Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans to increased her stock and earn more income to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase yams, tomatoes, onions, maize and beans

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en:
Leatitia is 35 years old and is married with three children aged 3, 5 and 12 years. Leatitia and her family live in Ruhengeri, in the Northern Province of Rwanda, which is two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Leatitia has been in the business of selling Irish potatoes for the past year. Though she is new in this business, she is faring quite well and she employs two people from her community. Together, they work from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. every weekday.

Leatitia is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to buy more Irish potatoes for sale in order to make her business more competitive as well as satisfying the high demand for Irish potatoes from her customers. Through this expansion, she hopes to supply to larger markets than she was previously able to.

If this expansion succeeds, Leatitia will save funds and provide for the education and health of her three children.

loans.use: To purchase more Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 50 años, vive con el amor de su vida, Dina de 45 años, y con sus dos jóvenes hijos: Junior de 17 y Anthony de 15 años. Ellos habitan en su apacible casa (propia) en una bonita zona de la sierra del Perú.

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de pollo broaster -pollo frito embadurnado con harina- acompañado de papas fritas. La atención a sus clientes la realiza en su vivienda, implementando su sala para ello. Para esta actividad cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa en la preparación de los platillos y él administra el local y atiende a los comensales cada noche, sobretodo a la hora de mayor demanda, cuando las personas salen a pasear o regresan de trabajar.
La atención empieza a las 6 de la tarde y se extiende hasta la medianoche, Jesús dice que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad porque se dio cuenta que no había competencia en la zona y además era un negocio muy rentable y eso lo ratificó cuando obtuvo sus primeras ganancias.
Así empezó, y hasta el día de hoy siguen preparando sus exquisitos platillos y atendiendo amablemente a sus habituales clientes, quienes buscan los pollos fritos de Jesús por la calidad y cantidad que brindan.
Para el futuro tiene pensado ampliar su negocio para tener un mejor local  y sea el mejor de su zona.

Este es el sexto préstamo que él tiene con MFP y está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no le gustaría ser irresponsable; por el contrario, quiere seguir progresando como hasta ahora.
